loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Cristina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 50 years old.

Marilyn has a business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for resale.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Alicia is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTFto buy items for resale, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries, for her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for resale, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is 26 years old and she is married with two children. Her husband is a driver.

Irenia is running a fishing business, which helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy nets and repair boats. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. And she is happy with this loan because of the opportunity for poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy nets and repair boats.

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús ha sido un hombre muy emprendedor gran parte de su vida y desde hace 18 años está dedicado a la venta de bebidas, alcohol, frituras, dulces, entre otros. El posee una chaza donde ofrece todos estos productos.
Le gusta trabajar solo, pero en ocasiones su esposa le ayuda en el negocio.
Jesús solicita un crédito para comprar un televisor e instalarlo en su establecimiento, aprovechando la época del mundial de fútbol y atraer más clientes a su negocio; también comprara un surtido de productos más amplio para aumentar las ventas y generar mejores ingresos.
En estos momentos su desafío más grande es la falta de un documento oficial que le permita seguir realizando su labor, ya que solo tiene un acuerdo verbal con el municipio y considera que esto no es suficiente, pues en cualquier momento pueden cerrarle su negocio.
Este hombre trabajador tiene la meta de afianzar su negocio y crear fidelidad en sus clientes, considera que su forma de trabajo es el garante de que su negocio progresará.
texts.en:
Jesús has been a very enterprising man for a good part of his life. For the past 18 years, he has made his living selling drinks, alcohol, fried snacks, sweets, and other things. He has a small food stall where he sells all these products. He likes to work alone, but on occasion, his wife helps him in the business.

Jesús is applying for a loan to buy a television set and install it in his establishment, taking advantage of the World Cup soccer season to attract more customers to his business. He will also buy a wider assortment of products in order to increase his sales and generate better income.

At this time, his biggest challenge is the lack of a legal document that would allow him to continue working, since he only has a verbal agreement with the municipality. He does not think this is sufficient, because they could shut down his business at any time.

This hardworking man's goal is to secure his business and build loyalty among his customers. He believes that his work ethic will guarantee his business's success.

loans.use: to buy a television set to install in his business, and to stock a volume of products.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона милая и добрая девушка с города Исфара, ей 23 года. Фарзона еще не обзаведена семьей, и живет с матерью и старшим братом. Мать Фарзоны портниха. Еще с детства Фарзона наблюдала за работой матерью и интересовалась кройкой и шитьем. Когда она подросла стала помогать матери с заказами. Сейчас она самостоятельно занимается пошивом платьев и клиентки довольны ее услугой. Фарзона хочет обновить машинку. За счет кредита она собирается купить новую компьютерную швейную машинку. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Farzona is a sweet, kind 23-year-old girl from the city of Isfara. She is not tied down with a family yet, and lives with her mother and older brother. Her mother is a dress maker. Since childhood Farzona has watched her mother work and become interested in cutting and sewing. As she grew up she began helping her mother with orders. Now she sews dresses on her own and customers are happy with her work. Farzona wants to update her sewing machine. She plans to use the loan to buy a new computerized machine. She hopes for your financial support.

loans.use: get a new sewing machine for development of her work

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz, es una joven madre que tiene bajo su cargo a un hijo, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada que tiene gracias al apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda económicamente. Alba Luz  busca la manera de salir adelante por esta razón ella solicita el crédito para seguir invirtiendo con más productos de ropa así como materia prima para hacer pasteles y  comercializarlos, de este modo aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a young mother who has a child under her care. She makes a living selling new and used clothing in a business she has thanks to the support of her husband, who helps her financially. 

Alba Luz is looking for ways to get ahead, and for that reason she is requesting a loan to continue investing in more clothing products as well as supplies to make cakes and sell them. In this way, she will increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items, flip flops, and supplies for making cakes

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José de 63 años de edad,  no estudio; esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos; tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están acompañados; solo dos están solteros pero trabajan. Nadie mas vive con él, solamente su señora depende de él. 

El cliente trabaja la agricultura, cultiva maíz, maicillo y fríjol y lo ha hecho por muchos años, lo aprendió de su padre y decidió cultivar para tener granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia; además se dedica a trabajar con ganado bovino siempre se ha dedicado a estas actividades, la distancia a su lugar de trabajo esta como a 4 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta; se involucra la compañera de vida, dos hijas y un nieto. Su horario es variado.

 El cliente alquilara un terreno para trabajar la agricultura, el préstamo le ayudara porque tendrá seguro el terreno donde trabajara y así tener suficientes granos básicos y por lo tanto mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es tener el terreno para trabajar. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando para su familia; ya que con el préstamo se adquieren oportunidades para trabajar y así poder darles un mejor futuro a su familia; con sus ganancias va pagando el préstamo para quedar bien solvente con Credicampo y así que le siga prestando para seguir creciendo en su economía.
texts.en:
José, 63 years old, did not go to school. He is in a relationship, and his partner does domestic work. He has four children, two of whom are in relationships. Only two are single, but they work. Nobody else lives with him; only his missus depends on him.

The client works in agriculture. He plants corn, sorghum, and beans, and he has done this for many years. He learned it from his father, and decided to farm in order to have basic grains to feed his family. He also works in bovine ranching. He has always made his living in these activities.

His place of work is around 4 km from his house; he travels on foot or by wagon. His life partner, two daughters and a grandson are involved, and his work schedule varies.

The client will lease a plot of land to work in agriculture. The loan will help him because he will be able to secure the land where he will work, and thus have sufficient basic grains and improve his quality of life. The need that will be satisfied is having the land to work.

His dream is to continue working for his family, since with the loan he will get the opportunity to work and thus be able to give his family a better future. With his earnings, he will repay the loan so that he can remain solvent with Credicampo, so that they will continue loaning to him, and he can continue growing economically.

loans.use: to pay for the lease on the land where he will farm.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the fruits and vegetable business, Fatuma sells fish.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of fish for her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Marisol

texts.es: Claudia de 38 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también se dedica  a la venta de refrescos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar,  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna
texts.en:
Claudia is 38 years old and sells all types of personal use products such as lotions, deodorants, crèmes, shampoos, and other items. Her business is located in her home. She also sells soft drinks. With the income she earns from her sales, Claudia is able to help her husband with covering their household expenses. She lives in her own home along with her husband and three children.

Claudia wants to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy everything she needs. She has many customers because her products are affordably priced. This loan will help her to generate better earnings so that she can provide what her family needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, crèmes, shampoos, and other products.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
For the past two years Mbeyu, a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya, has operated a food stall, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread and beans. She sells to her neighbours and passersby, and cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With this loan, Mbeyu wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials used in making balls.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía es una mujer de 32 años de edad, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 14, 11 y 9 años de edad, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Ella comenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, eligió esta actividad porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar  ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos. A través de lo que realiza obtiene un buen ingreso que le ayuda aportar al sustento de su familia. 
Ahora ella ha tomada la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de hilo y tinta que servirá para la elaboración de este producto artesanal.
El sueño de Lucía es ampliar su negocio,  para que su producto se pueda distribuir a otros lugares, con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old, single and has three children aged 14, 11 and 9 years old.  She currently lives in the Suchitepequez region.

She is an enterprising woman struggling to raise her family. She is engaged in the manufacture and sale of traditional clothes.  She chose this activity because she did not have the opportunity to study because her parents were poor. Despite this she makes a good income that helps her support her family.

Now she has made the decision to request a loan of Q 3,500.00 for the purchase of yarn and dye which will be used to make these handmade goods.

Lucia's dream is to expand her business, so that her products can be distributed to other locations, with the aim of improving the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and dye to make traditional clothes.

loans.name: Anarkhol

texts.ru:
Анархол уроженка района Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она активно занимается животноводством. Ее муж и старший сын находятся в России, чтобы обеспечивать семью. А младший сын учится в институте, он студент. 
Анархол, чтобы помогать мужу в обеспечении семьи, год назад начала свой бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Она самостоятельно занимается этой деятельностью. Анархол в основном выращивает телят и бычков, продолжительность откорма скота составляет месяц, после чего она реализует скот на местном скотном рынке. За счет суммы кредита Анархол хочет увеличить поголовье скота, так как сейчас сезон для развития животноводческого дела.
texts.en: Anarkhol is native to the Shahrituz region. She is 40 years old. She is actively working in animal husbandry. Her husband and eldest son are in Russia in order to support the family. The younger son is a college student. One year ago Anarkhol began her own business buying and selling cattle in order to help her husband support the family. She does this on her own. Anarkhol mostly raises calves and young bulls. The feeding period lasts for a month, after which she sells the animals at the local market. Anarkhol plans to use the loan to expand her herd, since now is the season for developing livestock businesses.

loans.use: To buy calves and steers to expand her herd.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 55-year-old married mother of four from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She has been in the farming business for the past twelve years. She earns a monthly income of KES 12,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, after repaying her previous loans successfully. With the loan she has applied for from VisionFund Kenya, she will be able to purchase farm inputs and animal feeds. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standards of living of her family and buy food for the family. 

In the future, Lucy would like to expand her farming land. She hopes to become a prominent farmer in Thika.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feeds.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a lady of forty-nine years, married to Peter and a mother of five children. She runs a retail shop and a grocery shop in Marura on the outskirts of Kiambu. She has been in this business for nineteen years now and gets a monthly income of about fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Cecilia's first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to buy cooking oil, soap, sugar, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase cooking flour, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma, 51 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a fish pond in their backyard for almost ten years, earning a net income of about PHP 500 weekly. Her net income is usually spent on daily expenses in their home. Elma also has a vegetable garden near their fish pond for additional income. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase St.Peter's fish fingerlings for her fish pond. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase St.Peter's fish fingerlings for her fish pond.

loans.name: Persiperanza

texts.en:
Persiperanza, a 61-year-old widowed mother of one, has been raising livestock for five years in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more livestock and other supplies for her business.

Persiperanza is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ma. Shirley

texts.en:
Ma. Shirley is 40 years old and has two children. Ma. Shirley is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Shirley is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Shirley requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Shirley has been farming rice for 18 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Shirley would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
Diona is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diona is 43 years old and has four children who are in school.

Diona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Diona requested a PHP 22,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to resell.

Diona has been in this business for five years. In the future, Diona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to resell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan to purchase charcoal for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from fishing. Rosie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 45 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of goods to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising chickens. 

Luna aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 53-year-old Angeline from Harare. She is married with five children, one of whom is attending school. She also cares for her grandson. Angeline runs a manufacturing business producing balls. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenge faced is high demand which exceeds supply of balls. 

Angeline has requested a loan of $500 to purchase raw materials used in making the balls. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family. Angeline plans to own a shop which sells all sporting equipment in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Yessenia Marisela

texts.es:
Yessenia de 28 años de edad,  por sus escasos recursos económicos estudio hasta 6° grado ya que era  la mayor de 8 hermanos y tenía que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar.


Yessenia actualmente vende tortillas y lo ha hecho durante 10 años y lo aprendió de su madre, y ahora que su madre es mayor, es ella la que atiende la venta de tortillas, aparte de moler para vender comida típica por las tardes y le ayuda a su hija mayor, se levanta a las 4:00 am y a pesar que está en su casa le toca muy pesado.


Con el dinero del préstamo,  comprara maíz, ya que  su esposo solo sembró frijol, además comprara algunas láminas para el techo de su hogar.


Los sueños de Yessenia son ver crecer a sus hijas, poder darles el estudio que ella no tuvo para que tengan  una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, tener una vivienda digna, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y su esfuerzo lo lograra.
texts.en:
Yessenia, 28, went to school through sixth grade, due to her difficult economic situation. She is the oldest of eight siblings and she had to help her parents work.

Currently, Yessenia sells tortillas, as she has done for 10 years. She learned from her mother, and now that her mother is older, she is the one who attends to the tortilla sales. Apart from milling to sell typical food in the afternoon and helping her oldest daughter, she gets up at 4:00 a.m. Even though she works from home, it's very difficult for her.

With the money from this loan, she will buy corn, because her husband only plants beans. She will also buy some laminate for her roof.

Yessenia dreams of watching her daughters grow up. She wants to give them the education she didn't have, a better opportunity at jobs, and a good home. She knows that with God's help and her efforts, she will achieve this.

loans.use: to buy corn and some laminate for her roof.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 44-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk-selling with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk, while her husband sells door-to-door on a daily basis.

She has two daughters and three sons; three of them are school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet her everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. 

In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to carter to more customers. She expects a boost in her sales and profits alongside. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Mayte Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mayte Guadalupe es una clienta deKubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Mayte tiene 23 años, es soltera y se describe como una persona emprendedora y responsable, con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Hace 3 años y medio, inicio un proyecto que se ha convertido en una realidad, es un taller mecánico especializado en la reparación de frenos de aire, ella esta pidiendo el préstamo para invertir en herramientas y poder cubrir con las expectativas de sus clientes. Ella se considera muy buena pagadora ya que ha tenido algunos créditos y siempre los ha pagado puntualmente.
Para Mayte su principal logro es haber tenido el valoro de iniciar un negocio, ahora quiere hacerlo crecer y convertirlo en el mejor taller de su colonia.
texts.en:
Mayte Guadalupe is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

Mayte is 23 years old. She is single and is described as an entrepreneurial and responsible person, with the will to improve her quality of life. Three and a half years ago, she launched a project that has become a reality, a mechanic's workshop specializing in the repair of air brakes. She is applying for the loan to invest in tools and to be able to meet the expectations of her customers. She considers herself a good payer, since she has had several loans and she has always paid them on time.

For Mayte, her principal achievement is having had the courage to set up a business. Now she wants to make it grow and make it into the best workshop in her town.

loans.use: to buy tools for her brake repair workshop

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Zubida is a 49-year-old married woman. She is doing business selling milk for many years. She has four calves and one milk cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of profit. 

She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She is in her 4th loan cycle. 

Currently, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Tanvir

texts.en:
Tanvir is a 30-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been running a business of selling milk for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Tanvir has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Tanvir is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Marites aims to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income and support her husband in financing the education of their children. They want them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

To improve her business, Marites wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, canned goods, beverages, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell. Having patience and strong determination, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
To generate income, Ederlina engages in selling grocery items and in cooking and selling meals and snacks in the local community. She is 56 years old and blessed with four children. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to satisfy their daily necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to buy assorted grocery items, rice, fish, meat, vegetables and seasonings needed to cooking food to sell in the local community. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items, rice, fish, meat, vegetables and seasonings needed

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Charles and they are blessed with three children, aged 12, 10 and three years old.

She has been running her hair and beauty salon business for the last ten years. To enable her to buy some stocks of hair oil, chemicals, and hair extensions to resell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 8,000, and she intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. 

In the future, she hopes to open a hairdressing school.

loans.use: to buy some stocks of hair oil, chemicals, and hair extensions to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Olivia hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a buy-and-sell mangoes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers.

Wilma has been in this business for nine years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Elvira is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Pebrita

texts.en:
Pebrita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell mango business in the Philippines.

Pebrita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell.  She has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Pebrita would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old, married and has four children.  Three of her children are in school.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sarah has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Sarah would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 49 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Riza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like soft drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store. Riza has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items. 

Riza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like soft drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Precious Tutsirayi Tsitsi

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Precious Tutsirayi Tsitsi from Harare. She is married with three children, and two are attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Precious Tutsirayi Tsitsi runs a retail business selling kitchenware, clothing and hair products. The business has been in operation for 4 years. 

She says the main challenges faced are capital constraints and the general non-performing economy. Precious Tutsirayi Tsitsi has requested a loan of $400 to buy kitchenware and hair products to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enjoy increased profits which should translate to an improved lifestyle. 

In the near future Precious Tutsirayi Tsitsi plans to open another retail outlet in Mutare. She is very grateful to KIVA and Microking for helping her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and hair products for sale.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a mat and basket weaving business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of reeds and a tin of dye for her business.

loans.name: Dijana

texts.en:
Dijana is a mother of four children and married at 34 years old, living in a minority community with her family. She is a housewife, spending her time taking care of the house and children who are between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. (The picture is with the 2-year-old baby). 

Her husband is the main source of income for the family and is employed by an electrical company. However, the money that he generates is barely enough to meet their daily expenses and not enough to be able to address other issues such as renovating their bathroom, which is an urgent need. 

Dijana is now requesting a loan so that she can finally repair and renovate the bathroom. This loan will improve the health and sanitary conditions of their family and provide a better standard of living. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To repair and renovate the toilet

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José de 47 años de  edad, estudio el bachillerato, está casado  y su esposa se dedica a vender pan, sus tres hijos viven con él por lo que son  4 personas las que dependen de él.


José actualmente está prestando los servicios de seguridad privada en un negocio y lo ha hecho desde hace 10 años, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo debido a la escases de oportunidades, él antes fue soldado, durante 20 años. Viaja unos 10 kilómetros en bus de su casa al trabajo entra a las 8:00 am y sale a las 5.00 pm, por lo que llega a dormir a su casa.


El dinero del préstamo será para pagar algunas deudas que tiene, ayudar a su esposa para que invierta más en el pan y así obtener  mayores ganancias.


Los sueños de José son tener una vivienda mejor a la que ahora tiene, poder tener un vehículo para ya no viajar en bus, y poder darle todo lo necesario a su familia, está seguro que es mayor compromiso pero con la ayuda de Dios lo hará posible.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old. He completed high school. He is married, and his wife sells bread. Their three children live with him, so there are four people who depend on him.

José now provides private security services for a business, and he has done this for 10 years. He decided to do this work due to the scarcity of opportunities. Before this, he was a soldier for 20 years. He travels some 10 kilometers by bus from his home to his workplace. He begins at 8:00 am and leaves at 5:00 pm, so he comes home to sleep.

The money from the loan will be used to pay some debts that he has and to help his wife so that she can invest more in bread and thus obtain better earnings.

José's dreams are to have a better house than the one he now has, to be able to have a vehicle so that he doesn't need to travel by bus, and to be able to give everything necessary to his family.  He is certain that it is a big commitment, but with the help of God he will make it possible.

loans.use: to pay some debts that he has and to help his wife so that she can invest in more bread to sell.

loans.name: Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
Tomas de 43 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos no tuvo ningún grado de estudio, ya que fue el tercero de 5 hermanos y  sus padres no creían en el estudio; ellos decían que solo con el  trabajo se podia salir adelante,debido a su alta pobreza tenia que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, de los 3 hijos, 2 están viviendo con él y el otro, ya esta casado  por lo que dependen de él 2 personas.  


Tomas  trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho por toda su vida, ya que desde niño su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, a parte de trabajar en la agricultura , es empleado en un cañal, por lo que le genera un dinero extra al mes, entra a las 5 de la mañana al cañal y sale a las 11 de la mañana; luego solo almuerza y se traslada  cerca de 5 kilómetros en bicicleta hasta donde tiene su parcela de maíz para empezar a trabajar lo acompaña un hijo que es el que le ayuda, es difícil decir a que hora sale porque hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado sale hacia su casa.


El dinero del préstamo sera invertido en empezar a preparar las tierras donde va a trabajar, comprar los insumos que va a ocuparen dicho cultivo y comprar una vaca, cabe mencionar que ya tiene un dinero extra y con lo del préstamo complementara para lo que tiene pensado hacer este año.


Tomas sueña con tener una casa mejor a la que tiene en este momento, poder ayudar a sus hijos, tener un vehículo para transportar a su familia en algunos momentos de descanso, él sabe que es un reto muy grande pero con la ayuda de DIOS y con su esfuerzo lo podrá hacer posible, agradece por la confianza brindada y dice que solo así podrá salir adelante.
texts.en:
Tomas is 43 years old, has limited economic resources, and no education.  He was the third of five siblings and his parents did not believe in schooling. They believed that only through work could he get ahead. Because of their extreme poverty, he had to help his parents work.  He is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have three children, two of which are living with him and the other, already married, so he has two dependents.

Tomas works in agriculture and has done so all his life.  As a child, his father taught him to work in agriculture. Apart from farming, he works at a canal which generates extra money month. He goes at 5 in the morning to the canal and leaves at 11 am.  He has only lunch and then travels about five miles by bicycle to his corn crop to start work, accompanied by his son who helps him.  It's hard to tell what time he leaves as he works until he finishes doing what he needs done before going home.

The loan will be invested in preparing the land where he will work, buying the supplies he needs for his crop, and buying a cow.  It is worth mentioning that with the extra money he already has and loan it to complement, this is what he plans do this year.

Tomas dreams of having a better house than they have right now, to help his children, and to have a vehicle to transport his family in those few moments of rest. He knows it's a big challenge but with God's help and his effort, it may be possible.  He appreciates the trust in him and says that only this way can he get ahead.

loans.use: to prepare the land where he will work, buy the supplies for his crop, and buy a cow.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer casada de 26 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a su hija de 7 años de edad, quienes viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Ella es una mujer que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Ahora lleva 3 años de tener este negocio que hasta el momento ha sido bastante productivo, en cuanto a la generación de ingresos que le ha ayuda a la economía de su familia.
Ella ha observado que este negocio tiene una fuerte demando por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de productos de consumo diario para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
El sueño de Manuela es generar más ganancias, para que a largo plazo pueda contar con otro negocio y así mejorar su economía para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a married woman who is 26 years old. She currently lives together with her 7-year-old daughter in the Department of Suchitepequez. 

She is a woman who works hard to help her family get ahead. She comments that she currently operates a general store, which is located a few meters from her home. She has had this business for 3 years, and it has been quite productive up to now, generating income which has helped her family's economic situation. 

She has observed that this business has strong demand, and for that reason she is requesting a loan of Q 6,000.00 to buy basic staple products, so she can offer better service to her customers and thus increase her earnings. 

Manuela's dream is to generate more earnings, so that over the long term she will be able to open another business and thus improve her economic situation and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic staple products to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling milk. She also sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time, Shamim has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Shamim's husband is employed in a textile mill, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. 

Shamim is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan through Kashf Foundation to purchase two more buffaloes. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more buffaloes.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 29 years old and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

She feels better since applying for her first loan, and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as bags and traditional clothing. 

She is happy with TRM (Tuba RaiMetin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy bags and traditional clothing.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, 38 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has operated a vegetable vending business for almost fifteen years, earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. Marissa's daily income is usually spent on purchasing more vegetables to sell. She presently lacks capital to purchase additional vegetables, so she would like to take out  a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase string beans, onions, Chinese cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes and bottle gourds to sell. Marissa is hoping that her business will continue to become more progressive and more improved.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, onions, Chinese cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes and bottle gourds to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which is his main source of income, and he also farms. George started this business to look after his family and to pay school fees for his children. He has personal goals of educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. George's main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. He intends to use the loan to buy more stock, such as soap, crates of sodas and bags of sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as soap, crates of sodas and bags of sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Marigold

texts.en:
Marigold, 43 years old, is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 8 years, Marigold has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load). Marigold has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marigold has previously borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
Juana  de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, esta soltera y tiene tres hijos.


Desde  la edad de los 13 años ayudaba a su madre en la siembra de maíz. Es una persona trabajadora y ahora se gana la vida vendiendo tamales, de esa actividad dependen los ingresos.


El crédito será invertido para comprar semillas, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra, para sembrar 3,500 metros de maíz.


El sueño de Juana es tener una buena producción de maíz, a la ves seguir en el negocio de  venta de tamales, para lo cual, debe estar muy bien de salud, para ganarse el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Juana, 62, studied through second grade. She is single and has three children. She helped her mother plant corn beginning at age 13. She is a hard-working person, and now she makes a living selling tamales. Her income depends on this work. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and to pay for labor in order to sow 3,500 meters of corn. Juana´s dream is to have good corn production, and at the same time, continue with her work selling tamales, for which she must be in very good health in order to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and pay for labor, to sow 3,500 meters of corn.

loans.name: Eduin Alexander

texts.es: Eduin es un hombre de 33 años de edad que con la ayuda de un socio quien es un experimentado comerciante el cual identifico la demanda de los clientes del sector por un establecimiento donde sonaran música Salsa, monto un bar, el cual poco a poco iba cogiendo apogeo entre los habitantes del sector e incluso visitantes de otros barrios, pero Eduin tuvo que enfrentar un gran problema y es que su socio con el que nació corporalmente con el que estaba logrando grandes cosas lastimosamente falleció, Eduin muy afectado por esta situación que le toco vivir pues no era muy experimentado en el ámbito comercial decidió en honor a su compañero seguir con el establecimiento e incluso se hizo la promesa de que este iba a ser le local “ Boricua” más reconocido y rentable de la ciudad, razón por la cual solicita el crédito y es que con víspera al mundial que se nos avecina Eduin quiere hacer la compra de un televisor para lograr que el negocio luzca muy  atractivo y comprar mercancía comúnmente consumida por sus clientes.
texts.en: Eduin is a 33-year-old man who set up a bar, with the help of a partner with experience in business, who identified the demand among local customers for an establishment where they could listen to salsa music. The bar has been gradually gaining popularity among the local inhabitants, and has even attracted visitors from other neighborhoods, but Eduin has had to face a serious problem: the partner who was like a brother to him and with whom he had been achieving great things unfortunately passed away. Eduin was deeply affected by this unfortunate event, and although he was not very experienced in business, he decided to continue with the establishment in honor of his companion. He even promised himself that the bar, “Boricua,” would become the best recognized and most profitable in the city. For this reason he is requesting the loan, and in light of the upcoming World Cup, Eduin wants to purchase a television so that his business will appear very attractive, and he will also buy products frequently consumed by his customers.

loans.use: to buy a television and stock his business to make it more attractive.

loans.name: Ajvaz

texts.en:
Ajvaz is 25 years old, married and a new father of a baby just eight months old. He lives with his wife and their baby as well as his brother in the same house in a minority Ashali community. 

In order to earn a living, he is working as a painter and improving facades of buildings and homes. He also works with his brother to cut wood for heating and to sell to others for heating. Now, for the first time, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new wood cutting machine. This machine will allow him to be able to cut the wood more efficiently and effectively, making his job quicker and easier and increasing the amount of wood he can sell. 

He is very grateful for the opportunity, and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start his own painting business.

loans.use: to purchase a new wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es: Oscar tiene 24 años estudio licenciatura en enfermería y obstetricia en el Instituto Politecnico Nacional y actualmente trabaja en un Hospital, se dedica a la medicina hiperbólica. Esta casado,  su esposa también es enfermera y juntos aportan para los gastos del hogar. Oscar esta pidiendo un préstamo para remodelar su vivienda, dice que esta pidiendo el préstamo porque de otra forma se tardaría varios meses en juntar el dinero que necesita. El se considera una persona trabajadora, responsable y que al tener un trabajo estable puede asumir el compromiso de pago.
texts.en:
Oscar, 24, studied for a degree in nursing and obstetrics at the Instituto Politécnico Nacional (National Polytechnic Institute) and currently works in a hospital. He works in hyperbaric medicine. 

He is married, and his wife is also a nurse, and together they contribute to the paying of the home expenses. Oscar is requesting a loan to remodel his home. He states that he is asking for the loan because without it, it would take him several months to collect the money he needs. He considers himself a hard-working and responsible person, and since he has a stable job, he can assume the commitment to pay off his loan.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario  tiene 20 años él es protesista dental el tiene su taller donde realiza variedad de trabajos para sus clientes que en la mayoría son odontólogos , su taller  se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Antofagasta, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor Mario  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de equipos para realizar su trabajo como motores, horno y soplete, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de estas herramientas esenciales para su trabajo,  el señor Mario  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son continuar ampliando su actividad teniendo más clientes en el taller y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar su negocio, el señor Mario es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mario is 20 years old. He is a dental prosthetist. He has a workshop where he does a variety of work for his clients, the majority of whom are odontologists. His workshop is located in the Antofagasta area. 

This loan is his first loan cycle with this institution. Mario is going to use this loan for the purchase of equipment required to do his work, such as motors, an oven and a torch. The reason he is requesting this loan is because he lacks the cash for the purchase of these tools, which are essential to his work. 

Mario faces challenges in his business, such as continuing to expand his work by having more clients in the workshop, and he is going to use the profits to expand his business. Mario is a very hard-working person and he feels very thankful for the opportunity that he is being offered.

loans.use: to buy motors, an oven and a torch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothes to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 40 years old and has four school-aged children. She helps her husband to generate income by managing a small retail store within her community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Teresita needs to increase her income to support her children's education. To improve her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of dried fish, canned goods, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, beverages, soft drinks and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that her loan will help her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish, canned goods, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, beverages, soft drinks and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maribel Del Carmen

texts.es: Maribel del Carmen es una mujer de 41 años de edad, luchadora y empeñada en sacara adelante a sus último hijo de 17 años de edad, ya que el primero ya trabaja y es una persona independiente. Maribel labora como vendedora de servicio de rastra o molienda de oro, trabajo que le ha permitido salir adelante, aunque es un trabajo muy pesado y cansado. Ella solicita el crédito para mejorar las paredes de su casa que no están repelladas y lo necesitan, para lo cual es necesario invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento y arenilla.
texts.en: Maribel del Carmen is a 41-year old woman.  She is hard-working and determined to get her youngest son ahead; he is 17 years old.  Her eldest son lives independently and has his own job.  Maribel's job is selling farm equipment or grinders, which has allowed her to get ahead, even though the work is hard and tiring.  Maribel is requesting the loan to improve the walls in her house; they are not stuccoed and need to be so.  To get the project done, Maribel needs to invest in the purchase of construction materials, such as sand, cement and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like sand, cement and gravel.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en: Ma. Lorena, 43 years old, is married and has five children, two of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lorena has operated a basket weaving business in the Philippines for 5 years. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her basket weaving business

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jairo es un hombre ya maduro, experimentado en vivir una vida llena de tropiezos ya que como a muchos colombianos le toco forjar su camino con esfuerzo y sufrimiento dado que tiene muy claro que en ocasiones la vida no le sonríe a todos, pero tiene más claro que esta no es razón para decaerse dejarse llevar por la mala situación, pues su frase más celebre es de los peores momentos salen hombres inteligentes y es quizás una frase que carece de sentido, o que solo él entiende y la explica muy simplemente, lo único que quiere decir es que de las peores situaciones salen las soluciones más inteligentes y es así como se adentró en el mundo de los microcréditos, para iniciar su local de alquiler de entretenimiento concretamente un local donde los niños pueden ir a distraerse jugando videojuegos, negocio con el que ha logrado crecer y suplir todos sus gastos, de momento requiere una ayuda monetaria para realizar mantenimiento y adecuación del local, pues como con su primer microcrédito logro montarlo lo que busca es hacerlo atractivo y que tenga unos equipos que funcionen a cabalidad. El gran sueño de este hombre soltero es encontrar una pareja con la cual pueda atender el negocio codearse y crecer económicamente en un entorno familiar donde los principales valores sean el amor y el respeto
texts.en:
Jairo is a mature man who is experienced in living a life full of obstacles.  Like many Colombians, it falls to him to forge his path with effort and patience.  It is very clear to him that sometimes life does not smile on everyone.  However, it is clearer to him that this is no reason to lose heart and be taken over by the bad situation.  

His best-known phrase is that intelligent men come out of the worst moments.  Perhaps this sentence does not make sense, or only he understands it.  He explains it very simply.  The only thing it means to say is that the most intelligent solutions come from the worst situations.  That is how he got into the world of micro-finance.  He did it in order to start his place of renting entertainment.  It is a place where children are able to distract themselves by playing video games.  With the business he has managed to grow and to cover all of his expenses.

He now needs monetary help in order to maintain and adapt the place.  With his first loan he managed to set up the business.  What he is seeking is to make it attractive and so that it has equipment that functions optimally.

This single man’s big dream is to find a life partner with whom he is able to tend to the business and to grow financially in a family environment where the main values are love and respect.

loans.use: to provide maintenance, to repair, and to improve the equipment in his place.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  Jenita has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Jenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Yudi

texts.en:
Yudi runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Yudi is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Yudi began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Ana Elvia

texts.es: Ana es una comerciante que tenía su negocio ubicado en un sector residencial, pero por el gran afecto y preocupación que tiene hacia sus hijos decidió mudarse cerca de ellos, se dedica a la venta de mercancía como acondicionadores para el cabello, shampoo, desodorantes, ropa entre otras las cuales les vende ha amigas y personas de barrio, cabe aclarar su volumen de ventas no es muy grande siendo este su principal reto y amenaza para su establecimiento, este local es lo único que tiene la señora Ana para sustentarse pues nunca espero que nadie le regalara nada y más aún es una madre soltera y aunque sus hijos ya son mayores de edad estos tiene responsabilidades y la plata que en ocasiones le dan a su madre no le alcanza para cubrir todos su gastos, por esta razón Ana todos los días abre su negocio con la esperanza de que sus ventas mejores, solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía al por mayor, y así resurtir su negocio para hacerlo más atractivo, para que en el encuentre una mayor variedad de productos con el único anhelo y deseo de aumentar su flujo de caja y tener tal éxito que pueda generar empleo a personas que como ella el estado le negó un empleo por sus condiciones de salud y edad.
texts.en:
Ana is a business woman who's business is located in a residential area. For the great love and preoccupation she has for her children she decided to move to be close to them. She sells merchandise like hair conditioner, shampoo, deodorants, clothing, etc. She sells to friends and people in her neighborhood. She has come to realize that her volume of sales is low. This is the principal challenge and threat for her business.

Her store is the only way Ana has of supporting herself as nobody is giving her anything. She is a single mother and although her children are adults, they have their own responsibilities and the money they sometimes give her is not enough to cover her needs. So for this reason Ana every day opens her store with the hopes that her sales improve.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise wholesale to restock her store and make it more attractive. Also so customers can find a greater variety of products. She hopes to increase the money flowing into her purse and be successful enough to be able to hire people who like her are denied work due to age and health.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk to have more variety to offer.

loans.name: William Darío

texts.es:
El señor William es un veterano de 55 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos que se dedica al comercio ambulante precisamente a la venta de aguacates, guanábanas, limones y mangos. Inicio con su negocio hace 15 años de cuenta propia no tuvo enseñanza solo determinación y un gran don vender un producto con una sonrisa, pues tiene ese gran ventaja con su carisma y buen trato a sus clientes vende fácilmente su frutas, como todo vendedor de frutas o verduras se enfrenta anualmente a un problema, el clima y es que este es factor determinante en la venta y valor de sus productos que se ven gravemente afectados por este factor.
Solicita un apoyo monetario para comprar mercancía, para surtirse de productos para tener un buen apoyo y cantidad de frutas que vender en épocas de crisis y seguir con su sueño de vender productos atreves de sonrisas para llegar como el mismo dice “a viejo pero con salud”
texts.en:
Sr. William is a 55-year old man, the father of three children, who sells his wares in the streets, specifically avocados, soursop, lemons, and mangos. He started his business fifteen years ago with his own money and with no one to teach him, just determination and the skill of making sales with a smile on his face. As well as that great advantage. William has charisma and treats his customers properly. As a result he sells the fruit easily. 

Like all fruit and vegetable sellers, he has an annual problem: the weather. It determines both sales and value. The fruit is often seriously affected by weather.

William is seeking financial assistance to buy more fruit so that he has stock to sell in times of crisis. He wishes to continue his dream of happily selling the produce so that one day he will be “an old man, but a healthy one.”

loans.use: buy fruit so he has extra to sell in times of crisis

loans.name: Om Basm Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Basm and consists of five women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen, and have taken a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB. 

Amat Allah, 38 years old, is married and has two children, 2 and 5 years old. She studied until secondary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Amat Allah is the leader of the group. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living.  Amat Allah is an employee in the private sector and her salary is not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. She wants to improve the condition of her house by furnishing it and purchasing home appliances. She has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances for her house.

Amat Allah looks forward to opening a savings account in AMB and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances to improve the condition of her home

loans.name: Wawan

texts.en:
Wawan runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Wawan is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Wawan began working with Ruma six months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Imas

texts.en:
Imas runs a small stall where she sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Imas is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Imas began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years of age, a resident of Nabbingo and married with one child who attends school.  He also takes care of his family by providing them with the necessary basic needs.

David operates a retail shop, which is situated in Nabbingo town, mainly dealing in sales of household items such as sugar, soap, salt, bread and soft drinks, among other items.  His dream is to expand his business by buying more stock so as to satisfy his clients’ needs. For his family, his dream is to construct a decent house and provide the very best for the family. 

David is hardworking and self-motivated, according to his colleagues. He will use the loan to buy a more stock to sell in the retail shop. He thinks this will help him to meet his customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell in the retail shop.

loans.name: Bislim

texts.en:
Bislim has three grown sons who are married, and all of them live in a minority community of Kosovo. Bislim and his three sons have been working together for more than five years, providing taxi transportation services to others as a business and a way to earn money. They transport people as well as different types of goods and materials for others. 

Now, after five years, their van is damaged, and Bislim is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new van. This loan will help them to continue to provide transportation services and continue to make money for their families. A new van will also be more reliable and fuel-efficient, therefore costing less to drive around. It will provide for a safer mode of traveling for his customers. 

He promises to pay on time and is very grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a new van for taxi transportation.

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en:
Biljana is 35 years old, and lives with her husband and their four school age children in a minority community of Kosovo. She and her husband are involved in the agricultural business based on family tradition, planting different vegetables for their family consumption and to sell at a profit. They work hard to make a living, and her husband even works on the land of others for a fee in order to provide as much income as he can. 

Now they are requesting a loan in order to purchase seeds to cultivate their land. This would help them to be able to grow more vegetables and much healthier and better quality products as well. They hope that their vegetables will then increase in number, and provide a better income and therefore a better quality of life. 

Her goal is to be able to offer her children a better education. She wants to thank all of the lenders, and she promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to cultivate the land.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda comes from Tajikistan. She lives in a village. Mavluda is married, and is bringing up two children. Her husband is a kind man, who always has supported Mavluda. 

Mavluda has been busy with gardening for more than five years. She has a garden, where she grows apples and grapes. Mavluda’s family income is mainly from her business. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Mavluda wants to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay workers' wages, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay workers' wages. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay workers' wages.

loans.name: Amachuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMACHUMA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras (vestimenta de mujer boliviana), producción de papa, servicio de transporte, venta de leche, crianza de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años ya que ella conocía la técnica de costura y al observar el mercado que este comercio es muy rentable.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá en la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las compañeras de su grupo son cumplidas.

En la imagen se observa que una de las socias no se encuentra en la imagen, ella fue presurosamente a su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Amachuma” communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Elena is the president.  The members’ businesses are varied and include sewing traditional skirts (clothing worn by Bolivian women), potato production, transportation service, milk sales, and raising livestock.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Elena is a member.  She states that this is her first cycle being a part to Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from one of the institution’s representatives who visited her at her house.

She currently has a business of making and selling ‘polleras’ [the traditional skirts].  She says that she undertook this business on her own initiative several years ago.  She did this because she knew how to sew, and she observed that this business is very profitable in the market.

The loan is to increase capital (to buy fabric wholesale).  She will get the fabric in the city of La Paz.  After making the skirts she will sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes that her colleagues in the group are dependable.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, age 56, is married to a driver and is blessed with two children. She owns and operates a transportation business using a jeep (or "sarao," the name of transportation in the Philippines).  She has been in this business for almost ten years and earns a net income of 1,200 PHP a week. Delia and her husband help each other to earn more income for their family. Due to financial inadequacy, she would like to request a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their jeep. She's hoping that their business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: and her husband to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their jeep.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 4 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling firewood. 

Eugenia has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. Eugenia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 38 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to build a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 39-year-old farmer living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of them in school. Henry sells cocoa from his garden to people who come to his home looking for it. He has been in farming for ten years and wishes to buy a plot at the center of town to construct a store for  his cocoa. Seasonality changes and poor storage methods have affected the growth of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha, 27 years of age, is an Iraqi married youth client with four children. She works to support her husband with the family and their living expenses. Suha is a seamstress and has her own modest work shop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child by assisting her mother, who was also a seamstress.  In 2012, Suha started providing tailoring services from her house. She gained great experience in this field and she provides good quality with great prices.

Suha is requesting a youth loan of 1,500 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine. She believes that, with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. The most important is that she will be able to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine

loans.name: Shyhrete

texts.en:
Shyhrete is 45 years old, and has a 13-year-old daughter. While her husband works transporting children to school for a private company, she is working as a seamstress for a private company.  Both make very low salaries. She works very long hours, and has always hoped to open her own business. 

Shyhrete is now asking for a loan to purchase a new electric stove and dishwasher for their kitchen. The equipment she has is very old, and not working properly. 

She hopes that one day she can provide a better standard of living for her family, and thinks that eventually she will, once she can have her own company.

loans.use: to purchase a new electric stove and dishwasher for the kitchen

loans.name: Maricel

texts.es: Doña Maribel trabajo pro varios años en el sector privado como cajera, cuando quedo en embarazo, abandono esta profesión y se dedicó de lleno a su hijo como madre responsable que es. Al transcurrir el tiempo se vio en la necesidad de buscar alternativas para generar un ingreso en su hogar ya que los días continuaban y en su hogar hacía mucha falta los aportes que Maribel brindaba, al pasar el tiempo se le ocurrió una idea una amiga muy allegada de Maribel a quien el compra regularmente productos por catálogo le había comentado que el negocio era muy rentable y que con este podía mantenerse así misma y a su pequeño hijo y de esta manera Maribel comenzó la ventas por catalogo y gracias al flujo de personas que conoció por sus años como cajera sus ventas se vieron favorecidas e incursiono la venta de otras marcas e incluso ropa, su gran sueño es poder construir su casa propia una casa forjada por el sudor de su frente, una casa que todos los días refleje el esfuerzo, sufrimiento y sacrificio de una Maribel y es esta razón por la que solicita un apoyo crediticio, y es con la intención de comprar surtido parte de productos que están en promoción y otros por pedido especifico, para comenzar a construir la casa y ya tiene un gran paso tiene compro el terrero para formarla el sueño está cerca falta un pequeño empujón que se lo podemos dar para que esta mujer vea su sueño realizado gracias a su esfuerzo
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel worked for several years in the private sector as a cashier. When she became pregnant, she stopped that work and devoted herself full time to her son, as a good mother should. With the passage of time she saw the need to find other ways of earning a living as the family felt the lack of income that Maribel has been bringing in. 

A close friend from whom she bought items from a catalog told her that the business was very profitable, and she could earn money to support herself and her son. So Maribel started selling from a catalog. Thanks to the number of people she knew from her days as a cashier, she made lots of sales and began selling different items including clothing.
