Maribel’s great dream is to be able to build a house of her own, a house built from the sweat of her brow, a house that would reflect her hard work, suffering, and sacrifice. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy more stock that is on sale and other items that her customers have ordered. Then she will be able to build her house. She has already bought a piece of land, the first step towards achieving her dream. All that is missing is a gentle push in the right direction. 

We are able to help this hardworking woman achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy more stock so that she can generate funds to begin the construction of a house

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a thirty-one-year-old, hardworking, married man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns an electronics shop and salon as his main source of income alongside agriculture. He started this business ten years ago to earn a living and take good care of his family. 

He has personal goals of educating his children and owning a wholesale shop. His main hardships are stiff competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands.  

Samuel will use the loan to buy more screens and phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy more screens and phones to sell.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian tiene 30 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella dice que le gusta bailar, es muy hogareña y trabajadora. Tiene una sastrería desde hace 10 años, ella tiene unas maquinas de coser sencillas que le sirven para bordar y coser ropa sencilla, en ocasiones también maquilla ó confecciona trajes para escuelas. Ella dice que sus logros se deben a que sus padres toda la vida les han enseñado a trabajar este negocio. Christian esta pidiendo el crédito para comprar una maquina de coser, dice que tiene mucho trabajo y que las maquinas que tiene no le sirven para coser mezclilla.
En el futuro le gustaría tener una sastrería que este mejor localizada, tener maquinas industriales para poder maquilarle a muchas escuelas.
texts.en:
Christian is 30 years old, is married and has two children. She says that she likes to dance, and is a very home-loving and hard-working person. She has had a tailor´s shop for the last ten years. She has some simple sewing machines that allow her to embroider and sew simple clothing. On occasion, she also makes or manufactures school uniforms.

She says that her achievements are due to the fact that her parents taught her to work in this business her entire life. Christian is requesting the loan to buy a sewing machine. She says she has a lot of work, and that the machines that she has do not work for sewing denim. In the future, she would like to have a tailor´s shop that is better located, and to have industrial machines so that she can manufacture uniforms for many schools.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a specialized sewing machine to make sheeting and curtains

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia tiene 28 años y es casada con 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres y tubérculos al por mayor, en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, La señora Sonia vive en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La señora Sonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de verduras al por mayor y asi de esta manera surtir su puesto de venta,  La señora Sonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la cliente vende en ferias, lo que implica un constante traslado de mercadería y gasto monetario en transporte,  va a utilizar los beneficios  seguir comprando mercadería para surtir su negocio, para la venta de sus productos. Su deseo para su negocio es  mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 28 years old and is married and has 3 children. She sells vegetables and tubers wholesale in the different markets of the city of La Paz. Sonia lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood.

This is her first loan with the institution. She will use the loan to buy vegetables wholesale so she can stock her sales stand. Sonia has challenges in her business. One of them is that she sells in the markets which means a constant transfer of her goods and the money it costs to pay for the transport. She will use the profits to buy merchandise to stock her business so she can have product to sell. She hopes to improve the income from her business so she can provide her children a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is a responsible father, who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 42 years old, and has two  school age children. 

To provide the necessities to his family, he operates his motorcycle transport within his community to have an additional source of income. To continue using his motorcycle, he wants to avail himself of a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy needed spare parts and accessories for the maintenance of his motorcycle. 

Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to generate sufficient income and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy needed spare parts and accessories for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Hysnije

texts.en:
Hysnije lives in an Ashakli minority community of Kosovo with her husband and their 4 children. Currently neither she nor her husband are employed, as is the case for many of the people in her neighborhood, but they do earn money by renting out three shops that are attached to their house to others.

The rent they charge is very low and her husband continues to search for employment, but without any success. The home that she lives in is very old and they have not had a chance to save for any renovations, no matter how hard she tried. Now, she is requesting a loan in order to change the doors and windows so they can provide better living conditions for their family, a healthier environment, and protection from poor weather conditions. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to change the doors and windows in her home so she and her husband can have better living conditions.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Фирдавс живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Фирдавса также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Фирдавс занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Фирдавс подрабатывает мастером по ремонту и строительству домов. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Фирдавсу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Фирдавс хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Фирдавс очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Firdavs is a hardworking 29-year-old man with a positive attitude.  He is married and the father of one child.  This is the first time he is reaching out to MDO Arvand, and he decided to do so when he heard about the possibility of receiving financial support.  Firdavs lives with his family in a rural setting.  He never received a higher education, as his family was not in a position to send him to a university.  The same goes for Firdavs' wife, who did not receive an education either.  She works as a homemaker taking care of the household and raising their child. 

Firdavs supports his family by running his own business, which consists in fattening and selling cattle.  In addition to this activity, he also works as a repairman on construction sites.  He makes a good income from his business, and his wife helps him by selling the milk they obtain from their cattle.  Firdavs is now planning to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business.  With this goal in mind, he has contacted MDO Arvand and requested a loan to buy some cattle.  He is looking forward to a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, 44 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Mary Jean works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Mary Jean has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, rice, sardines and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is an Iraqi, married woman aged 46 years. She has two children, and she works to support her husband and the family with their living expenses.

Layla is a seamstress, and has her own modest workshop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child assisting her mother, who was a seamstress as well.  In 2008, she started providing tailoring services from her house to make a living. She has gained a great experience in this field, and she provides good qualitiy at great prices.

Layla is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy two specialized sewing machines. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits.  Most importantly,  she will be able to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two specialized sewing machines.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 43-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of five children

She has been running a business manufacturing clay pots for many years with the support of her husband. She makes various types and styles of clay pots. She generally uses a hand spinning tool to prepare her pots, which is a very time-consuming process. Now, she wants to buy an electric machine to increase productivity and quality. Therefore she is applying for a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. With this loan, she will also purchase a stock of good quality clay. 

She is a very good client, and pays back on time. She wants to introduce her products to nearby cities, which will ultimately help in generating more profits.

loans.use: to buy an electric spinning machine and a stock of good quality clay.

loans.name: Horonkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe HORONKANTIGUI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAFELA un village tout près de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme NAWA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  HORONKANTIGUI, fait la vente des charbons de bois et de bois de chauffe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  50 sacs de 100 kg de charbon de bois. Elle s’approvisionne à KAFELA et les villages environnants de KAFELA. La revente se fait à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The HORONKANTIGUI group is made up of nine married women who are, on average, 43 years old with five children each.  Most of these women live in traditional families in Kafela, a village which is very close to the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  Eager to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their 17th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Nawa (standing first from the left in the photo) sells charcoal and firewood.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 50 bags of charcoal, each bag weighing 100 kilos.  She buys her merchandise in Kafela and the surrounding villages.  She resells in Sikasso, to both men and women.  Her customers pay her in cash or on credit.  She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 26,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Bedrije

texts.en:
Bedrije is a grandmother living with her three sons and their families. Altogether, there are 10 people that live in the same house. 

Two of her sons are working currently, one in construction and one in a restaurant, providing for all of the family members. In the past, they owned a cow that they were using for milk and milk products for their family needs.  However, her husband needed an operation on his throat, and they had to sell the cow for the money to pay for the procedure. 

Bedrije is now requesting a loan in order to purchase a milk cow again to cut down on the family expenses and provide nutrition to them all. She is very happy to have the opportunity to own a cow again, knowing it provides for her family, and she enjoys taking care of it. 

Knowing that it is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Amar Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAR AZUL” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Yhadira es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, confección de usos, salón de belleza, venta de abarrotes, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Yhadira es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  salón de belleza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un instituto de la ciudad de El Alto, ya conocida la forma trabajo y con un pequeño ahorro decide emprender un espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cepillos y secadora) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Amar Azul" Communal Bank consists of eight members under a Board of Directors headed by Señora Yhadira. The members run businesses that  include weaving textiles, food sales, cosmetics sales, dressmaking, a grocery store, a beauty salon, and a taxi service. The Amar Azul Communal Bank is is about to start its fourteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and works with the organization's Andean Regional Office.  
 
The loan that Amar Azul is applying for will benefit small businesses, including Señora Yhadira's beauty salon. She states that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who was a member. Señora Yhadira learned cosmetology at an institute in the city of El Alto and, with a small amount of savings, opened her salon upon finishing this program of study. 

Señora Yhadira is applying for this loan to increase her working capital for the purchase of brushes and a dryer. She will purchase these items from wholesale suppliers in El Alto and then install the dryer in her salon. 

Señora Yhadira is married and the mother of three children. Her salon allows her to earn the income she needs to support her family. Asked what she likes about working with Pro Mujer, Señora Yhadira answers that the organization allows her to save and offers health care.

loans.use: to purchase brushes and dryers.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  ALBATOUROU debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  SOUTOURA, fait la vente des pagnes wax. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  20 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché pour la revendre au détail. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses marchandises. La revente se fait sur place et au  marché du quartier  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
Group Soutoura’s four members are married women. They are on average 48 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, in Mali’s third administrative region.

To meet customer demand, they are taking their fifteenth solidarity loan with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

Mrs. Albatourou, the second person standing from the right in this photo of group Soutoura's women, trades in wax clothing (wax is a local fabric). With her loan, she plans to purchase twenty pieces of wax fabric at the great market, and to retail them. She is very much in demand due to the quality of her wares. She resells at the general market and at her local market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and extends credits.

She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 30,000 XOF. Part of it will be used to reimburse the loan and pay interests, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: to buy Wax-type fabric.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a very sociable woman. She is from a rural area. Gulnora runs an animal husbandry business because she lives in an agricultural area and has a good opportunity to develop this business. Gulnora has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 11 years. She feeds milk cows. Gulnora sells milk and kefir to local people. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profits. With the profits, she wants to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en: Isabelita is 60 years of age, married and blessed with 10 children. She helps her husband gain income to sustain their daily needs and finance the schooling of her youngest child. She has owned and managed a small variety store in the local community for almost eight years. She would like to continue and improve this business to generate a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, frozen foods, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will make more improvements in the business as she continues to work hard and strive. .

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, cooking oil, frozen foods, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Gloria Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Gloria Elena se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria Eliana has a business selling food.  She makes a variety of dishes including baked chicken, soups, and sauteed meat.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and she already has 8 years of experience with this business, which is doing very well.  Gloria Eliana dreams of having her own restaurant.  She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

Gloria Eliana is happy to be receiving this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy products for her business, including rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 26-years-old.  He lives in Gaza with his wife. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it two years ago which helped him earn money and ensure the daily needs for his family.  Mohammad is requesting this youth loan to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business and he desires to use part of the profits on his children’s education in the future. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a display refrigerator and shelves.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married, 27-year-old businessman in Thika. He is married to Susan and together they are blessed with two children who are nine and three years old. Joseph operates a motorcycle transport business. He has operated this business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support himself and his family. 

This marks his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya after he was recently introduced by the VisionFund staff. With the loan he has applied for from VisionFund, he will be able to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. The additional income created will allow him to buy enough food for his family and repay his loan. In the future, Joseph would like to expand his motorcycle business. 

His hopes are to buy a public service vehicle and become an established businessman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 39 years old and married with four children.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Joan has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

Joan aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and materials for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 21 years now. She earns additional income from making dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and materials for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 57 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Genara works very hard to provide for them.

Genara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Genara has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Milagros has been raising cattle for two years and earns additional income from farming bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is a hardworking woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mdzara

texts.en: Mdzara appreciates for her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, wheat flour and potatoes for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, onions, tomatoes, wheat flour and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Walter Alonso

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre que siempre ha querido progresar y salir adelante, y su esposa es la motivación por la cual siempre ha deseado cumplir sus sueños.
A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confección en el sector donde vive, esto le ha permitido adquirir una gran experiencia y por esta razón decidió iniciar con su propio negocio hace ya un tiempo.
Tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones y trabaja en contratación con terceros.
Tiene grandes expectativas con su establecimiento y ha puesto todas sus esperanzas en este negocio. Él solicita un crédito para adquirir una máquina plana que en estos momentos considera que necesita.
Su mayor sueño es que su negocio se expanda y abarque una mayor parte del mercado, y esto solo lo logrará aumentando su capacidad de producción empleando las maquinas que requiere.
texts.en:
Walter is a man who has always wanted to progress and move forward. His wife is the reason that he has always wanted to make his dreams come true.

Throughout his life, he has worked in different dressmaking workshops, which is the industry he works in. This has allowed him to gain substancial experience, which is why he decided to start his own business awhile ago. He has a small workshop and works for third parties as a contractor.

He has high expectations for his establishment and he has put all his hopes into this business. He is requesting a loan to buy a flat machine, which he considers a necessity.

His biggest dream is to expand his business and enter a larger part of the market. He will only achieve this by increasing his production capacity by having the machines he needs.

loans.use: to buy a flat machine and increase his income.

loans.name: Kukiriza Nansana2 Group

texts.en:
Jane is married with two children.  She is a 30-year-old mother and a first time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd and a member of Kukiriza women’s group. She runs a retail shop in a trading centre in the city outskirts and she is borrowing a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to increase more stock in the retail shop for Easter season so that she can increase her sales and income. However, she also sells charcoal to her customers which increases her incomes since it’s of a high demand in her area. She wishes to borrow more loans from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd so she can increase her business to a wholesale shop in future. 

The sixth person at the extreme left is the Ugafode staff in charge of the group.

loans.use: To purchase items that she will sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the stairs of the house and renovate one of the rooms.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

Over time, Zubaida has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family’s income. Zubaida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow. It will allow her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Andrea Paola

texts.es:
El 15 de Julio nació una niña la cual la llamaron Andrea, la madre y el padre estaban muy contentos por la llegada. 
El tiempo fue pasando y la niña fue creciendo, llego la hora y el día de llevarla al jardín, al colegio, termino la primaria muy juiciosa y continuo con los estudios  hasta que termino el bachillerato, lo hizo con una hermosa hija, después de trabajar  decidió estudiar AUXILIAR EN SERVICIOS FARMACÉUTICOS para sacar a la hija adelante y poderle dar un mejor futuro y tomo la decisión de hacerlo en CAMPO ALTO  ya que tenia buenas referencias de esta institución.
Actualmente se encuentra estudiando y cursa segundo semestre y esta muy contenta  por todo lo aprendido y esperando terminar el Auxiliar para seguir con una carrera profesional.
Ella necesita del convenio con kiva, ya que es una persona que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas en el precio normal, además con los gastos que ella tiene el dinero es un poco escaso para todo lo que ella tiene que suplir.
texts.en:
Andrea was born on July 15, and her mother and father were very happy about her arrival.

As time passed, Andrea grew, and the time came for her to leave the nest—to college. She wisely finished primary school and continued school until earning a high school diploma. She did so with her beautiful daughter. After working, she decided to study as a pharmacy services assistant to move her daughter forward and be able to give her a better future. She decided to go to school in Campo Alto because this university had good references.

She is currently in school in her second semester. She's very happy about what she's learned and hopes to finish the program so she can have a professional career.

She needs the financing from Kiva because she doesn't have sufficient financial resources to make the standard payments. In addition to expenses she has, there is little money for everything she has to take care of.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 45 years old and the mother of three children. For many years, she has earned a living by weaving sweaters. She works hard on her weaving every day so that she can earn a living and provide for the food, health, and education of her children. Sajida is requesting her eighth loan from Kashf Foundation for 60,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of wool and threads in different colors. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy wool and different-colored threads.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 54-year-old married woman. She has five children. She has been manufacturing buckles, with the help of her son (also shown in the photo), for the past 12 years. They make beautiful buckles at home and then sell them in the local market. They have attained a regular list of customers and make enough to contribute in the family income. Hameeda's husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers Hameeda requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, sequins and pearls in various colors to increase production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, sequins and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Afira

texts.en: Afira is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a business selling animals. At present, she has five calves and two cows. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has become famous in her locality and earns enough to contribute to the family income. She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her eighth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Monsieur ALMOUDOU est né à DIANKE,marié, père de 4 filles il  réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à Médine un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur ALMOUDOU n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de trente ans à la couture auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atelier se situe au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu d’être le président du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) et des tissus d’homme afin de les revendre au comptant et à crédit aux tailleurs de Sikasso. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce septième prêt individuel auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Ce septième individuel lui permettra d’acheter 12 machines à coudre et accessoires et 20 complets tissus.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Mister Almoudou, born in Dianke, is married, and the father of four daughters. He lives with his wife and their children as a traditional family. They reside in Medine, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mister Almoudou did not get the opportunity to continue school, and instead was initiated into sewing by his uncle at a young age, over thirty years ago. His workshop is located in Sikasso’s great market. Most of his clientele is male, with many fair merchants. With such a long experience in his domain, he enjoys the complete trust from his profession, which earned him the presidency of the Surveillance Committee of the Sikasso Tailors’ Association (A.T.S.). In addition to tailoring, he purchases sewing machines in Lome (Republic of Togo) and men’s fabrics that he retails cash or credit to other Sikasso tailors.

In order to meet the ever-growing demand, he is requesting this seventh loan from micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This seventh individual loan will allow him to purchase twelve sewing machines and twenty pieces of fabric.

With this loan, he is planning on a monthly profit of 150,000 XOF. With the profit, he will pay for his personal expenses, contribute to the family’s expenses, pay the loan interests, and reinvest in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Rushangul

texts.ru:
Рушангул 34-летняя замужняя женщина, многодетная мать. У нее четверо сыновей и одна дочь. Рушангул и ее семья проживают в районе Восеъ. Муж занимается строительством. Трое старших сыновей учатся в средней школе, а младший сын и дочка еще маленькие.
На протяжении трех лет Рушангул занимается шитьем, она в основном принимает заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Эту деятельность она научилась у матери еще в юности. Рушангул шьет на старой ручной машинке, которая причиняет ей много неудобств. Рушангул берет кредит для того чтобы приобрести новую швейную машинку и ткани для шитья. Этот кредит ей важен для продолжения и расширения деятельности.
texts.en: Rushangul is 34 years old, married, and the mother of five children: fours sons and one daughter.  She and her family live in the Vose region of Tajikistan.  Her husband works in construction.  Her three older sons are in secondary school and her other two children are still very young.  Rushangul has been involved in sewing for the past three years.  She essentially receives orders and sews traditional Tajik dresses for women.  Rushangul learned this skill when she was young, from her mother.  However, she uses an old manual machine which gives her a lot of trouble.  She is taking a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and some fabrics.  This loan is important to her, as it will allow her to continue and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some fabrics.

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Don Mario es el único sustento de su familia, a la que mantiene gracias a su negocio de venta de ropa, tiene un hijo que cursa la universidad y su mayor anhelo es que culmine su profesión, su esposa lo apoya en los quehaceres del hogar. El solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio con productos atractivos para su clientela de esta manera salir siempre adelante con sus gastos primordiales.
texts.en:
Mario is the sole breadwinner of his family, which he supports through his business selling clothes.

He has a son studying in the university, and his greatest desire is that he finishes his profession. He helps his wife with the chores of the house.

He is asking for the loan to invest in the business with attractive products for his customers, in this way always getting ahead with his primary expenses.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a responsible woman. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is a teacher at a school. 

Dilafruz has been busy growing potatoes and wheat more than ten years. Her family is poor because their income is small. Their children have expenses that increase year after year. Dilafruz works hard on her land to earn a living. Now she needs financial support. She has no money to buy clothing for her children in the new spring season. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy clothes for her children in the spring season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her children in the spring season.

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr: Mawussi vit avec son conjoint architecte et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus les produits d'alimentation générale et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle fait sa toute première demande à WAGES. Elle espère à l'avenir réinvestir dans l'activité en agrandissant sa boutique et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Elle est âgée de 38ans avec une ancienneté de 16ans.
texts.en:
Mawussi lives in Lome with her architect spouse and their three children. Her revenue-generating activity is grocery retail. She procures her products from the great market in Lome.

To better meet client needs, she is requesting her very first loan from WAGES. In the future, she hopes to reinvest in her business by increasing the shop's size, and to guarantee her family’s food independence. She is 38 years old and has been in this business for sixteen years.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Seven years ago, Mavluda began her own business in order to support her family. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and her children are adults. She is the family's main breadwinner and earns her income by selling different kind of shawls to women. She renews her inventory of shawls at the beginning of every season, and does her work with help from her daughter-in-law. She is now buying goods for the new season and is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy variety of shawls to sell. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shawls.

loans.name: Ali

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PACHACUTEQ DE YANATILE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quebrada, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Ali tiene 27 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de madera,el socio vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de  madera.
El socio se siente agradecido por el  crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ali is a member of the Communal Bank “Pachacuteq de Yanatile” which is located in the District of Quebrada in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. He is 27 years old, single, and divides his time between his daily activities and his business of selling wood. Ali sells his products to his customers who requested them. He has been in this business for a long time and has done well because of the effort he puts forth each day into his work. Ali wants to continue working so that he can get ahead.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood. Ali appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of merchandise to sell at her counter.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: To earn additional income, Leonida cooks and sells pork and chicken barbecue to people who live in her her community. She has been in this business for almost 15 years and usually devotes her income to the education of her children and buying daily necessities for them. She aims to further improve her business so that she can increase her income. In order to do this, she needs to have more capital, which is why she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy various types of meat and seasonings. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of meat and seasonings.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44-year-old Miriam from Harare. She is married with one child who attends school. She also cares for two other dependants. Miriam runs a retail business selling clothing items for men, women and kids. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are limited access to working capital and a lack of variety in her products. Miriam has requested a loan of $500 to buy more stock of men and ladies' clothes for her business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to finish building her family house. In the future, Miriam plans to open more shops around town.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio, a 62-year-old widower, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 20 years, Antonio has had a fish vending business in the Philippines. He is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Antonio would like to save enough money to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is 38 years old, married and has earned a living for many years by selling bangles. She buys her bangles in wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the family's needs, which is why she started her own business. Hameedan has requested a loan for PKR 50,000 to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to sell to her customers. This will help her to increase her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest varieties of bangles in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 56 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marcos Cruz

texts.es: Marcos de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, sus clientes son los que trabajan con las mototaxi, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marcos esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Marcos is 41 years old and lives in his own home along with his family, which consists of his wife and their three children. His business is a paint and body shop that is located at his house. His customers are motorcycle taxi drivers and the income he earns from his repair jobs enables him to pay for some of his household expenses.

Marcos is requesting a loan in order to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other equipment so that he can continue his work. As a result, he will be able to generate more income so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other equipment.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 1999 dans un marché de la place, madame Pauline sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter de nouvelles pagnes afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. Son souhait est de voir son activité s'améliorer et assurer l'auto suffisance alimentaire de la famille. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 12 et 9ans scolarisés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline has retailed fabrics at a local market since 1999. She is requesting a first loan to buy new fabrics, to better satisfy her clients.

Her wish is to see her business improve enough to guarantee food independence for her family. She is married and the mother of two children. The children are twelve and nine and go to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El Señor  José tiene 46 años, él se dedica a al servicio de sauna, piscina y atención de snack,   brinda el servicio hace ya bastante tiempo tiene experiencia en el área, el atiende esto en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra en una avenida muy concurrida d la ciudad de santa cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  José  va a usar este préstamo para compra de mesas, sillas e insumos para la atención de su Snack,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de poder brindar un mejor servicio ya que tiene mucha clientela , el Señor  José enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida  de su familia y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar variedad de artículos que necesita para su negocio, el  Señor  José es una persona responsable se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Señor José is 46 years old. He offers sauna, swimming pool, and snack services. He has been offering these services for quite some time. He has experience in this area. He runs this business from his own house, which is on an avenue with a lot of traffic in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is his first one with this institution. Señor José is going to use this loan to buy tables, chairs, and supplies for his snack service. His reason for applying for this loan is the need to be able to offer better service, since he has many customers. Señor José faces challenges in his business, which are to improve his income and the quality of life of his family, and he is going to use the profits to buy a variety of articles that he needs for his business. Señor José is a responsible person. He feels happy for this opportunity that they offer him.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and supplies

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Гулсара. Ей 32 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Она развелась 8 лет назад и с тех пор живет с мамой. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 6 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 Сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Meet Gulsara, a kind woman, who is always trying to improve her living conditions while hoping for a better future.  Gulsara is 32 years old and needs some financial support.  She is divorced and does not have any children.  She separated from her husband eight years ago and has been living with her mom since then.  She lives in a rural setting which offers perfect conditions for the development of her animal husbandry business.  Gulsara has been raising livestock for more than six years and is very experienced in her field of work.  Because of the quality of her cattle, she now has her own loyal customers.  Gulsara wants to develop her business and make more money.  She plans to use her extra income to improve her living conditions.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy some cattle and increase her working capital.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa jeune femme est mariée et mère d'un enfant de 05ans. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des biscuits au marché et s'approvisionne au même lieu. Avec son troisième crédit, elle espère acheter plus de marchandises afin d'agrandir l'activité et aider sa famille à s'épanouir.
texts.en:
Yawa is a young married woman, and the mother of a five-year old. To provide for her family, she retails cookies at the market, where she also gets her supplies.

With her third loan, she is hoping to purchase more merchandise to grow her business and help her family be happy.

loans.use: to buy cookies and shoes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is the mother of eight children, one of whom currently attends school. She runs a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for the last six years. She has applied for a loan for 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more used clothes to sell. She sells her clothing door to door, and generates additional income from rental houses. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. In the future, Alice would like to have a permanent business premises and also become a wholesaler. Her family lives in a house which has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia vende galletas, dulces y gaseosas, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar galletas, dulces y gaseosas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Juana continues earning her living through a business selling treats. She sells cookies, sweets and soft drinks.

She's been working in this business for a number of years and it's going very well. Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is asking for the loan to buy cookies, sweets and soft drinks. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with payments of her share.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Erdenetogtoh

texts.en:
Erdenetogtoh is 44 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in their apartment in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Enhbat, helps his wife to run their family business, selling clothing at the local market. Her daughter, TSerenchunt, is 20 years old and is a freshman in the university. 

Erdenetogtoh has been running her clothing retail business at a rental counter of the local market since 1999. She has lot of regular customers. She is a hardworking, responsible and well-educated woman. She has good taste in the selection of her inventory and is well known among the clients with her good and friendly service. She is now requesting loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell at her rental counter in order to increase her family income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory from Erlian, China, to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Don Carmelo,  tiene 47 años de edad, es  casado, tiene  3 hijos y  viven  en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda y nueva como ser blusas, pantalones, camisetas, faldas, vestidos y otros. Anteriormente trabajaba en  la empresa privada  y al  quedar sin empleo estableció su negocio.  Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras para comprar ropa para esta época de verano como ser short,  trajes de baño, camisetas etc. para vender.  El tiene como meta seguir creciendo con su negocio vender variedad de  ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
Don Carmelo is 47 years old, married, and has three children. He and his family live in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

For the past three years, Carmelo has been selling new and secondhand clothes such as blouses, trousers, T-shirts, skirts, dresses, and other items. He previously worked at a private company, but he established this business when he lost his job. Carmelo is requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL in order to buy clothes for the summer season such as shorts, swimsuits, T-shirts, and other items to sell. His goal is to keep growing his business by selling a variety of clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the summer season such as shorts, swimsuits, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over time. 

Mukhtaran is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packages of salt, biscuits and beverages for sale at her store.

loans.name: Manzanitas De Tilacoca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS DE TILACOCA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, agricultura, compra y venta de estuco, tienda de barrio, venta de frutas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprende por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración los comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta presnete una de las socias por razones personales no participo en la imagen
texts.en:
The communal bank "Manzanitas de Tilacoca" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Rosa is the president. The businesses that the members of the group run are varied. Among them are: knitting sweaters, knitting blankets, agriculture, buying and selling stucco, neighborhood store, and selling fruit.

The loan that they will take out will benefit this little group of micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Rosa is a member. She indicates it is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, having entered at the invitation of an adviser from the institution who came to visit her in her home. At this time she has a business of knitting blankets. She lets it be known that she began this business on her own initiative a number of years ago.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy wool wholesale, which she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto, and later, after making her blankets, she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the credit that the institution offers.

In the picture, one of the members is not present because for personal reasons, she did not participate in the picture.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Flambeau De Petitanse Group

texts.fr:
Monise  est  la coordinatrice de son groupe Flambeau de Petitanse. Elle est   marie et elle a  3 enfant. Elle  habite dans la region nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l'éau portable est très limité. 

Monise dirige son commerce de produit divers  pendant  les 3 derniers années.  Elle va a acheter des cosmetiques, chaussures, vetement, etc. Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Elle était  commercant. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce

Des autres membres de Flambeau de Petitanse  ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produit cosmétiques, poisson, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, etc. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera a voyager dans les autres pays de l’amerique
texts.en:
Monise is the coordinator for the "Flambeau de Petitanse" group. She is married and has three children. She lives in the north of Haiti where electricity is rare and where drinkable water is very limited. 

For the past three years, Monise has been selling various items. She will buy cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc. Before starting her business, she was a shopkeeper. She hopes this loan will help her grow her business.

The other members of Flambeau de Petitanse need loans for selling cosmetics, fish, carbonated beverages, groceries, etc. She says her main goal is to have a larger business that will help her travel to other countries in the Americas.

loans.use: buy clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Дилбар 38 лет, проживает в районе Яван. Она заботливая жена и мать двоих детей. Сыну 20 лет, а дочери 3 годика. Муж и сын работают на стройке. С ними также живет мать Дилбар, она пенсионерка. 
Сама Дилбар занимается растениеводством. В течение год она при дворе дома сеет огородные культуры. Дилбар просит кредит для купли качественных семян овощей и минеральных удобрений. Благодаря кредиту она сможет во время провести посев. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilbar is 38 years old and she lives in the Yavan region of Tajikistan.  She is a caring wife and the mother of two children.  Her son is 20 and her daughter is just 3 years old.  Her husband and her son work in construction.  The family also includes Dilbar's mother who is retired and lives with them.

Dilbar is involved in agriculture.  Since last year she has been cultivating crops on her own plot of land.  She is requesting a loan to buy quality vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers.  This loan will allow her to sow on time.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy quality vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Tania Marcela

texts.es: Tania es una madre muy joven con tan solo 21 años de edad que se dedica atender un restaurante en su casa, todo los conocimientos de culinaria los aprendió por parte de su madre, y hoy en día atiende un humilde restaurante que quizás no sea el más vistoso pero según la carismática Tania es el que tiene le mejor sazón, debido a su corta edad Tania no tiene mucha experiencia y peor aún la violencia que ha azotado sus alrededores ha sido un factor en contra para crecer empresarialmente tanto así que llegaron a pensar en mudarse de su hogar y buscar nuevos horizontes, comenzar una vida de 0, pero la determinación y carácter de esta joven que muchas veces esta ausentes en muchas personas la llevo a seguir con su humilde negocio, ella cree que con trabajo y humildad se pueden lograr grandes cosas. Solicita una ayuda monetaria para adecuar su local pues su comida tiene buen sabor pero su negocio no tiene un buen impacto visual, este es su primer microcrédito y esperar lograr grandes resultados, su principal sueño es ver crecer a su hijo sano y que este nunca le llegue a faltar nada
texts.en:
Tania is a very young mother who is just 21 years old. She earns her living through a restaurant in her house. 

She learned everything she knows about cooking from her mother. Now, she runs a humble restaurant which may not be the most well-visited, but according to the charismatic Tania, it's the one with the best flavor.

Because of her young age, Tania does't have much experience. Worse still, the violence that has swept around her been a factor against business growth, so much so that she's thought about moving her home and looking for new horizons, starting a new life from zero.

However, the determination and character of this young woman, which is absent in many people, allowed her to continue with her humble business. She believes that with work and humility, it's possible to achieve great things.

She's asking for financial help to improve her premises, as her food tastes good but her business doesn't have a good visual impact. This is her first microloan and she hopes to achieve big results. Her main dream is to see her son grow up healthy and never lacking anything.

loans.use: to adapt the premises, as her business does not have a good visual impact.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno was born in 1972. She is married and has four children. Her husband, Inomjon, is a businessman. 

Barno began her own business of making and selling bags. She sells bags at a local market. Barno manages her business alone. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profits. She is going to improve the living conditions of her family using the profits from the business. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy raw materials for sewing bags. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for sewing bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
Tserendolgor is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in their apartment in Dundgovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Monh-Orgil, is very supportive of his wife and her business. Her son, Temuulen, is five years old and attends a local kindergarten. 

Tserendolgor started her clothing retail business in 2013. She has been attending university for her higher education and has just graduated. She has her regular clients and has been close with the suppliers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. She is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter at the local market. She is a hardworking, caring and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell at her rental counter at the local market.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana es una Humilde campesina que desde muy joven a estado dedicada a las actividades del campo tiene 50 años de edad y dos hijos, los ha logrado mantener gracias a la venta de pollos y huevos, los cuales los distribuye en pueblos cercanos, familiares y amigos quien se concientizan de la dura situación que ha vivido Ana y lo costoso que es mantener un hogar con unos humildes ingresos y es la preocupación de uno de estos familiares la que ayudo a convencer a la señora Ana de acudir a entidades crediticias para realizar un préstamo para la compra de pollos con el objetivo de  aumentar sus ganancias, esta dedicada mujer asiste sus pollos diariamente sin faltar un solo día deja de realizar actividades personales por estar al cuidado de sus animales ya que siempre se le ha descrito como una mujer luchadora y muy esmerada en sus labores, su único sueño es fortalecer día a día su actividad y darse una mejor calidad de vida tanto a ella como a sus hijos
texts.en: Ana is a humble farm woman who has done farm work since she was very young. She is 50 years old and has two children, whom she has managed to support thanks to the sale of chickens and eggs, which she distributes in the nearby towns, to relatives and friends who are aware of the hard situation in which Ana has lived and how costly it is to maintain a household with this lowly income. It is the concern of one of these relatives that helped to convince Señoar Ana to turn to the credit institution to obtain a loan for the purchase of chickens, with the goal of increasing her earnings. This dedicated woman tends to her chickens daily without missing a single day. She has stopped doing personal activities to care for her animals, since she has always been described as a hard-working woman who is conscientious in her work. Her only dream is to strengthen her business day by day and to realize a better quality of life, for herself as much as for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens to increase her income

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es una persona muy solitaria, su única compañía son sus pollos los cuales le han dado de comer estos últimos años pues se dedica a la venta y comercialización de estos. Su vida personal ha sido un caos ya que su único hijo ya es una persona madura que tiene sus propias obligaciones con su hogar y se separó con su esposo, toda la vida ha estado dedicada a este negocio. Hoy en día la vida le sonríen puesto que sus ventas mejoran, cada día  sus pollos son mas buscados por mas clientes por lo que puede darse el gusto de pensar en modificaciones y ampliar su negocio, solicita un ayuda crediticia para la compra de pollos y ampliación galpones, con lo que espera aumentar sus ventas y darse una mejor calidad de vida  y ante todo demostrar de que no importar cuanto la vida te golpee ya que puedes levantarte cuantas veces quieras y demostrarle a la vida que tu eres dueño de que tú puedes forjar tu camino, que todos nacimos con la herramienta necesaria para ser grandes en la vida
texts.en: Carmen is a woman of 53. She is a very solitary person. Her only companions are her chickens, which she has fed for these last few years, since her business is marketing and selling them. Her personal life has been a shambles, since her only son is already an adult who has his own obligations in his household, and she is separated from her husband. She has worked in this business all her life. Now life is smiling on her, since her sales are improving. Every day her chickens are more sought after by more customers, and for this reason she can indulge in thinking of modifications and expanding her business. She is applying for financial help to purchase chickens and expand her sheds, with which she hopes to increase her sales and give herself a better quality of life, and above all demonstrate that it doesn't matter how many blows life deals you, since you can get up as many times as you want and show life that you are the owner of what you can do and forge your path, that we are all born with the necessary tools to be great in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and expand her sheds to have a greater capacity.

loans.name: Ayshakan

texts.ru: Айшакан, 44 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей. На протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 20 000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Айшакан достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айшакан имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Также в наличии земельный надел 1,20 ГА на обработку и посадку дыни, огурцов и арбузов. Все члены семьи активно помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айшакан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян элитных сортов и на культивацию земли. Доходы от кредита Айшакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует купить скот для разведения.
texts.en: Ayshakan is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  For the past ten years she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture.  She started in this business with a capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she has greatly developed her farming business and her monthly income now comes close to 10,000 som (KGS).  She now owns four dairy cows and 10 sheep and also cultivates 1.2 hectare of land on which she grows melons, cucumbers and watermelons.  All the members of her family actively help her to run the farm. Eager to further develop her farming business, Ayshakan has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy mineral fertilizers as well as high quality seeds to cultivate her land.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her small business.  In the future she would also like to buy more cattle for breeding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and high quality seeds to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with six children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents and young sisters). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity.

Justine has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for nine years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market six days and sells wholesale only. 

Justine has requested for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Wayna Taucaray Iii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Wayna Taucaray III” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de tejidos, sogas, papel de escritorio, ropa, comestibles, frutas, verduras, cosméticos y otros brindan servicios de transportes y seguridad. 

Juana  nació en la provincia del Cusco, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en la venta papa, yuca, moraya y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de papas, yucas y moraya. (La socia Juana esta levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Wayna Taucaray III” in the city of Cusco. The members of this Communal Bank are individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children. The business activities of the members include selling items such as woven goods, rope, stationery, clothes, food, fruits, vegetables, cosmetics, and other products. A few other members provide transportation and security services.

Juana was born in Cusco Province. She is married and has five children. Juana has a small business where she sells potatoes, cassava, freeze dried potatoes, and other products. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of potatoes, cassava, and freeze dried potatoes. In the photo, Juana is the woman with her hand raised.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete their loan payments according to the established terms.

Cusco is located in the District and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is known as a tourist area where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, cassava, and freeze dried potatoes.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar is a 27-year-old married woman. She is doing business in decoration sales with the support of her husband. She offers a variety of wall hangings, glass paintings, etc. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. It will help her to purchase more decorating items, such as wall hangings, vases and wall mirrors. She hopes to increase her sales by offering a bigger selection to her customers. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more decorating items, such as wall hangings, vases and wall mirrors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling dressmaking supplies. She offers various colorful laces, buttons and ribbons to the people of her community and earns enough to lead a decent life. She is very experienced in her work and has attained a regular list of customers. 

Nasreen is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy more spools of thread, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs. With this loan, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces and ribbons.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business with her husband, selling milk in her community. Over the time, Sajida has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Currently, Sajida is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Cumbre Las Americas Group
