loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion jeans and trousers for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has been running a clothing business located in the market for five years, and works six days a week, and twelve hours a day. She also owns rentals for additional income. Rose started her business to look after her children. She now needs a loan to buy clothes to sell. 

Rose is a hardworking woman who hopes to expand her business. The main challenge she faces is competition.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, pepper, etc for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, meat, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Ebenezer is a group composed of eight women, all living in the same neighborhood and involved in different business activities. They are into the selling of noodles, underwear, cooking oil, vegetables, shirts, fish, second-hand clothing, provisions, bags and maize.

Henrietta is the featured borrower of this group. She is 25 years old, married, and a mother of one. She can be seen in the photo standing at the far right. She assists her husband in managing the household expenses and school fees for their child, who is 8 years old. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase underwear and noodles from the market to sell to customers. She begins working every day at 8 a.m. and finishes at 5 p.m. She hopes to earn enough revenue in order to further diversify her activity and improve the living conditions of her family.

Together with her friends, she will need a total amount of 3,200 GHS (Ghana cedis) to serve customers better.

loans.use: to purchase underwear and noodles from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is a thirty-seven-year-old single female living in Kasese, Uganda with four children, all of whom go to school. She has been in the business of selling beer and soda for four years and works twelve hours a day. It is located on a busy street and she has rentals for additional income. Night started the business to have a better life for her children, being a single mother. She hopes to construct a residential house despite the challenge of inadequate capital.

She needs the loan facility to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия жизнерадостная и доброжелательная женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Зулфия очень любит свою семью, в особенности своих детей. Она старается со своим мужем трудиться, чтобы зарабатывать деньги на удовлетворение всех имеющихся нужд семьи. Она хочет, чтобы её дети получили хорошее образование и стали образованными людьми. 

Сама Зулфия работает в швейном цехе, она сама швея. Этой профессии она выучилась в юности и знает все тонкости данной работы. Мужа Зулфии находится на заработках за пределами страны. Он также посылает каждый месяц денежные средства своей семье. Но сейчас старший сын Зулфии тоже хочет поехать к своему отцу, чтобы помогать ему в работе и зарабатывать больше денег. Для этого ему нужно купить билет и всё необходимое для поездки. Поэтому Зулфия обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку билета для своего сына. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a cheerful and friendly woman of 47.  She is married and has three children.  Zulfiya loves her family very much, especially her children.  She and her husband work and save money to provide for all of the needs of their family.  She wants her children to get a good education and become educated people.  Zulfiya works as a seamstress in a sewing shop.  She learned this profession when she was young and knows all of the intricacies of this work.  Zulfiya's husband works abroad, and sends money home to his family every month.  Zulfiya's eldest son now wants to travel to his father to help him in his work and to earn more money.  For this to happen he needs to purchase a ticket and all other necessities for the trip.  Zulfiya thus turned to Arvand and is hoping to receive a loan to buy a ticket for her son.  She is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy a ticket

loans.name: Karundo Bagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Olive is 38 years old, and is a member of Karundo Bagambakamu group. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, and has four children, three of whom are of school going age. 

Olive operates a salon business, specialising in ladies hair dressing, and has been in operation since 2006, in the area of Nyabuswa. She started this business to help supplement her family income. Seasonal customers and changes affect her business productivity. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy braids for the salon ahead of the Easter season.

She wishes to have her children attain higher education levels.

loans.use: to buy braids for the salon ahead of the Easter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, pepper, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гульмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 2 теленка и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота и дальнейшей его реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 44 years old, married, and, together with her husband, is raising 3 children.  Gulmira has a secondary education.  Her work in animal husbandry, beginning 10 years ago with the purchase of a single cow, serves as the main source of income for her family.  Thanks to Gulmira's hard work and dedication, she now has 3 milk cows, 1 steer, 2 calves, and 15 sheep.  Her monthly income is 20,000 KGS.  WIth the goal of expanding her business, Gulmira turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 120,000 KGS to purchase sheep for breeding and for eventually sale.  With the income from the loan Gulmira plans to save towards increasing the number of cattle in her herd, and hopes to save towards home repairs.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Zyinabu

texts.ru: Зыйнабу 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Зыйнабу - среднее образование. По характеру она очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Зыйнабу занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, упорному труду и нацеленности на результат, в хозяйстве Зыйнабу на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок и 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зыйнабу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец, часть средств планирует потратить на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки, скот будет находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Зыйнабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на покупку автомобиля и постройку дома.
texts.en: Zyinabu is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising 3 children.  Zyinabu has a secondary education.  She is very responsible, social, and cheerful.  Zyinabu and her husband started working in animal husbandry 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS.  Thanks to dedication, hard work, and a focus on goals, Zyinabu now has 1 milk cow, 1 calf, and 5 sheep.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Zyinabu turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep.  She also plans to use part of the loan to buy a calf for breeding.  With the income from the loan Kyinabu plans to save towards further increasing the size of her herd, and hopes to save towards purchasing a car and building a house.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Nuriza

texts.ru: Нуризе 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей школьного возраста. Главной ценностью своей жизни считает благополучие своей семьи и детей.  В 2005 году начала бизнес в торговле женской одеждой, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Нуриза имеет среднемесячный доход, в среднем 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Нуриза смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своей деятельности, Нуриза обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота, а именно покупку одежды. Доходы от кредита Нуриза планирует вложить в расширение площади ее магазина и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Nuriza is 35 years old, married, and is raising two school-aged children.  She considers the well-being of her family and children to be of the highest value in her life.  In 2005, with a starting capital of 25,000 KGS, she began a business selling women's clothing.  Because of her ability to develop her business and gain loyal customers, Nuriza has an average monthly income of about 30,000 KGS.  Thanks to Nuriza's hard work in her business, she was able to increase turnover and grow her business.  With the goal of further increasing and expanding her business, Nuriza turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 80,000 KGS to increase business, and in particular to buy clothing.  With the income from the loan, Nuriza plans to invest in increasing the size of her store and save towards her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, salt, onion, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар, 32 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. У Чынар - среднее образование, она знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынар на протяжении 14 лет занимается животноводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 20 овец и 2 лошади. Есть все условия для содержания скота, заготовлены корма и сено. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, а также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку жилого дома.
texts.en: Chynar is 32 years old, widowed, and the mother of 2 children.  Chynar has a secondary education, and knows how to use financial resources to work toward accomplishing set goals.  Chynar's 14 years of work in animal husbandry has served as the main source of income for her family.  She now has 3 milk cows, 20 sheep, and 2 horses.  She has all the necessities for taking care of cattle, including feed and hay.  Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.  With the goal of further increasing her business, Chynar turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase cows to breed, and to increase her monthly income from selling milk products.  With the income from the loan, she plans to invest in further increasing the size of her herd, and also plans to save towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, palm, oil, vita, pepper, vita etc for her business.

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru:
Саиджон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый парень  в возрасте 26 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Саиджон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена его также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Саиджон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Саиджон подрабатывает мастером по ремонту домов и квартир. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Саиджону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Саиджон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Саиджон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Saidjon is a cheerful and hardworking young man of 26.  He is married and has two children.  He first turned to Arvand when he found out that there was a chance to receive financial support.  Saidjon lives with his family in a rural area.  He does not have a higher education because the financial troubles of his family precluded him from studying in university.  His wife also does not have an education and is a homemaker, taking care of household chores and raising the children.  To have money for food, Saidjon has his own business fattening and selling cattle.  Saidjon also works repairing houses and apartments, which provides him with a good income.  His wife also helps Saidjon in his work by selling milk from their cattle.  Saidjon now hopes to expand his business by increasing the number of cattle in his herd.  He thus turned to Arvand in the hopes of receiving a loan to purchase cattle.  Saidjon is very hopeful that there will be a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: St Thereza Women Group

texts.en:
Alex is a thirty-nine-year old married male living in Kasese-Uganda, with four children of whom three go to school. Alex has been dealing in electronics for sixteen years, working six days a week and twelve hours a day in a location near the border. He also farms for additional income. Alex hopes to educate his children up to university, however, lack of enough capital is a challenge he faces. He is requesting a loan to buy electronics like mobile phones to sell. 
Alex is a member of St Thereza women's group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since groups don't give security to Hofokam.

loans.use: to buy electronics like mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Les Fidele De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Paulimus est le coordinateur de son groupe Fideles de Dilaire. Il n'est pas marie. Il a 3 enfants. Paulimus habite dans la région nord`est Haïti ou l’électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limite. Il dirige son commerce de vente de produit cosmetiques pendants les 8 derniers années. Avec ce prêt, Paulimus va investir dans l'achat de cosmétiques. Il espère que ce emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de Fideles de Dilaire ont besoin d’un emprunt pour les commerces ventes produits cosmétiques, charbon, chaussures, etc. Il dit que son défi principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant Son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Paulimus is the coordinator of the Fideles de Dilaire group. He is not married and has three children. Paulimus lives in the north of Haiti, where electricity is rare and drinking water is very limited.

Paulimus has been running a business selling cosmetics for the past eight years. With this loan, he will invest in buying cosmetics. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

The other group members need a loan for their businesses which sell cosmetics, charcoal, shoes, etc.

Paulimus says his main challenge is becoming a great merchant. His main goal is to have a large business which will facilitate him building a larger house, with the help of Esperanza International.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Chuisequec Group

texts.en:
In the western highlands of Guatemala, the agricultural town of Concepción is located. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chuisequec” consisting of eleven women is found here. The ladies create traditional crafts, jewellery, and beaded items in order to create income.

Doña Rosario is a 37-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is a true leader and role model for the group. She has been elected President. She is very charismatic and promotes harmony within the Trust Bank. This hard-working woman, who is married with seven children, is involved with her family farm growing carrots, onions, and cabbage. She is requesting a new loan which she will invest in the onion crop that she will plant in the winter months. Right now, she has to prepare the soil and buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seeds. She wants to have everything ready so that she can have an excellent and abundant harvest.

The eleven women are greatly helped by the non-formal educational themes that are covered by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer at the monthly meetings on topics like money management and business administration, budgeting, and accounting, as well as health and nutrition. Many of them, like Doña Rosario, have had little or no formal education. But they realize that education is the key to a successful future. Four of Doña Rosario’s children attend elementary school and she is quite pleased about this. 

The Trust Bank “Chuisequec” send their appreciation and gratitude to Kiva investors for believing in their dreams. Armed with their newly acquired knowledge and loans, the ladies are able to improve the quality of their lives and empower themselves with the final goal of eliminating poverty. This will not only benefit themselves but also their families and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To invest in her onion crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, spices, onion, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Kasanga Thiyikulhaye Group

texts.en:
Tusabe is a forty-one-year old married male living in Kasese, Uganda. He has six children, five of whom go to school. Tusabe has been selling cattle for fourteen years, working five days a week and nine hours a day in a rural location. He also operates a motorcycle transport business and farms for additional income. Tusabe hopes to educate his children and become rich, however, competition is a challenge he faces. Tusabe is a hard-working and honest man who needs a loan to buy coffee to sell.

Tusabe is a member of the Kasanga Thiyikulhaye group where members guarantee one another to acquire a loan facility since they can't afford security.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Lukenge est une commerçante d’une expérience de 8 ans, âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Nazareth». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché secondaire de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter divers habits usagés de triage dit de premier choix. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Lukenge has eight years experience selling used clothing. She is 44 years old, married, and a mother of 10 children, who all go to school. She is a member of the Nazareth business group. 

Lukenge first started her business with funds received from her husband, and she displays her merchandise in a local town market. She is seeking a loan through Hekima in order to increase her business. She is going to buy various, high-quality used clothing. 

In the future, Lukenge would like to increase her line of credit, buy a piece of land, and feed and school her children.

She strongly thanks Hekima for their micro-lending support to female entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional banking services, during this post-conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy various used clothing

loans.name: Abavandimwe Group

texts.fr:
Aïsha  fait partie du groupe  Abavandimwe et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 42 ans, elle a 2 enfants l’un a  13 ans et l’autre 24 ans. 

Elle fait le commerce de  limonade depuis 7 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de limonade à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait avoir sa propre maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aïsha is a member of the Abavandimwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 42 years old, a widow, and has two children, who are 13 and 24 years old.

Aïsha has been selling sparkling lemonade for seven years. She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of sparkling lemonade to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to have a proper house and see her children study.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of sparkling lemonade to resell

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Rayito de Luz” or “Little Ray of Light” is located in the community of Olintepeque in the western highlands of Guatemala. It is composed of nine enthusiastic women who are requesting a loan from Kiva investors. They will use the funds to grow their businesses and use the income to meet the needs of their families. Their ultimate goal is to improve their quality of life and to eliminate poverty.

Doña Maria, the 32-year-old Treasurer of the group, has five children who range in age from 5 months to 16 years of age. Four of her children attend a local school. Doña Maria has a convenience store where she sells items for daily consumption. It has grown a lot in the past few years because of the previous loans she has received. She is requesting a new loan to purchase additional items for the inventory including oil, sugar, pasta, drinks, and other basic items. 

As is the case with many of the ladies in the Trust Bank, Doña Maria has had only one year of formal education. She has taught herself to read and write and methodically carries out her duties as Treasurer. She has been greatly helped by the monthly educational trainings given by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer on subjects like effective business practices, the prevention of over-indebtedness, customer service, and the value of children’s education.

Each of the women in the “Rayito de Luz” Trust Bank has a ray of hope for their future. They have already met some success in their businesses and look forward to continuing the journey as empowered women eliminating poverty. They are most appreciative of Kiva investors for believing in them and generously helping them out with their loans!

loans.use: To purchase additional items for the inventory including oil, sugar, pasta, drinks, and other basic items.

loans.name: St Clare 111 Group

texts.en: Rusia is a forty-year-old married woman with eight children, six of whom go to school. Rusia has been in the retail shop business for fourteen years, located in a rural area. She also farms as a source of additional income. Rusia hopes to educate her children and buy land for them, however, she faces the challenges of bad debtors and high rental charges. Rusia is a hard-working woman who needs a loan to buy goats, bananas, and cassava flour for reselling.

loans.use: to buy goats, bananas, and cassava flour for reselling.

loans.name: Ndugu Group

texts.en: Eve is a 65-year-old lady and a member of a village bank known as Ndugu Group, where the members guarantee each other for loans. She has had a business fattening cattle for 15 years now, and she even sells her animals across borders in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Eve also sells tree seedlings to generate additional income. She has a dream of earning more income from her loan with Hofokam and Kiva. However she complains of animal diseases which sometimes kill her cattle. Eve is therefore asking for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Kihuura B United Group

texts.en:
Expeditor is a hard-working, Ugandan man living in Kagadi. Expeditor is 53 years old with 10 children, 3 of whom attend school. He has been farming and selling produce to generate income. 

Expeditor hopes to grow his business and become a model farmer in his area despite the challenge of price fluctuation. Expeditor is requesting a loan to buy maize, ground nuts, and beans to sell. He is a member of Kihuura B United Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, ground nuts, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava for her business.

loans.name: Kyenzige Kwesiga Group

texts.en:
Faith is a 65-year-old, hard-working and married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has 8 children aged between 16 and 35 years and only 3 attend school. 

Faith owns a maize milling machine and has been farming since 2001 to generate income to support her family. She hopes to buy more land in spite of the challenge of inadequate capital. Faith intends to use the loan to buy a generator. She is a member of Kyenzige Kwesiga Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Karibea Group

texts.en:
Tetula is a mother of one boy who is at school. She is single and makes her living by running a business of cosmetics and women's clothes. She has been in this business for five years now. Tetula is aged in her early forties and does her business door-to-door. She starts working at 10 am and works until 8 pm each working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, Tetula has been receiving a loan service since 2011. She used the previous loans all of which paid back successfully to restock her business with the products that were most in demand so that her business could grow. Her business now is doing great and thanks goes to Kiva lenders who did this. She got a profit which she used to cover school fees and home food expenses. Tetula drams that after three years, she will be able to be a wholesaler of her products. She will use this loan to buy stock to resell wholesale. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" Karibea" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock to resell wholesale.

loans.name: Kidubuli Tukorehamu Group

texts.en:
Julius is a 30-year-old gentle man with two children; he is a resident of Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a carpenter by profession dealing in timber products. He has been in this business since 2000 and besides this he deals in cattle selling as the other income earning activity. He is a member of Kidubuli Tukorehamu group where the members guarantee each other for loans.

Julius wishes to buy his own land and says bad debtors do affect the business since most of the work is done on a credit basis. Julius is therefore asking for a loan to buy timber for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy timber for his workshop.

loans.name: Isunga Elders Savings & Credit Sugar Cane & Chilli Group

texts.en:
Rauben is a 40-year-old married man with 4 children, one of which is school-aged. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and is a member of Isunga Elders savings and credit group, where elders started a group of members who guarantee themselves for small developmental projects.Their members deal mostly in agriculture.

Rauben's main income-generating activity is coffee growing. He also raises and sells chickens to supplement his income. Changes in the weather affect his business. Rauben intends to use the loan to buy groundnut seeds for planting. In the future, he wishes to construct a good residential house.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milk, mayonnaise, beans and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 40s is married with six children and five of them go to school while the other one is still small. She has been running a charcoal business for two years now. She works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her charcoal stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a wad rope, sofa set, dinning table and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal. She dreams of building her own house.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "Ebeneza" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Né à NIORO du Sahel, Monsieur LAMINE est un  polygame résidant avec ses épouses et leurs 6 enfants à HAMDALLAYE, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur LAMINE n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études,  s’est initié il y a quatre 4 ans des activités d’achat et de vente des Fruits et légumes (Pomme de terre, orange, citron patate, etc.). Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau de Bamako, de Kayes et de Mopti, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il rejoint à l'institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année avec laquelle il sollicite ce deuxième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce  deuxième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso 25 sacs de pomme de terre, 10 sacs d’orange, 20 sacs de citron, 20 sacs de patate. Ses ventes sont faites en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales au comptant et à crédit.  
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Born in Nioro, Sahel, Mr. Lamine lives in a polygamous familywith his wives and six dhildren in Hamadali, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. Not having had a chance to progress in his studies, four years ago he launched a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables (potatoes, oranges, lemons, sweet potatoes etc). Thanks to his experience in this field, he has a good business reputation and receives a lot of orders in Bamako, Kayes and Mopti. However, he laks the necessary means to provide of rhis needs. Thus  a year ago he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now seeking his second individual loan. This loan will allow him to bolster his working capital and meet his customers' expectations With this individual loan, he wiill by in the region by Skiasso 25 bags of potatoes, 10 bags of oranges, 20 bags of lemon, and 20 bags of sweet potaoes. He sells wholesale and retail to a customer base composed of all soical layers, for cash and in credit. He plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 80,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover his and his family's expenses. pay off the interest on his loan, and reinvest the rest in his business

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ibaale Kwesiga Women Group

texts.en:
Erisa, a 45-year-old gentleman and a father to 4 children, is a resident of Fort Portal, Uganda and member of Ibaale Kwesiga Women's group where members guarantee each other for small loans. This group was started by women then later on men joined it and they carry out different businesses all together but reside in the same location.

Erisa operates a retail shop and also carries out farming and a bricklaying business to increase his capital base. He wishes to start up poultry business but limited capital is a hindrance. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat, pepper, spices and onions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil and onions for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her previous loan. The coffee-growing season went well and she was able to produce a bountiful harvest. She will use this current loan to buy more fertilizers since her previous experience was perfect. She thanks Kiva lenders for their great support and she looks forward to many more loans. Betty describes herself as a hard working woman.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur  MALIK est né à NIORO, marié et père de quatre enfants résidant avec sa famille à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  troisième region administrative de la république du mali.
Monsieur MALIK exerce des activités d’achat et de vente des habits de Prêt à Porter depuis environ quatre  ans .Il dispose une boutique à la gare routière de SANOUBOUGOU I. Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans  après six prêt individuel correctement remboursés, ainsi il sollicite un septième prêt individuel.
 Avec ce septième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 chemises différentes, 20 pantalons de qualité différentes, 20 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine), 5 complets de veste, 20 Tee-Shirt, 10 complets de sous-vêtement. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce septième prêt individuel un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 115 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce,  payer son prêt et son intérêt , à couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en: Mr. Malik was born in Nioro. He is married and has four children. He lives iwht hsi family in Sanoubougou, a working-class neighborhood in the ciyt of Skiasso, the third administrative region of Mali. He as been buying and selling ready-to-wear clothng for about four years. He has a shop at the Sanoubougou I bus station. GIven the growth of his customer base due to the quality of his merchandise and the fact that his own resources are insufficient to meet demand, five years ago he thought it useful to turn to the Soro Yiriwaso mirofinance institution. After six individual loans duly reimbursed, he is now requesting his seventh loan. This loan will allow him to buy 15 miscellaneous shirts, 20 trousers of various quality grades, 20 pairs of various shoes (Soulier, Ferardine), five sets of jackets,, 20 T-shirts, 10 sets of underwear. He stock up in Bamako and then resells his articles in his store located right in the middle of the bus station, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. With this 7th individual loan, he anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 115,000 West African francs, which will allow him to bolser his working capital, pay off the ineres ton his loan and cover some additional family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Don Agustín tiene 53 años, es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, artículos eléctricos, ollas, sábanas y otros artículos para el hogar.
El comenta que se dedica a esta actividad ya hace más de 20 años, realiza sus ventas en zonas de la cordillera, Paraguarí y central.
Comenta que tiene 450 clientes a quienes en forma semanal los visita para realizar sus ventas y cobranzas, lo caracteriza el buen trato y la calidad de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo quiere comprar ollas, sábanas y otros artículos para poder venderlos, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo sigue haciendo.
texts.en:
Don Agustín is 53 years old. He is from the city of Caacupé, married and has 4 children. He sells clothing, electrical appliances, pots and pans, bedding and other household items. 

He says that he has been doing this for more than 20 years. He makes his sales in the mountain region, in Paraguarí and in central areas. 

Don Agustín says he has 450 customers who he visits weekly to make sales and receive payments. He is set apart by his good customer care and the quality of products he offers his customers. 

With this loan he wants to buy pots and pans, bedding and other items to sell, and thus be able to continue with his sales as usual.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans, bedding and other articles

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora María Martha, quien se gana la vida haciendo tortillas, también se apoya vendiendo ropa variada y cosméticos negocio con el que pretende salir adelante siendo madre soltera, ella tiene bajo su cargo a dos de sus hijos quienes aun están estudiando. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, arena, hierro, para realizar divisiones de cuartos en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
María Martha, who makes her living selling tortillas, also sells a variety of clothes and cosmetics, a business with which she can succeed in to get ahead as a single mother; she has two children under her care who are still studying. 

She is seeking the loan to buy construction materials such as breeze blocks, cement, sand and iron to divide the rooms in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and breeze blocks.

loans.name: Bubuzhan

texts.ru: Бубужан 60 лет, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Бубужан  - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Бубужан  занимается животноводством, стартовав более 40 лет назад, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 11 телят, 8 овец и 2 лошади. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Бубужан  также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает пшеницу, ячмень и эспарцет. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубужан  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Bubuzhan is 60 years old, married and has a grown son. Bubuzhan has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Bubuzhan raises livestock, having started over 40 years ago. At present her farm includes two dairy cows, 11 calves, eight sheep and two horses. She has all that is necessary to raise livestock. Fodder and hay are ready, Bubuzhan also has a land plot of 2.5 ha [5 acres], where she every year plants wheat, hops and sainfoin [a perennial used for animal fodder]. Her monthy income is 17,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Bubuzhan has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to increase her livestock headcount by buying steers. She plans to use the revenues resulting from this loan for an additional increase of livestock, and plans to save up to buy an apartment.

loans.use: To buy steers

loans.name: Amparo Del Rosario

texts.es: Amparo del Rosario es una joven mamá de 27 años de edad, quien habita en el Bario La Libertad en Chontales, desde joven le ha gustado cocinar y desde hace poco tiempo se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de alimentos en su casa de habitación, todas las tardes ofrece variedad de productos a sus fieles clientes, quienes en los últimos meses le han solicitado variedad de alimentos. Su esposo con quien ha procreado dos hermosas niñas trabaja en una empresa privada y además la apoya en el negocio, ya que el despacha junto a su esposa los diferentes platos. Ella solicita dicho crédito para la comprar carne, tomate, plátano, repollo, arroz, frijoles, chile, condimentos, carbón, los cuales son la materia prima de sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Amparo del Rosario is a young mother of 27 years of age, who lives in the La Libertad neighborhood in Chontales. Since she was young she has liked to cooked and since not too long ago she has worked making and selling food in the house she lives in. Every afternoon she offers a variety of products to her loyal customers, who in the last few months have asked her for a variety of foods. Her husband, with whom she has had two beautiful daughters, works in a private business and also helps her in her business, as he serves the different dishes along with his wife.

She is asking for this loan to buy meat, tomatoes, bananas, cabbage, rice, beans, chilies, condiments and charcoal, which are the raw material for her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, tomatoes, bananas, cabbage, rice, beans, chilies, condiments and charcoal, which are the raw material for her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 24  años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; ella es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para la clienta  el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
The client is 24 years old and lives with her family. She has a business selling clothes. She has different styles and has clothes for everyone: men, women and children. The clothing which she sells is of very good quality and she sells it at affordable prices; that is why she has gained a lot of customers lately. She is very active and is always to be found working, always struggling to get by. 

The client brings dedication and courage to her work with the aim of seeing the business grow in order to achieve a better future. That is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan  that allows her to buy a variety of types of clothing - such as skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and suits - so that she will always be able to meet her customers' needs. She hopes that in this way she will be able to give her family financial security and full lives.

loans.use: buy a variety of types of clothing such as skirts, trousers, blouses, t-shirts and suits

loans.name: Kibasi Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Charles, a 27-year-old youth, is a member of the Kibasi Tweyimukye Group where members acquire loans as guarantors, and who are residents of Fort Portal. 

Charles deals in the business of selling pork, which is supplemented by farming as his other activity. He started this business in order to sustain himself and wishes to accumulate more capital in the future. Charles complains of inadequate capital and bad debtors as factors affecting his business outcomes. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo  y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y visionaria quien se gana la vida por medio de la venta pan dulce de manera ambulante. De esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Carmen desea construir una pila con su respectivo lavadero para almacenar el agua y para lavar su ropa y la de su familia. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y pago de mano de obra para la construcción. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así proceder a la construcción lo antes posible dado que de esta forma se ahorraría mucho tiempo para invertir en su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and young 5-year-old daughter. Carmen is a very hard-working and visionary woman who earns a living through selling pastries on the street. This is how she pays her household expenses. 

Carmen wishes to build a water tank with a corresponding washing area in order to store the water and wash her and her families clothes. For this she has decided to apply for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand and gravel, and the payment of labor costs for the construction. She hopes to be able to rely on this support and in this way proceed to the construction as soon as possible, given that this would enable her to save a lot of time to spend on her family and business.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, gravel and to pay for the labor costs for the construction of a water tank with washing area.

loans.name: Tweimukye Bukumi Group

texts.en:
Sylvest is a married and hardworking Ugandan man, aged 52 years. He lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a retail shop and farming to look after his family. He hopes to educate his children despite being challenged by competition.

Sylvest is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as bread, cooking oil and matchboxes to sell. He is a member of Tweimukye Bukumi where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bread, cooking oil and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Twesigangane Group

texts.en:
Amos is a married Ugandan man, aged 43 years, with eight children aged between four and eighteen years, of whom seven attend school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been farming and selling produce to pay school fees and finance his family. He hopes to educate his children and also grow to his business despite price fluctuations. 

Amos is requesting a loan to buy more produce such as maize to sell. He is a member of Twesigangane Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more produce such as maize to  sell

loans.name: Twekambe Kyarwakya Group

texts.en:
Colonuel is a married and hardworking Ugandan man; he is aged 49 years with five children aged between 10 and 24 years, of whom only three attend school. He lives in Kagadi where he has been farming and selling produce since 1998 to generate income to support his family. He hopes to buy more land for farming despite the challenge of natural hazards. 

Colonuel is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for planting, and insecticides for spraying crops. He is a member Twekambe Kyarwakya Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for planting and insecticides for spraying crops

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Don Angel de 54 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz  y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa en casa propia. Don Angel  está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. así como muestra la fotografía ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Angel, 54, has earned a living in agriculture for several years.  He grows beans and rice.  With the sales from his harvests he's able to cover some of his household expenses.  He's a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives with his wife in his own house.

Angel's requesting a loan to be able to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, seeds, herbicide, and other inputs for his harvest, as shown in the photograph.  What he earns isn't enough to cover those expenses, and this way he'll earn better income and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soil amendments, seeds, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 25 years old. She is married, has two children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden. In her free time, she sells fish and tomatoes to people around her area. She dreams of providing her children with higher levels of education and building a residential house for her family. Competition and lack of enough capital hinder her business. She wants a loan to buy more tomatoes and fish to sell for better profits.

loans.use: To buy fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 20 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su abuela, su hijo y su compañero de vida. La clienta tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. ubicado en su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del municipio. Tiene mucha clientela pues las  personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan y en este lugar, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar ropa por mayor  y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client, 20, lives in her own house with her grandmother, her son, and her life partner.

She has a clothing business in her house in an area that's very busy and well known by the town residents.  She sells a variety of garments such as skirts, blouses, pants, etc.  She has a lot of customers because people always find what they want in her place; friendly and good service is the most important thing.

The client's dream is to expand her business, so she decided to get a loan from Integral to be able to buy clothing wholesale and have a greater variety of pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments.  Her goal is to attract more buyers and achieve a higher level of sales as well as more income to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
A $1,000 (USD) loan is offered to Madalena to improve her business. She has a fishing business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as boat repair materials and a net. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Madalena independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is also a fisherman.

loans.use: to buy boat repair materials and a net

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta tiene 57 años, es de la ciudad de Lambaré, ella está casada con el sr. Faustino, con quien tiene 4 hijos, todos ya mayores que ya tienen sus respectivas familias, y que esta pareja pudo criar con gran esfuerzo.
La Sra. Marta se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas, calzados, perfumes y desodorantes desde hace más de 20 años, y el Sr. Faustino se dedica a la compostura y reparación de calzados. Esta es una pareja muy sacrificada, que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia por medio de su trabajo sacrificado y la lucha.
Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de prendas de vestir y perfumes en forma mayorista para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marta is 57, she is from the city of Lambaré. She is married with Faustino, with whom she has 4 children, all of them are older now and they have their respective families, since this family was able to raise them with great effort.

Marta has been making her living as a street vendor of clothing, shoes, perfumes and deodorants for more than 20 years. Faustino works in repairs and shoe repair. This is a very sacrificing couple, who have been able to get their family ahead by their sacrificed work and fighting.

They ask for this loan to invest it in the purchase of clothing and perfumes in bulk for selling. In this manner, they will be able to continue with their sales like they are doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en el 1er ciclo, es un grupo nuevo  que están muy entusiasmadas para poder aprender por medio de las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia muy luchadoras y emprendedoras.
Marta es una de las que integran este grupo, es vendedora de todo tipo de prendas, que ella misma trae y vende de forma ambulante. Por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia, y tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder sacarlos adelante. Ella pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar prendas variadas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá invertir en su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas Group is in its first loan cycle.  It's a new group and they're very excited to be able to learn through the training they'll get.  The women are very persevering and enterprising heads of family.

Marta's one of the members of this group.  She sells all types of clothes that she herself gets and sells on foot.  Through this job she helps her family, earning the income she needs to be able to get them ahead.

She's requesting this loan because she wants to buy a variety of garments to sell.  That way she'll be able to invest in her business and keep on helping her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angelica de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a vender refrescos, gaseosas, jugos y agua en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también vende pupusas,  ya tiene mucha clientela pues vende sus productos a un buen precio con las ventas que realiza logra obtener buenas ganancias que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y otras necesidades que se le puedan presentar Angelica solicita un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor  ya que últimamente ha tenido mucha demanda y así poder surtir de mas productos su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Angélica, 44, lives in her own house with her daughter.

She makes a living selling beverages, soda, juice, and water in her home.  She also sells pupusas.  She already has a lot of customers because she sells her products at a good price.  With the sales she makes she's able to earn good profits that allow her to cover her household expenses and other necessities that come up.

Angélica's requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale.  She has had a lot of demand lately and she wants to supply her business with more products and earn more profits so she and her daughter have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beverages wholesale

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Amanecer, y ya está en su ciclo número 14, donde todas y cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida en la que cada una está.
Felipa es miembro de este grupo, ella  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de elementos de limpieza en su domicilio,  tiene una buena clientela formada , en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada trabajándose y capacitándose.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos químicos para hacer sus productos de limpieza. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Amanecer group is in their 14th loan cycle.  The group is putting in their best effort to be able to move forward.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, which allows them to know the living situation of each member.  

Felipa is a member of the group.  She works making and selling cleaning products in her home.  She has a good customer base formed.  In her last survey, she was outside the poverty line, but she will continue working enthusiastically and training herself.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in chemicals to make her cleaning products.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and move forward.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

Margarita operates a direct-selling business of UNO Products in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a buy and sell ready-to-wear business. Margarita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her direct-selling business of UNO Products.

Margarita successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 (USD) to improve her business. She is married, and she opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $250. She earns a good income from her business.

Maria will use her loan to buy some stock such as bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, water, noodles and milk to keep in her store. She is a very hard workingwoman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, water, noodles and milk

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 50 años, es casado vive con su señora y tiene 3 hijos, por quienes esta pareja ha luchado para sacarlos adelante y que no les falte nada.
Comenta que desde muy joven viajó al exterior en busca de mejores oportunidades, allí aprendió el oficio de herrero, pudo juntar su dinero y volvió al país donde abrió su propia empresa, hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada, y su propia herrería.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un compresor, que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su negocio y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 50, is married and lives with his wife and three children, for whom he and his wife have fought to move forward so they are lacking nothing.

He says that from a young age, he traveled abroad for better opportunities. From this experience, he learned how to work as a blacksmith. He was able to save up his money and he returned to his home country where he opened his own business. Today, he works with established customers in his own shop.

He is requesting this loan to invest in buying a compressor, which will allow him to keep working and fighting to improve his business and keep helping his family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his blacksmith trade.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio tiene 31 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, él está acompañado con la Sra. Graciela hace más de 7 años con quien tiene dos hijos.
Se trata de una familia unida y emprendedora, comenzó desde muy abajo, y ha ido creciendo con mucho trabajo y hace tres años habilito en su casa una despensa donde atiende su señora que cada día está creciendo más y más gracias a su buena administración y dedicación, además el señor hace exactamente un año dos meses habilito también en su casa una panadería con la cual también le está yendo muy bien.
Comenta que su mayor deseo ahora es hacer un tinglado y comprar maquinarias más sofisticadas.
Antonio pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en una maquina amasadora, que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Antonio is 31 years old.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person.  He has been married to Graciela for more than seven years and they have two children.  He has a united and enterprising family.  He started very young and has grown with a lot of work.  Three years ago, he built a store in his home where his wife works every day.  It is growing more and more thanks to her good management and dedication.  One year and two months ago, he also built a bread shop in his house, which is also going very well.

He says that his main goal is to build a shed and purchase more sophisticated machines.  Antonio is requesting this loan to invest in a kneading machine, which will be a big help for him to continue with his work.

loans.use: to purchase a kneading machine.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 46 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Edna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Edna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Hernalyn

texts.en:
Hernalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Noralyn works hard to support her family.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Noralyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Bermethan

texts.ru: Берметхан 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Берметхан - среднее образование. По характеру Берметхан очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Берметхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 3 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока и молочной продукции, также обрабатывает 0,78 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает дыню, кукурузу, арбузы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Берметхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян элитных сортов. Берметхан планирует подготовиться к весенне-летнему сезону, улучшить плодородность почвы и получить большой урожай. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Bermethan is 52 and married with two children. She has a high school education and is a very responsible, sociable and cheerful person. Bermethan works in animal husbandry and agriculture, a business she began 14 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four milking cows and three calves, with a monthly income of over 10,000 KGS from the sales of milk and dairy products, as well as 0.78 hectares of land on which she grows primarily melon, corn and watermelon. The resulting harvest is sold to wholesale suppliers. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Bermethan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase mineral fertilizers and high-quality seeds. She plans to prepare for the spring and summer growing season, improve the quality of the soil and receive a large harvest. She wants to invest profits from the loan into further improving the amount of livestock she has, and to save toward purchasing furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a fifty five year old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa garden and sells cocoa from there. He has been farming for ten years. Jackson’s dream is to have a big store for his cocoa. His challenges are seasonality changes and lack of enough capital that affects his business. He wants a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, todas formaron un grupo muy unido y trabajador.
La Sra. Teodolina es un caso particular ya que ella pasó de ser empleada doméstica a emprender su propio negocio, el cual consiste en un copetín bien surtido. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que a través de su esfuerzo está mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, comestibles, bebidas, y demás productos, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Esta agradecida por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The La Esperanza communal bank was formed by neighbors in the city of Santaní, where all the members work in independent activities. Together, they form a united and hard-working group.

Teodolina is a special case, as she became a domestic employee by starting her own business, which consists of a well-stocked, small restaurant. She is an enterprising woman who, through her efforts, is improving her living conditions.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying sweets, groceries, drinks, and other products, which will allow her to continue with her sales. She is grateful for the help she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy sweets, groceries, drinks, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling used clothing. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.  

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like nets, gasoline, bamboo, wood, etc for her business. She has been in this business for 25 years, and earns additional income from manicure and pedicure.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, gasoline, bamboo, wood, etc

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is 62 years old and married with eleven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 60 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, egg, sugar, coffee, etc.

Ancheta has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers and blouses for her market stall.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer muy emprendedora, que con mucho esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante. Ella comenta que gracias a su préstamo anterior pudo surtirse con mayor variedad de prendas, y de esa forma cumplir de mejor manera con su clientela.
Ella pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la estación de frío y quiere poder dar una variedad a sus clientes. agradece por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very hardworking woman, who is getting ahead with much effort. She notes that thanks to her previous loan, she was able to stock up with a greater variety of clothing and in this manner, fulfill her clients in the best manner.

She is asking for a new loan to be able to invest it in buying winter clothes, since the cold season is approaching and wants to be able to provide a variety to her clients. She is thankful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Santa Ysabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Santa Ysabel” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de los 13 Señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, que están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Estela es parte de este grupo, ella tiene una peluquería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias al buen servicio que ella brinda a sus clientes, y así se va abriendo camino.
Ella en vistas a ir mejorando sus condiciones de trabajo, pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás insumos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Santa Ysabel” communal bank is in their 1st cycle with the Woman's Committee program. All the members are committed to working hard and helping each other to get ahead. They are doing the Stoplight Poverty survey and 3 of the 13 women are below the poverty level, that is to say fighting for better living conditions.

Estela is part of the group. She has a hair salon where she works every day from early in the morning. She has gained a good clientele thanks to the good service she offers her clients so she is making headway. With the goal of improving her working conditions Estela has requested a loan to buy supplies for her salon such as dyes, shampoo, mouthwash, cream and other supplies. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving so she can continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, mouth-wash, cream, etc

loans.name: Leciel

texts.en:
Leciel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa palm roofing material in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa.

Leciel has been in this business for seven years and she also earns extra income from running a general store and raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Leciel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of nipa palm to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, two of whom are in school, Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Jean is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Elfha

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elfha works hard to support her family. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing. Elfha is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marn's Group

texts.en:
Marn is 40 years old and is a widowed mother of two kids who are still in school. She lives in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she is the one who needs to support her kids and she has been a cassava farmer for the past 22 years. Marn earns 11,100 KHR per day. 

Marn is the leader of a group loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund. She and her co-borrower are each requesting 500,000 KHR. Marn will use her portion of the loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for labor and harvesting fees for her farmland. She hopes her cassava will grows healthy and she will be able to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay for labor and harvesting fees

loans.name: Bayanzul

texts.en:
Mrs Bayanzul used her previous loan to purchase a natural gas vehicle in order to provide her husband with a job. Now her husband is rendering taxi services to local people and contributing to the family income. Her elder son works in Korea on an employment contract. She herself teaches children at kindergarten. 

This time she is requesting a loan of 1,950 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass to renovate her house. After the renovation her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Socias Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOCIAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: ayudante de mecánica, venta der mantas, restaurant, elaboración de carteras, salón de eventos, joyería, venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio.
