En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de abarrotes; da a conocer que este negocio era un negocio familiar, donde ella desde niña apoyaba a sus padres, con el pasar del tiempo decide establecer su propio espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Socias por Siempre" [Members for Always] village bank will start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Rosa is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied; among them exist: assistant to mechanic, sale of blankets, restaurant, making of wallets, events hall, jewelry, sale of food, sale of ice, sale of cosmetics.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises where Rosa is a member. She indicates that three years ago, she became a member of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a counselor of the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a food store business. It's worth mentioning that this business was a family business, where since she was a little girl she helped her parents. With the passage of time, she decided to establish her own selling space.

The loan that she will take out now is for increasing capital (purchase of food in bulk) that she will acquire from wholesale distribuors in the city of El Alto. Later, she will resell them in her sale space. This form of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy food in bulk.

loans.name: 05 Village 9 Minh Khôi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is a poultry and cattle farmer, who is requesting a loan to buy more baby chickens to raise and sell. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, named the 05 Village 9 Minh Khôi solidarity group. 

This is Loan's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women, though she has been involved in her business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.

With her profits, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Villa Anta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ANTA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Avelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de frutilla, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de lana de vicuña, venta de medias.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Avelina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien realizaba el mismo negocio, cuando se casó decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada) por mayor) que adquirirá de los distribuidores mayoristas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “VILLA ANTA” communal bank is starting their 9th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is lead by a board of directors with Avelina as President. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: clothing sales, selling strawberries, the sale of blankets, selling meals, selling vicuña wool and selling socks.

The loan will help all these entrepreneurs, one of them being Avelina. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer 4 years ago on the invitation of an adviser who visited her in her home. She has a business selling meals. She learned the business from her mother who did the same thing. When she got married Avelina decided to start her own business.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buying potatoes and dried potatoes wholesale. She will buy them from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and later sell them in her commercial space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help support her family as she is married and has 3 children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and dried potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: 12-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng has a service business repairing cars. Phượng has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to repair cars.

Phượng is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents. Phượng is the group leader of the 04-07-12-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2013, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phượng has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to repair cars.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat, spices, and other foods to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, spices, and other foods to sell.

loans.name: Anna Jean

texts.en:
Anna Jean is married, 36 years old, with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Anna Jean requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish for her dried fish-making business.

Anna Jean has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Anna Jean would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish for her dried fish-making business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish for her dried fish-making business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 23 years. She earns additional income from fish dealing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 27 years old and single. For the past two years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income as a vegetable farmer. Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NTWF.

Amelita is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, soy sauce, noodles, and other products. In the future, she hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, sugar, soap, soy sauce, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en:
Pheang is a citizen from Kampong Cham province and she is a married mother of two kids. One is in school and the other one is too young for schooling. To make a living, she does cassava farming as the main source of income and grows rice as the supplementary source of income. Engaged with this current business for nine years, she can earn income 36,700 KHR per day. 

This is the third-time loan for Pheang and the fourth-cycle loan for her joint borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, her condition of living and her business are better as a result of her two past loans, she also has completely paid them back. She is seeking loan of 1,600,000 KHR and her group members are requesting loans of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor fees and land leasing. She hopes to support all her kids to study until high level.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor fees and land leasing.

loans.name: Toeu's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44, Toeu is a farmer from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has five kids, three of whom still rely on her as one is too young for schooling and two are in school. To cover her family’s expense, she is growing rice and cassava as the main source of income which she has been doing for 24 years. Toeu also earns extra income via her spare time job as a paid worker. This business generates about 25,500 KHR per day. 

Now, she leads a group of two in order to request a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is in the second loan cycle. She and her co-borrower are requesting a loan of the same amount: 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava field. She strong hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin is 53 years old and a mother of five kids. Currently two of them are under her responsibility and they are in school. She lives in Battambang province where her rice is grown. Rice is the main source of income for feeding the family. She has been in this business for 20 years. She is in the third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) while her joint borrower is a second-time borrower. The past loan which she has fully repaid has enabled her to upgrade her standard of living so it is better than before. 

For this cycle, she is requesting loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for a loan of the same amount. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes very strongly that she can make more income so she can renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sirading

texts.fr:
Née à KAYES, Madame SIRANDING est une femme mariée et mère de 6 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à OUAYERMA I à SIKASSO troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Cette brave femme après mener beaucoup d’activité sans succès s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente des jus d’orange et jus de boisson. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter un sacs de sucre, 2 cartons de jus de boisson et 2 cartons de jus d’orange. Après l'approvisionnement elle transforme ces matières premières (sucre, jus de boisson et jus d’orange ) en jus d’orange dans un bidon de 0,25 litre qui seront vendus en détail sur place et au à une clientèle composée d’homme et femme au comptant et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in KAYES, Ms. SIRANDING is a married woman and mother of six. She resides with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended family in OUAYERMA I, in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, this good and honest woman was introduced to commerce in orange juice and juice drinks. 

Concerned about better satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan. This initial loan will enable her to purchase a bag of sugar, 2 boxes of juice drinks, and 2 boxes of orange juice. After stocking up on sugar, juice drinks, and orange juice, she uses them to make ¼ liter containers of beverages, which are then sold retail locally to men and women customers paying with cash or credit.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 32,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses, pay the loan interest, and invest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice drinks

loans.name: 01 Thôn 4 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Hãn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hãn is 57 years old and she is married with 5 children. Hãn is the group leader of the 01 Thôn 4 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Hãn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hãn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hãn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hãn hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Lớp Nghề Group

texts.en:
Đương is 59 years old and married with three children. For more than 10 years, she has worked raising poultry and cattle to resell. Đương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid three previous loans. One of her most critical business difficulties is illness.

Đương is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 10 Lớp Nghề solidarity group. She will use her portion of the group loan to purchase baby chickens and cattle to resell. Đương will use the profit from her loan to maintain a successful business. She hopes that her family will be healthy and happy and that her children will find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: 19 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Nhung is applying for a loan to purchase cattle to raise and resell. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Nhung has been involved in this business for 2 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Nhung is 23 years old and she is married with 1 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 19 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group. 

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for her children’s education and their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better: more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
This is Dominga, 48, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Segundino and a mother to her children. Dominga and her husband manage their household while operating their tailoring business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. Dominga mainly makes curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings as well as meeting seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms. She also does repairs and alterations and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Dominga earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Dominga is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed to continue her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a factory. Dominga meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
This is Celeste, 32, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is single and she has children who are studying. She takes care of her children while she is also doing her business. She works hard to provide for her family’s everyday needs and to support her children’s education.

Celeste operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Celeste is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory.

Celeste hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products like cabinets, drawers and other plastic home products needed in her business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. Mildred is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a fish net, gasoline and other materials for fishing.

Mildred has been in this business for 23 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, gasoline and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 60 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Fe has a business selling feeds and rice in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of feeds and rice to offer for sale.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of feeds and rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family in the Philippines. Riza is widowed and small restaurant where she sells her prepared meals.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food stand.

Riza has been in this business for 1 year now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lom's Group

texts.en:
Lom, a resident from Battambang province, is 31 years old and a mother of four kids. Now, two of her kids are in school and two are still young for schooling. Rice and sesame farming are the main source of income which enables Lom to earn up to 32,800 KHR per day. Lom has been involved in her current business for 11 years. 

This is Lom's third-cycle borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the group leader of two to get a new loan. She has managed her past with success and it has helped her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her joint-borrower is applying loan of 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Lom will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and to pay for plowing fee for her farming. She hopes to gain better yield than before and to gain more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Jeremy

texts.en:
Jeremy is 48 years old, married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jeremy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Jeremy requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

 In the future, Jeremy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en: Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Hoeun is 37 years old and a married mother of four school-age children. She struggles to make a living. Rice and sesame farming are her main source of income.This current business makes her a profit of 35,000 KHR per day. It is not her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has made a difference in her standard of living. Now, she is seeking a new loan and she is the leader of her group of four. The entire loan of her group is 5,400,000 KHR, and 1,400,000 KHR would be her loan portion. As the leader she will use her loan portion in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay a plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and produce a better crop yield than before.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Flor Y Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR Y CIELO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cipriana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de abarrotes, venta de celulares, tienda de barrio, venta de blusas, venta de sombreros, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cipriana es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de bolsas plásticas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento por iniciativa propia, al observar que este producto era ampliamente comercializado en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de bolsas plásticas por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "FLOR Y CIELO" [Flower and Sky] Communal Bank consists of eight members, and has a Board of Directors headed by Señora Cipriana. The members run businesses that include two grocery stores and sales of cell phones, clothing, hats, and cosmetics. Flor y Cielo is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], and works with the organization's German Busch Regional Office. 

The loan that the Flor y Cielo members are applying for will benefit their small businesses, including Señora Cipriana's business selling plastic bags. Señora Cipriana started the business herself after observing extensive sales of plastic bags. She states that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a Pro Mujer member. 

Señora Cipriana will use the funds from this loan to increase her working capital for the wholesale purchase of plastic bags from distributors. She will then sell the bags to order. Señora Cipriana is married and the mother of five children, and her business allows her to earn income to support her family.   

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Señora Cipriana notes that the organization offers health care.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale plastic bags

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle KADIATOU est née à KAFANA, et vit chez  son père dans une grande famille à KABOILA II un quartier populaire au centre ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initiée depuis plus de cinq ans des activités d’achat et de vente des condiments  (Oignons -grosses et petites graines, pomme de terre et tomate, etc) dans laquelle elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de SIKASSO. Mademoiselle KADIATOU est à son premier individuel  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 15 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (5 sacs de petites graines et 10 sacs de grosses graines), un panier de tomate et deux sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre.
 Ses marchandises sont vendues à BAMAKO au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce premier prêt individuel elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. KADIATOU was born in KAFANA. She lives with her father in a large family in KABOILA II, a working class district in downtown Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, she was introduced over five years ago to the business of buying and selling condiments (small and large onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc.) for which she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. 

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She gets her supplies from villages surrounding Sikasso. Ms. KADIATOU is on her first individual loan enabling her to increase her business capital to purchase 15 sacks onions (5 small and 10 large), a basket of tomatoes, and 2 sacks of potatoes at 50 kg each. 

Her merchandise is sold in Bamako to a customer base composed of housekeepers paying with cash or credit. With this first individual loan, she envisions making an average monthly profit 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase her business capital, help cover family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments (onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
As agreed, the Mertha Sedana Group makes their payment on time. With 10 members, they can make the payment of 30,000,000 IDR together. During the loan period, they manage the pigs well: with instructions from their vet, the group keeps the pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Ketut sell her piglets and earns a net profit of 1,500,000 IDR, after deducting the cost of feed and making her payment. She’s really happy with the profits and has decided to continue her loan to increase her number of pigs. All the profits are used for her family's daily needs, repairing her house and school fees.

After calculating and evaluating the last loan period, the Mertha Sedana Group decided to continue their loan. The loans are used to increase their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group received the same loan amount, with each of them receiving 3,000,000 IDR.

Ni Ketut is using her loan to purchase 5 high-quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs closer to the holiday to get a good price. She hopes that her plan is going well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their business until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

2 of the members can't attend the meeting because they had to attend a buried corpse (Ngaben) ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: to purchase 5 high-quality piglets

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.fr:
Violette  fait partie du groupe  Haguruka  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 37 ans et est mariée à Pierre, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, savon, sel,…) depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de haricot, de sel, beaucoup de savons,... à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait avoir sa propre  maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Violette is part of the group Haguruka and lives in Bujumbura. She is 37 years old and married to Pierre, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 1 to 14 years old, of whom four are students. 

Violette has been doing commerce in shop goods (rice, soap, salt,…) for ten years. 

She is on her seventh Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilos of beans, salt, soap, …. to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to have her own house and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of beans, salt, soap, ... to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Myrnalin

texts.en:
Myrnalin is 40 years old and married with two children who are in school, Myrnalin works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, ice, charcoal, soft drinks and beverages to sell.

Myrnalin has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Myrnalin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, ice, charcoal, soft drinks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Wendwaoga 2 Mogtedo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 2 MOGTEDO 2. Elle se porte bien et cède sa place à FATI. Mariée, elle est mère de 09 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 16ans.  03 vont à l’école, elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02tonnes de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’acheter un moyen de déplacement. Mme ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. MARIAM represents the group WENDWAOGA 2 MOGTEDO 2. She is doing well and hands over her spot to FATI. She is a married mother of nine children. The oldest is 40 years old, and the youngest is 16. Three go to school. She has three persons to support. 

Ms. MARIAM has been making rice dishes for ten years. She gets her supplies in Mogtedo. She wants to purchase 2 tonnes of rice. 

With her profits, she wants to purchase a means of transportation. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 2 tonnes of rice

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen, 48, is a married father of three kids and a local villager from the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. Nowadays, only two kids rely on him and they are still in school.

To feed the family, he is growing rice as the main source of income and does paid work to supplement his income. It is the business that he has been in for ten years and it has earned him a decent income to cover his daily living costs.

Including this cycle, he is in the fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s field partner) and he has fully repaid his past loans.

For this cycle, he is a team leader of a group consisting of five borrowers to get a new loan. The total amount of his group loan is 7,800,000 KHR, which includes 2,000,000 KHR for his loan portion. As the leader, he will use his entire loan portion to pay for plowing, planting fees and fertilizer purchasing. He hopes to gain a better crop yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, planting fees and fertilizer purchasing

loans.name: Jherson

texts.es:
Jherson, es soltero de 23 años, nació en la provincia Bustillos del departamento de Potosí y vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Santa Cruz – Bolivia. 

Jherson nos cuenta que desde muy pequeño le gustó los números, por este motivo decidió estudiar la carrera de Contaduría Pública en la Universidad Privada Cumbre, además que se encuentra trabajando hace algún tiempo como auxiliar contable en una consultora financiera, lo cual le permite poner en práctica los conocimientos que adquirió en la universidad; una de sus mayores motivaciones para salir profesional es poder trabajar en lo que a él le gusta y de esta manera ayudar económicamente a sus padres, por este motivo Jherson solicita un crédito educativo para terminar su último año de estudio en la universidad y poderse titular en la carrera que ha elegido

Jherson se identifica como un estudiante aplicado y un trabajador destacado dentro de su fuente laboral. Tiene la certeza que una vez que se titule, le será mucho más fácil poder conseguir un mejor trabajo ya que él nunca renunciará a sus sueños y que en un futuro logrará con mucho esfuerzo ser dueño de su propia empresa. 

Jherson de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a él se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Jherson is single and is 23 years old. He was born in Bustillos Province of the Department of Potosí and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Jherson tells us that he has liked numbers since he was little and so he decided to study Public Accounting at the Universidad Privada Cumbre. Also he has been working as an assistant accountant in a financial office which allows him to put in practice the knowledge he has gained at university. One of his motivations is to be a professional and be able to work at what he likes and by doing so help his parents financially.

So Jherson has requested an education loan to finish his last year of university and graduate in his profession. Jherson is a diligent student and a outstanding worker at his place of employment. He is certain that once he graduates it will be much easier to find better employment. He will never give up his dreams and in the future become the owner of his own business. Jherson thanks all the people who through their financial resources help others and generate new opportunities for growth like the loan he is now requesting.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Public Accounting.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba à Alpe (République de Côte d’Ivoire). Il réside dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnéka, quartier Banankabougou, chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle, marié et père d’un enfant. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur Yacouba abandonna trop tôt l’école pour se lancer dans des activités génératrices de revenus. Il est actuellement propriétaire d’un atelier de couture. En vu de diversifié ses activités il s’est lancé dans le commerce de mercerie qu’il exerce depuis 8 ans à son propre compte. Il s’approvisionne en marchandises pratiquement chaque semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce dans son atelier situé au bord du goudron non loin de son domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de tailleurs. Ainsi pour mieux organiser son activité, Monsieur Yacouba  décida d’entrer en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à son troisième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter des merceries. Monsieur Yacouba envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba [was born] in Alpe (Republic of Cote d’Ivoire). He resides in Fana City, Commune de Guégnéka, in the Banankabougou district with his father in a traditional family. He is a married father of one child. For societal reasons, Mr. Yacouba dropped out of school early in order to get started in revenue-generating businesses. He is currently the owner of a tailoring shop. 

To diversify his business, he started off in the commerce of sewing supplies, a business he has been operating on his own for eight years. He gets his supplies of merchandise practically each week from suppliers in Bamako. The sales are made retail and in cash in his shop located on the roadside not far from his home. His customer base is composed essentially of tailors.

Thus, to organize his business better, Mr. Yacouba decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his third loan, which will be used to purchase sewing supplies. He envisions making an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gustavo tiene 33 años de edad, vive en una de las compañías  de la ciudad de Itá. Es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de afrecho, maíz, golosinas, galletitas, entre otros, cuenta con un camión para realizar sus ventas, visitando así negocios ubicados en zonas de Itá, Itauguá y otros lugares más.
El comenta que con su esfuerzo ayuda a su familia, y también está luchando por un futuro mejor, ya que por medio de esto está saliendo adelante. Cuenta que con sacrificio se ha abierto camino y que hoy día ya tiene una buena clientela.
El Sr. Gustavo solicita el préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de afrecho y maíz para su posterior venta. Él está agradecido por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá poder crecer.
texts.en:
Gustavo, 33, lives in a community in the city of Itá.  He's a merchant who makes a living selling bran, corn, snacks, cookies, and other products.  He has a truck he uses to make sales, visiting businesses in the areas of Itá, Itauguá, and other places.

He said he helps his family with his sacrifice.  He's also striving for a better future, because he's getting ahead with his effort.  He said he has made his own way and that currently he has good customers.

Gustavo's requesting the loan to buy bran and corn to sell.

He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy bran and corn

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUITOUGOU est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Badialan, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de produit cosmétique, d’habillement, de fruits et légumes et de charbon de bois.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUITOUGOU sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARIAM  deuxième personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 5 kg de poisons fumés, 4 cartons de cube Maggi, 1 gros sachet de l’ail, 4 boites de concentrée  de tomate et de la poudre de gombo chez les grossistes à Bamako. Ces condiments seront vendus en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUITOUGOU is composed of married women, who average 28 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in Fana City, in the Badialan district, in Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, cosmetic products, clothing, fruit & vegetables, and charcoal. 

The women of the group DJIGUITOUGOU are on their sixth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, MARIAM, who is the second person from the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase 5 kg of smoked fish, 4 boxes of Maggi cubes [bouillon cubes], a big bag of garlic, 4 cans of tomato paste, and some powdered okra from wholesalers in Bamako. These condiments will be sold retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash in her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as garlic, tomato paste, and okra.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn is 42 years old and a mother of four children. They are living in a rural area of Takeo province. Thoeurn earns a living by cultivating two hectares of a rice farm and selling into the local markets. She has been engaged in the business for more than 20 years, and she earns additional income from weaving traditional clothes called sot silk, which is a Khmer word. Thoeurn is pictured in the photo with her daughter who is a second year student at Royal University of Law and Economics in Phnom Penh.

Thoeurn is taking out this loan in order to help her daughter enroll in a university. She said being a farmer is very hard and uses a lot of physical labor, so she doesn't want her children to follow her path. She will try her best to provide educational opportunities to each child after their graduation. This loan amount will be used to pay for tuition fees for her daughter, whose major is accounting, which is the suitable for her personality. Thoeurn is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via Kiva to enable poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and married with seven children.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to raise.

Mary Jane has been raising livestock for four years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Sambat Group

texts.en:
Sambat is 33 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker in Thailand. 

Sambat is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Sambat hopes that she can open a grocery retail shop and build a new house, and her children can earn higher education.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 23 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de produit cosmétique, d’habillement, d’essence et de sucre.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJENEBA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’essence. Elle compte acheter  35 litres d’essence sur place chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000 Fcfa qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group SIGUITEMASON is composed of married women, who average 23 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Konobougou, in Commune de Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in grains, cosmetic products, clothing, gasoline, and sugar. 

The women of the group SIGUITEMASON are on their first solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, DJENEBA, who is the second person from the right, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of gasoline. She intends to purchase 35 liters of gasoline locally from wholesalers in Konobougou. The sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produit cosmétique, d’habillement, de beignet et de jus.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARIAM , première personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagne. Elle compte achète des pagnes bazin chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village  of Konobougou, in Commune de Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in cosmetic products, clothing, beignets, and juice drinks. 

The women of the group BENKADI are on their first solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, MARIAM, who is the first person from the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to purchase some damask ‘pagne’ cloth from wholesalers in Bamako. The sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Sumber Bunga Group

texts.en:
To improve the relationship and business progress, the Sumber Bunga group is always exchanging information among members about the development of pig breeding. In group meetings which  are held once a month, they always exchange information so that they can implement a way to raise pigs properly and correctly.

By maintaining superior pigs, Wayan earn a satisfactory profit. The extra money could be set aside for business capital and savings. By raising pigs, Wayan is able to boost the economy and help improve her family's income for the welfare of her family.

The Sumber Bunga group will receive a new loan, but it is a bigger amount. The group has the same members. The loan is still being used for increasing their pig business. Beside purchasing piglets, they will also use the loan to renovate the cages and buy feed.

Wayan will use her loan to purchase three superior (good quality) piglets for fattening and will sell them five months later. Money for her daily needs comes from her husband. Her husband is really happy about that. He support his wife’s business by maintaining the pigs and feeding and washing the cages every afternoon. Wayan and her husband hope the business will succeed.

loans.use: to buy three superior quality piglets

loans.name: Reylyn

texts.en:
Reylyn is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a photo shop business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Reylyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new equipment for her photo shop business.

Reylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her photography business.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children, Sophat is 39 years old and a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To strive for a living, she does rice and sesame farming which she has done for twenty years. 

Sophat is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has had successful repayment of the past loans. Now, her lifestyle is getting better than before. 

For this cycle, she is a leader of a group consisting of three members. She is requesting the loan of 1,400,000 KHR, and she is planning to spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees. She highly believes that she will be able to gain a better yield and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees

loans.name: Siyoni Group

texts.fr:
Illuminée  fait partie du groupe  Siyoni  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de   50 ans .Elle a  un enfant de 32 ans.
Elle a sous charge son petit fils qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait importer des chaussures et des habits  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Illuminée is part of the group Siyoni and lives in Bujumbura. She is 50 years old and a widow. She has one child, who is 32 years old. She supports her grandson, who is in school. 

Illuminée has been doing commerce in rice for seven years

She is on her 13th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilos of rice to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to import shoes and clothing and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Taman Sari Group

texts.en:
After six months of raising pigs, Luh Eka sold two of her pigs and made a profit of IDR 300,000 per month. These results have been deducted her loans. Together with her husband, who as a farmer, Luh Eka was able to develop her pig raising efforts so as to help the family income.

These results are certainly very useful for families and can help pay their children's school fees. Although the price of piglets as well as pig feed is currently expensive, Luh Eka remains passionate for the development of her pig business with the group she leads.

After successfully repaying the previous loan, the Taman Sari group decided to continue the loan and are each getting 1,500,000 IDR. With full support from their husbands because it was considered beneficial to the family economy, they are optimistic the businesses will run smoothly. With 10 members, the group have new loan of 15,000,000 IDR.

Luh Eka is receiving 1,500,000 IDR of the loan and is using this loan to buy three piglets for fattening. Luh Eka hopes to gain more profit than the previous loan. The loans are helpful to Luh Eka in developing the business and of course in increasing the family income.

loans.use: to buy three piglets for fattening

loans.name: Norvi

texts.en:
Norvi owns and has been the sole operator of Sign Up Design, Inc for the past ten years. This graphic and web design studio specializes in custom web and graphic design services for businesses of all sizes. Norvi works mostly with local clients with branding services including logos, websites, and marketing designs. However, she also has many clients across the continental United States. 

Norvi is seeking to expand her business and fulfill the growing demand. She hopes to purchase an additional server to help maintain the heavy web traffic demand of her ever increasing customer base.

Help Norvi provide a necessary service to many local business owners in the Florida area!

loans.use: to purchase an additional server to help maintain the heavy web traffic

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is 29 years old and she is happily married to Gilberto, who works as a tricycle driver. God has blessed them with loving children and one of them goes to school already. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God they are raising their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Marianne owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, five Philippine pesos' worth of cooking oil, an egg or other goods. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she sells them per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her in adding more products to her store.

Marianne dreams that her store will get bigger and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory to create, remodel, and even customize trikes for all ages.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a talented and passionate artist and entrepreneur as well as a 38-year-old woman. Her journey with craft started very early in life as a hobby, which she further developed by studying every day. While caring for her family and during her only moments to herself, Leticia honed her craft from home and sold her products to relatives and neighbors.

As years passed by, as her children were growing older and her family’s expenses were increasing, Leticia decided to open a handicrafts workshop outside her home. Now, thanks to her passion for her craft and growing business, in addition to supporting her own family, she employs two other women, thereby enabling them to support their families.

loans.use: To buy soil, grass and sand for her pottery business

loans.name: Deob's Group

texts.en:
Deob is a 36-year-old a farmer from the province of Battambang province. He is married and blessed with four small kids who are still under his responsibility. Rice farming and pineapple farming have been the main sources of his income for 18 years. He earns additional income from a paid-work m job. His current business has earned him 35,400 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Deob and his joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He and the other group member are applying for loans of equal amounts of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his pineapple field. He hopes to collect a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his pineapple field

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, her business partner, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina owns and oversees operations of their jeepney* (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which has a paying boundary** (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every day.
				
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

Gina hopes to have more units of jeepney and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

** In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fungicides, larvicides, and carrot seeds to increase the variety of his crops

loans.name: Hamilton Andrés

texts.es: Nacido de una familia humilde, cría con excelentes enseñanzas y valores recibió la educación que sus padres le pudieron brindar, no pudo acceder a estudios superiores debido a que provenía de una familia con bajos recursos, y por ende salió a buscar la manera de poder ayudar en su hogar, él es Hamilton quien hoy en día tiene una tienda en la cual distribuye básicamente licores aproximadamente 9 años, monto su negocio en su hogar con ayuda de microcréditos y su madre, se ha enfrentado a diferentes problemas como lo son las famosas “vacunas” una cuota que tiene que pagar a los “cuidadores” de su barrio para que lo dejen operar, pero su gran ventaja es que su negocio está ubicado en muy buen sector por lo que ha acogido y fidelizado a varios clientes con los que ha logrado mantener su establecimiento y su hogar, opera todos los días con un horario de 14 horas diarias apoyado por su hermana quien ha sido su gran socia y con la que ha podido constituir su salsamentaría, solicita un apoyo crediticio para comprar mercancía en grandes cantidades específicamente cerveza pues las dichosas “vacunas” le han reducido sus ingresos. Su principal sueño es poder montar un negocio muy grande en la cual sus clientes puedan convivir y tengan un lugar de relajamiento y esparcimiento al cual llegar luego de una atareada jornada laboral
texts.en:
He was born in a humble family and raised with good values and teachings. He studied thanks to his parents, but could not go to the university because they lacked the money. He then had to find a way to help at home. His name is Hamilton and he has had a store where he sells alcohol for approximately nine years. He started this business at home with the help of his mother and some microloans. He has had to face several problems, such as the well-known “vacunas” [literally: vaccinations], which is some money he has to pay to his neighborhood’s “security guards” so that he can work. However, he is well located, so he has built a good customer base. This has helped him to maintain his business and his family. He works fourteen hours a day and his sister helps him. She has been a great partner and has helped him to open a grocery store.

He is requesting financial support to buy supplies in bulk, more specifically beer. Unfortunately, the abovementioned “vacunas” take a big share of his income. His biggest dream is to be able to expand his business so that his customers can have a place to meet, relax and have fun after a hard day at work.

loans.use: to buy beer in bulk and attract more customers.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
19 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras se han unido con el propósito de poder trabajar, todo dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a eso poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Carmen, una de las integrantes, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio de ingresos, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, y también gracias a la venta de bijouterie que está haciendo. Ella está contenta por la oportunidad de crecer que está recibiendo a través de las capacitaciones que va haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de canutillos, hilos, apliques y demás para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Nineteen hardworking women have come together with the objective of working hard. They are part of the Poverty Elimination Program and through the Poverty Elimination Survey, they will learn more about their situation and will be able to help their families.

Carmen, one of the members, was found to be in the poverty level two, which means that she receives a middle income. With her effort and continuous work, she is improving her situation. She sells imitation jewelry that she makes. She feels happy of having the opportunity to grow through the training sessions she goes to. She is requesting a loan to buy beads, threads, appliqués and other materials to continue with her business. She appreciates this opportunity, which will allow her to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy beads, threads, appliqués and other materials to make imitation jewelry.

loans.name: 1 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE MAYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Aida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de carnicería, costura de busos, carpintería, tienda de barrio, producción de mantas, servicio de limpieza, ayudante de minibus.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Aida es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  ayudante de minibus; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo que realiza el servicio de transporte donde ella apoya y desarrolla esta actividad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de repuestos de automóvil) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “1 de Mayo” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Focal Center. It is composed of 8 members, and it is directed by a board of directors, of which Señora Aida is president. The businesses in which the members of the group are engaged are varied; some of them are: a butcher shop, sewing sportswear, a carpentry work shop, a corner store, making blankets, a cleaning service, and minibus assistant. 

Their loan will benefit the women micro-entrepreneurs of whom Señora Aida is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She is a minibus assistant. She says that she learned this business from her husband, who provides a transportation service where she carries out her occupation and lends her support.

The loan that she is requesting is for increasing capital in order to purchase automobile parts. She will buy them in the stores in the city of El Alto and install them later in her service space. This form of work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family, as she lives in a common-law-marriage and she has a child. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase automobile parts.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es: Su principal sueño es montar varios locales de venta, su única ambición es superarse cada día, sus principales dificultades son la falta de capital para cumplir sueños, él es John un paciente hombre que tuvo que esperar varios años pro su local de negocio pues antes trabaja en comercio de pollos, una vez se le presento la oportunidad logro montar una heladería en la que ha operado varios años, espera poder mejorar y ampliar su negocio pues los materiales con los que empezó son de segunda mano y ya están empezando a mostrar defectos, solicita una ayuda para cambiar la maquinaria de su establecimiento y seguir creciendo como microempresario brindándole a la comunidad un servicio tan común y requerido como lo es un helado, un pequeño producto que nos alegra y nos saca una sonrisa cada vez que lo consumimos, con la colaboración espera comprar una nevera, una cajonera y mercancía para su negocio con la intención de sorprender a sus clientes con nuevos servicios y productos
texts.en: His principal dream is to set up a number of sales locations. His only ambition is to improve himself every day. His principal difficulties are the lack of capital to accomplish his dreams. This is John, a patient man who had to wait a number of years for his business location, since in the past he worked in the chicken business. Once he was presented with the opportunity, he succeeded in setting up an ice cream shop that he has operated for a number of years. He hopes to be able to improve and expand his business, since the materials with which he began are secondhand and they are already beginning to show defects. He is applying for help to change the machinery in his establishment and to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur, offering the community a service as common and as in demand as an ice cream, a little product that makes us happy and brings us a smile every time we consume it. With the assistance [of the loan], he hopes to buy a freezer, a chest of drawers, and merchandise for his business, with the intention of surprising his customers with new services and products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a chest of drawers, and merchandise for his business, to surprise his customers with new services and products.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco moved to the United States with his family from Ecuador over twenty years ago. After a few years, he noticed a unique opportunity in the form of a courier service. Francisco's business, Ecuacare, allows customers to purchase items abroad and handles the delivery of the items to Miami. 

Francisco has seen a large increase in his customer base over the past few years and hopes to continue to expand. He hopes to create a systematic website that utilizes an automated ordering system to help maximize efficiency and efficacy of his services. With this loan, Francisco will be able to develop this service.

Help Francisco develop his vision for his business and support his family!

loans.use: to build a website

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle's primary source of income comes from raising and selling hogs. Her spouse is a tricycle driver whose income is just enough to cover the family's daily meals. So, she involved herself in raising hogs to sell in the future, as she only stays at home to nurse her children. She has two young children. 

Jingle has already disposed of her hogs, and her profits go for education expenses, bills at home and credits to her neighbors. She is now asking for additional capital of 17,000 Philippines pesos to buy piglets to raise and feed for sustainability. She hopes to improve her business and gain good profits again to cover their expenses. She will also save funds for future expenses for the next school year. She also promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for sustainability

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is from Capatan. He lives with his wife and children. He has four children. His wife is a vendor selling processed food products such as pork sausages and hot-dogs. To add to their income, he raises hogs and sell piglets upon achieving desired weight. He is now asking for a loan of P40,000 to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for piglets. This will help ensure good nutrition for his hogs so he will be able to sell them at a higher price.

 In the future, Marcelo hopes to keep growing healthy hogs and save fund for his family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for piglets

loans.name: Renee

texts.en:
They say a picture is worth a thousand words, but for Renee, vintage furniture is an entire novel. During the preparations for her wedding, Renee and her husband sought to create a remarkable venue filled with old and vintage décor. During the process, they found a passion for treasure hunting and a need for vintage weddings. Thus, Forget-Me-Not Vintage Rentals was born.
 
Dedicated to vintage item rental to fully enhance the ambiance of clients' weddings and parties, Renee utilizes a warehouse and website to showcase her inventory. She rents her merchandise on a large scale system consisting mostly of weddings.  They transport the inventory and hope to purchase a box truck to increase efficiency. In addition, one of their more famous items, Vintage Wooden Tables, can be recreated but requires a specific type of wood. Thus, Renee needs a loan to purchase more raw materials.  

Help Renee fulfill her vision and get her interesting niche business off the ground!

loans.use: to purchase a delivery vehicle and supplies to create additional Vintage Wooden Tables

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 48, is a mother of five kids residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She does rice cropping and pineapple growing as the main source of income. She has been involved with this business for 18 years, and it has earned her decent income. 

To supplement the family income, Mom uses her spare time to earn more income via working for others for a fee. 

She is a repeat borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the fourth loan for Mom and her joint borrowers in the same group composed of three borrowers. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she leads the group of three to get a loan. As the leader, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), and she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer for her pineapples. She hopes to gain better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapples

loans.name: Dahiana

texts.es:
Dahiana tiene 20 años, es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, está estudiando el 3er.año en Técnico Superior en Farmacia.
Comenta que su aspiración es terminar su carrera para poder trabajar en un hospital público y más adelante abrir en su casa su propia farmacia. Ella a través de sus estudios quiere ayudar a su familia, dándoles la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, estando más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Dahiana is 20 years old and is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. She is in her third year of studying for her Higher Level Pharmacy qualifications. 

She says her ambition is to finish her studies in order to work in a public hospital and later to open her own pharmacy at home. Through her ​​studies, she wants to help her family, giving them the opportunity to improve their living conditions. 

She is asking for this loan to pay her fees, and thus be able to continue with her studies, bringing her closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 26 años  y está estudiando la carrera de administración de Negocios, está en el primer año. Su Mama es costurera, y por medio de su trabajo está ayudando a Leticia para que ella pueda estudiar.
Su meta es terminar la carrera y asi poder ejercer su profesión y lograr una solvencia económica que le permita ayudar a su mama para poner un salón de ventas de mercería en su casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Leticia, 26, studies Business Administration and is in her first year. Her mother is a seamstress and through her job, she helps Leticia so that she can study.

Leticia’s goal is to finish her studies and be able to work as a professional in order to receive a good income that allows her to help her mother to open a haberdashery at home.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her university’s tuition fees and be able to continue studying.
