loans.use: to pay for her university's tuition fees.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Graciela continua con su negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual el trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia continua trabajando conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia vende cemento, bloquetas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the ROSITA DE LOS ANGELES communal bank, located in the San Sebastian district, within the province and department of Cusco.

Graciela buys and sells building materials, has had this business for a good amount of time, and has satisfied customers, both personally and financially.  She continues to work with her husband and sells cement, cinder blocks, and other things that her customers request.  She wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy cement and other things.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, está siguiendo esta carrera, con la cual podrá acceder a un trabajo que le permitirá tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Él es una persona muy dedicada, que quiere salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma estar más cerca de cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en: Fernando is studying computer engineering. He is doing this so he can access employment which will allow him to live in a dignified manner without any hardships. He is a very dedicated person who wants to get ahead and help his family through his studies. Fernando is requesting a loan to pay his university fees and in this way get closer to achieving his objective.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo vive con sus padres, es soltero, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y además está trabajando, y de esa forma solventa sus estudios.
Su aspiración como estudiante es crecer a nivel intelectual ya que su carrera abre diversas puertas a nivel laboral. En un futuro le gustaría alcanzar lo más alto de su carrera y ser independiente.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma estar cerca de cumplir su meta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y estudiando.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives with his parents and is single. He is studying Business Administration and is also working to pay for his studies. His goal as a student is to improve his intellectual level as his studies will open a variety of door in the employment field. In the future he would like to rise to the top of his profession and be independent.

Marcelo is requesting a loan to invest in paying his fees and in this way get closer to his goal. He is grateful for this opportunity he is receiving so he can grow and study.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de mana (es un cereal a base de maiz es dulce),la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender mana.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz y azucar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She continues to sell mana (a sweetend corn-based cereal) and works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm and has been doing this for a number of years.  Things are going well for her and her dream is to have her own store so she can sell mana.  She will use the money from this loan to buy corn and sugar.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the spare parts needed in her tricycle business. Her income from the business is assisting her in covering their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benilda dreams of having another tricycle and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and food vending. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Elsie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy recycled materials to resell.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirty-three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es:
Sonia de 39 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, una por falta de escuela en la zona y lo otro por el poco interés que le daban los padres de antes al aprendizaje,  se casó a la edad de 23 años, procrearon 4 hijos con su pareja. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, los 4 hijos viven en su casa, dos de ellos estudian y los demás trabajan en casa, nadie aparte del núcleo vive con ella.
 
Sonia es ama de casa, es quien se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar, y al cuido de los animales de corral que posee, desde lo cuatro años su madre le enseño lo importante de aprender todo con respecto a la cocina, donde a cualquier parte que fuera se pudiese defender de los retos que se le afrontaran, el horario de labor es de las 5 am a 7pm, teniendo una jornada súper extensa.
 

El crédito lo necesita para la agricultura, lo invertirá en personas que le ayuden a su hijo y esposo, en la preparación de la tierra, el mejoramiento será el ya ir adelantando el trabajo para la época de la siembra, la necesidad satisfecha será avanzar desde ya con los trabajos.


Su sueño, es lograr  mantener su familia siempre unida es lo más importante, luego luchar siempre cada día contra todas las adversidades, lo que espera a futuro es heredarles un buen ejemplo de responsabilidad a sus hijos; el préstamo le ayudara en solventar la necesidad antes mencionada, de la ganancia de la inversión espera pagar la cuota y mantener su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and did not go to school because there was not one in the area and because her parents did not consider it to be important.  She married at age 23 and had four children.  Her husband is a farmer and their four children live at home.  Two of them attend school and the others work at home.  No one else lives with them.

Sonia is a housewife and cares for the home and the corral animals she has.  Since age four her mother taught her the importance of respecting the kitchen and facing the challenges that confront her.  She works from 5:00 am to 7:00 pm and keeps a long shift.

She needs this loan for her farming and will use the money to pay for labor to help her son and husband prepare the land to get ready for the planting season and get ahead on the work.

Her dream is to keep her family together, which is the most important thing and then to fight the daily adversities.  In the future she wants to provide a good example to her children.  This loan will help her pay for the previously mentioned needs and she expects to be able to repay the loan with the future earnings.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Hoern's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Hoern is 39 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 10 years, Hoern can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Hoern has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor. She hopes to grow more healthy rice so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica es una joven muy decidida, que se está esforzando por poder terminar su carrera, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, y comenta que cuando termine sus estudios quiere poder trabajar en el área que eligió.
Viene de una familia muy humilde, y con la esperanza de poder ayudarles a tener una vida mejor y sin tener que pasar por necesidades. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere poder sus gastos de manutención, como pasaje de colectivo, fotocopias y demás.
texts.en:
Erica is a very determined young woman who is working hard to be able to finish her degree. She is studying Computer Engineering and states that she wants to work in her chosen field when she graduates. 

She comes from a very humble family and hopes to be able to help them have a better life, without lacking any necessities. She is grateful for this opportunity and is asking for the loan to cover her expenses such as bus fare, photocopies, etc.

loans.use: to pay expenses such as bus fare and photocopies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for almost five years, showing herself as a MIGS member in Jade center at Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a responsible mother and blessed with three children.

Josephine is a farmer who plants corn, monggo,  and other crops  with the help of her loving husband who supports her, especially for their daily needs. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds and fertilizers.She is accessing a loan in the amount of Php. 50,000 for their business to have a good harvest someday. She hopes and prays that her business will help to educate her children with the help of her husband, and she is very thankful to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for the trust given to her, especially for the loan granted for her business.

loans.use: To pay for additional seedlings and fertilizers for her farming.

loans.name: Esterlinda

texts.en: Esterlinda is 58 years old, married and a resident of Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines.They have four children,of whom all are in school. Starting with working capital of 10,000 PHP, Esterlinda opened a small grocery with a focus on a soft drinks dealership. She was granted a loan to pay for additional cases of soft drinks to sell. She is very thankful for the help of Paglaum Cooperative especially since it gives her additional income to send her children to school. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the coop.

loans.use: to pay for additional cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business.  His earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintenance of the farm.  The profits from his business will definitely help his family sustain their daily needs.  He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Roberto hopes that his farm will expand and grow bigger.  He hopes that his family will always be in good health.  As a CCT community partner, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of the farm.

loans.name: Fabio De Jesús

texts.es:
Fabio es un hombre de 69 años, emprendedor, carismático y con mucha calidad humana. Desde hace 50 años se desempeña como vendedor ambulante y aprendió de este negocio con amigo que le enseño.
Cuando era niño vivo en una finca con sus padres quienes le inculcaron muchos valores, entre ellos el que considera más importante de tos, la humildad.
Hoy en día se dedica a la venta ambulante de aguacates, los cuales transporta por toda la ciudad en una carretilla y los vende a precios muy económicos, esto ha hecho que tenga una muy buena cantidad de clientes quienes afirman que es un hombre simpático y dispuesto a atenderlos con una amable sonrisa en su rostro.
En estos momentos Fabio solicita un apoyo económico para aumentar su inventario de aguacates, comprándolos de contado y mejorando sus utilidades.
Él es separado pero es padre de tres hijos que ocasionalmente lo acompañan y apoyan con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fabio is a man of 69, entrepreneurial, and charismatic, with much human warmth. For 50 years he has worked as a street vendor. He learned this business with a friend who taught him.

When he was a boy, he lived on a farm with his parents, who taught him many values. Among them is the one he considers the most important, humility. 

Today he works as a street vendor of avocados, which he transports through the entire city in a cart and sells at very economical prices. This has given him a very good number of customers, who confirm that he is a friendly man, ready to serve them with a kind smile on his face.

At this time, Fabio is applying for economic support to increase his inventory of avocados, buying them for cash and improving his profits.

He is separated, but he is the father of three children who occasionally accompany  him and help with his business.

loans.use: to buy more avocados and increase his inventory

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 47 years old and a married mother, blessed with two kids. Her main source of income is from growing rice on one hectare of farmland, and from her pineapple plantation. 

This is not the first loan for Pheap and her joint borrowers in the same group of three with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan enabled her to improve her lifestyle and make it better than before, and she has repaid her past loan with success. 

For this cycle, she is the leader of her group.  She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She strongly believes that she can earn more income and make their living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Joshlyn

texts.en:
Joshlyn started The Write Fit through infusing her passion for creative writing with fashion. She loved the word play and sentiment of greeting cards and was also tired of the same old graphic tees sold by big-box stores, so she decided to create her own lifestyle t-shirt company with unique shirts, made for the lives of everyday people. 

After two years in the making, The Write Fit’s online store launched last summer, featuring ten categories of shirts with fun and creative catch-phrases printed on the front. Unique shirt categories like ‘Soundtrack to Life’, ‘Ordinary People’ and ‘Live Write’ are designed to appeal to a wide variety of people with different interests and personalities. 

The Write Fit provides Joshlyn with the creative expression she’s always wanted in a job. She pulls inspiration from all over, including daily activities and random happenings in her life, Googling every idea to make sure it hasn’t already been done, before putting the slogan on a product of her own. 

Many of the challenges Joshlyn has faced in starting her business has revolved around tracking inventory and knowing how much inventory to produce. This Kiva loan of $3,250 will help Joshlyn to purchase more inventory, set up a tracking system for sales and invest in more marketing for her budding business.  

In the future, Joshlyn would like to expand locally and start selling at fashion boutiques. She currently runs everything on her own, but wants to eventually hire assistants and seek out interns that have a creative hand to help bring new ideas to the table. Her goal is to set up a creative process that will allow her more time to come up with new designs on a monthly basis.

Check out The Write Fit at: http://shopthewritefit.com

loans.use: to purchase more inventory, set up a tracking system for sales and invest in more marketing for her budding business.

loans.name: Junk Girls, Llc Group

texts.en:
The Junk Girls was founded in 2009 and born out of a combination of art therapy for Jenny and Melissa’s love for all things handmade. After our 18+ years working in corporate jobs that included Netflix and eBay, our vision is to put our collective skill sets together and do something meaningful that would make a difference for both us and others. We believe that everything has value, no matter how damaged it is, and we enjoy giving new life to things that might otherwise be overlooked or thrown away, which as a metaphor, fits our lives perfectly. 

We are social entrepreneurs who work within the emerging new industrial revolution of Makers/Do-It-Yourself Micro-Manufacturing. Considered innovators by many, we are utilizing our background in art and design to create inventive ways to repurpose what some call junk into beautiful art, jewelry and home décor products, while enabling ourselves and others to heal during and by this process. 

Our products and market:
We have developed a number of product lines under the categories of a “Good, Better, Best” pricing structure. This enables us to sell to a varied customer base, with the overarching Junk Girls brand and artist cache attached to each area.

Our main product under the “Good” category and our primary wholesale line are our metal-stamped products, which make up 40% of our gross revenue. Currently, Melissa hand-stamps words and phrases on recycled and repurposed metals, to include silver-plate, brass and copper. These items are then packaged and sold as necklaces, key rings, cuffs, cheese markers, wedding forks, dangles and charms. 

How a Kiva loan will help us:
The manufacturing of our metal-stamped products is created 100% by hand. This is our number one area of growth, with our retailers requesting higher product volume than we can supply. By automating the process, we can build products at least 4-5 times faster to meet the market demand. A Kiva loan will help us with the first round of tools in building the metal stamping automation process.

loans.use: to purchase tools used in building the metal stamping automation process.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old, married, and has one school-age child. She lives in Poblacion, Sibutad where she personally operates her little sari-sari store (variety store). Selling a variety of items makes Joyce a meager income of 4,000 PHP a month.

Joyce became a member of Paglaum Coop in 2013. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and soap.
  
Joyce has set aside an amount for savings, which she deposited to Paglaum. She deeply wishes to see her child finish her studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and soap.

loans.name: Ángela Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora Ángela Carolina,  labora  en un centro hospitalario desempeñándose como operadora de micro computadora desde hace veinte años, con horario de 7 am a 4pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario,  realiza esta labor para la manutención de sus 3 hijos y su querida Mamá  siendo madre y padres para ellos.   

Doña Ángela solicito a Ceprodel crédito para la compra de cerámica y mano de obra, para darles  mejor comodidad a sus lindos hijos, y  sueña con la preparación profesional de ellos.
texts.en:
Ángela Carolina has been working at a medical center as a micro computer operator for 20 years. She works from 7 a.m. til 4 p.m. from Monday through Friday so she can provide for her three children and beloved mother. She is both mother and father to her children.

Ángela is asking Ceprodel for this loan so that she can buy ceramic tile and pay for the labor to install it, making her house more comfortable for her beautiful children. Her dream is for her children to prepare themselves for professional careers.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile and pay for labor.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
Claudia es madre de un hijo pequeño al cual ama con todas sus fuerzas y desea darle siempre lo mejor, por esta razón se dedica a la venta de helados; desde hace algunos meses viene ejerciendo esta actividad gracias al apoyo de una hermana que le regalo un enfriador de helados para que ella pudiera trabajar desde su casa y así estar pendiente de su hijo.
Los helados los vende todos los días desde una pequeña ventana en su casa. Ella solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a su clientes, entre estos productos están galletas de helado, chococonos, conchas y cucuruchos; productos que son muy populares en esa región y comprar insumos desechables como vasos y platos.
Su mayor anhelo es ver su negocio crecer y de esta forma tener un local donde vender otros tipos de helados como artesanales y batidos.
texts.en:
Claudia is the mother of a little son whom she loves with all her might and to whom she always wants to give the best. For this reason, she sells ice cream. She has had this business for several months, thanks to the support of a sister, who gave her an ice cream cooler so that she could work from her home and thus tend to her son.

She sells the ice cream every day from a little window in her house. She is applying for a loan to stock her business and thus offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Among these products are ice cream cones and other packaged ice cream products that are very popular in this region. She will also buy disposable supplies such a cups and plates.

Her greatest wish is to see her business grow and in this way have a shop where she can sell other types of ice cream, such as home-made ice cream, and smoothies.

loans.use: to buy a stock of ice cream and disposable supplies

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de 71 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado de estudio, por la falta de escuelas en el tiempo que ella se estaba creciendo no tuvo acceso al aprendizaje, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, es quien se encarga de llevar los granos básicos al hogar, tienen hijos pero ya no viven con ellos cada quien ha hecho su vida aparte. Nadie más vive con ellos.        	

Se dedica a los oficios domésticos, desde toda su vida se a dedicado al hogar, su mamá fue la que le enseño todo lo relacionado al cuido de la casa animales y su matrimonio, por lo que hasta hoy conserva esa enseñanza, no tiene más actividades a las que se dedique, por hoy son sus hijos los que la sostiene con los gastos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, comprara todos los materiales de construcción arena, hierro, cemento  y la mano de obra, el mejoramiento será el tener una casa más digna donde vivir. La necesidad satisfecha es el poder realizar su proyecto de construcción. 
 
Los sueños que tiene son el poder tener una vivienda digna donde al fallecer le quede a sus hijos, espera que sus hijos sigan las buenas enseñanzas que desde pequeños les inculco.
texts.en:
Teresa is 71 years old and did not attend school due to a lack of schools when she was growing up, so she didn’t’ have access to education.  She is married and her husband is a farmer; he takes the basic grains home.  They have children but they no longer live at home and have their own lives now.  No one else lives with them.  

She cares for the home and has done so all her life.  Her mother taught her everything about caring for the home, the animals, and her marriage and she keeps this knowledge.  She doesn’t have any other activities and her children help her with her expenses.

She is asking for this loan to improve her home and buy building materials such as sand, iron bars, cement, and pay for labor so she can have a more dignified home in which to live.  She will accomplish this through her building project.

Her dream is to be able to have a dignified home that she can leave to her children and she hopes that her children will keep the knowledge that she has taught them since they were young.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic ingredients such as wafers, fritters, cheese and sweet sauces; additional inputs for his business

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en: Phea, 31, is a villager from Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, she grows rice and sells fish. Phea is a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fish for resale and to pay for shipping costs. She believes that she can earn a higher income than before. With the extra income, she plans to buy a decent motorbike to transport fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale and to pay for shipping costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité mujeres unidas se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural, donde todas las señoras se están esforzando por sus familias, y también para poder ayudar a su comunidad, la cual aún está muy carente.
Una de ellas es Estelvina, quien se dedica a la actividad de cría y venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas, y de esta forma es que está luchando para tener un poco de ingresos para poder ayudar a sus familias. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y por sobre todo muy luchadora
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con la cría de sus animales y tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Mujeres Unidas” [Women United] was formed in the city of Santaní. It is in a predominantly rural zone where all the women work very hard for their families, and to be able to help their community, which is still very poor. 

One of the women, Estelvina, works raising and selling, and butchering farmyard animals such as chickens, pigs, and sheep; and in this way she endeavors to earn a small income so that she can support her family.

She is a woman who is very industrious, and above all, she is a fighter. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of animal feed, so that she can continue raising her animals, and have the income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 49 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children of whom two are now adults and four are still school-aged. 

Maria Fe has been engaged in a fish vending business for 12 years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She is also supported by her husband. She has requested a loan to be used as additional capital in purchasing fish for sale.  Maria Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maria Fe hopes to expand her fish vending business.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital in purchasing fish for sale

loans.name: Luisito

texts.en:
Luisito previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their Jeepney. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Luisito would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Jeepney and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luisito dreams of expanding his business and hopes that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week. This is also where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre luchador que no le teme a ensuciarse las manos para progresar y conseguir lo que desea, pues desde hace 30 años de dedica a la mecánica de motos en un local que tiene ubicado en la autopista de Marinilla, Colombia.
Allí realiza todo tipo de arreglos mecánicos y se ha caracterizado siempre por su responsabilidad, honestidad y buen servicio con sus clientes.
El desea que su negocio sea reconocido, por eso pide un apoyo económico para hacerle algunas mejoras físicas a su local, además desea comprar herramientas para realizar trabajos más rápidamente y satisfacer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es continuar en el negocio de la mecánica y extender su negocio hasta otros municipios, así podrá generar más empleos y tendrá más y mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is a determined man who isn't afraid to get his hands dirty in order to move forward and get what he wants. He has been a motorcycle repair mechanic for 30 years, and has a shop located by the highway in Marinilla, Colombia.

There he does all types of mechanical work and has always been known for his responsibility, honesty and the good service he gives his customers. He wants his business to be well known, and that is why he is asking for financial support to do some physical improvements to his shop. He also wishes to buy tools to carry out jobs more quickly and satisfy his customers. 

His greatest dream is to continue in his repair business and expand it to other municipalities. This way he will be able to create more jobs, and have more revenues and better income.

loans.use: To carry out site improvements and buy tools.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello, y a través de las capacitaciones ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Herminia es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura, con lo cual ayuda a su familia. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, que a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Poco a poco  gracias a su empeño está mejorando su vida y quiere seguir trabajando, es por eso que está pidiendo este préstamo, para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, y demás, y así seguir con su trabajo, como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Pyapy Mbarete" is in its second loan cycle of the Women's Committee Program where everyone has committed themselves to working and to helping each other to get ahead. They also make up part of the poverty elimination program where each one of them is completing a poverty elimination survey in order to determine everyone's situation and, along with the training sessions, continue to improve their living conditions accordingly.

Herminia is part of this group and makes a living as a seamstress with which she helps her family. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who has been helping her family and loved ones through her effort and sacrifice. Thanks to her persistence she is improving her life little by little and wants to keep working. It is for this reason that she is asking for this loan, to be able to purchase fabrics, thread, elastic etc., and thus continue with the work she has been doing.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and that it will be very helpful for her.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic and other supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Lucia,  es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, propietaria de una farmacia, que está ubicada en su casa particular.
Ella está casada y su esposo también trabaja por cuenta propia, ayudándose  mutuamente para solventar los gastos de la casa. Son personas muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de medicamentos para poder surtir su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking and enterprising person.  She owns a pharmacy, which is located in her home.  She is married and her husband also works at his own business.  Together they meet their household expenses.  They are hardworking people and above all, enterprising.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of medicines to stock her business.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru:
Ахмадчон способный молодой человек, который в данный момент учится в ВУЗе. Ему 20 лет. Он живет с родителями в городе Худжанд. Его мать швея, а отец работает в одной частной фирме. 
Ахмадчон одновременно учится и работает. Он после занятий работает маляром. Ахмадчон самостоятельный молодой человек. Он не хочет быть обузой родителям и старается обеспечивать себя сам и еще немного помогать семье. Год за годом цена на образование повышается и в связи с этим Ахмадчон решил оплатить за трехлетний учебный год вперед. Для этой цели Ахмадчон просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. Ахмадчон учится в первом курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета, по специальности "Финансы и кредит". Он учится прилежно и в будущем хочет стать хорошим специалистом своей области.
texts.en:
Ahmadjon is a capable young man, who currently takes higher education. He is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in the city of Khujand. His mother is a seamstress and his father has his own company. Ahmadjon both works and studies. He works as a painter after the studies. 

Ahmadjon is an independent young man. He does not want to be a burden for his parents and strives to support himself and also help his family a little. Year after year the price for education has increased and due to this, Ahmadjon decided to pay for his third year of education in advance. With this goal, Ahmadjon requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar. 

Ahmadjon studies in the first year at the Khujand State University, specializing in Finance and Credit. He studies diligently and in the future he would like to become a good specialist in his field.

loans.use: to pay tuition in advance for his third year at the university

loans.name: Carla Vanessa

texts.es:
La Señora Carla Vanessa, es madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo y  labora  en un instituto  desempeñándose como conserje  desde hace diez  años, con horario de 6am a 3pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario,  realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.   

Carla Vanessa  se acercó a  Ceprodel  a solicitar un crédito para  comprar  una refrigeradora y darle una mejor atención a su pequeño hijo ya que ella tiene que trabajar duramente  para  poder  darle  su  preparación profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Vanessa is a single mother of three children, only one of whom is in her care. She has worked at an institute as a janitor for the past ten years from 6am to 3pm, Monday through Friday. She does this work to support her home.

Carla Vanessa approached Ceprodel to apply for a loan in order to buy a refrigerator and take better care of her young son, because she has to work hard to be able to give him his professional training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Pyapy Mbarete, que significa brazo fuerte, ya que todas las integrantes están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando, a través de la lucha que están haciendo. Además de ello forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
 Vanesa es una de las integrantes, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, es empleada doméstica y también se dedica a hacer bordados. Se destaca por ser una mujer muy sacrificada, que está saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos y agujas, para poder seguir con sus bordados, y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida,  sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
This group is called Pyapy Mbarete, which means strong arm, since all of the members are putting forth their best effort to improve themselves through their struggle.  They are part of the poverty elimination program, which can improve their living conditions and those of their families.  

Vanesa is one of the group members.  She is a hardworking person.  She works as a maid and also makes embroidery.  She is known for being someone who makes sacrifices, since she is moving forward with many sacrifices.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of thread and needles to continue with her embroidery and improve her living conditions and her income to help her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they are all receiving to be able to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase thread and needles for embroidery.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия проживает в селе района Спитамен. Она занимается сельским хозяйством. Вот уже 5 лет как она выращивает зерновые культуры - пшеницу и рис. Зулфия сеет урожай на 2 га участке земли, который она арендует.   
Зулфие 32 года. Муж занимается предпринимательской деятельностью, все дети (их трое) учатся в сельской школе. Зулфия работает на своей участке земли с раннего утра до сумерки. Она трудится усердно, чтобы потом пожинать плоды своих трудов. В данный момент Зулфия нуждается в кредите в размере 2000 долларов США. На эту сумму она хочет приобрести семена, минеральные и химические удобрения, а также оплатить за услуги тракториста. Этот кредит важен Зулфие для продолжения деятельности.
texts.en:
Zulfiya lives in a village in the Spitamen region. She works with agriculture. She has grown field crops for 5 years already - wheat and rice. Zulfiya sows crops on a plot of land of 2 hectares, which she rents. 

Zulfiya is 32 years old. Her husband is a business man and all the children (they have three) go to the village school. Zulfiya works on her land from early morning to dusk. She strives hard in order to later reap the fruits of her work. 

Currently Zulfiya needs a loan in the amount of 2,000 US dollar. For this sum she would like to purchase seeds, mineral and chemical fertilizers, and also to pay for a tractor service. This loan is important for Zulfiya to continue her work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral and chemical fertilizers and pay for a tractor service

loans.name: Tukad Kemiri Group

texts.en:
The Tukad Kemiri group, represented by Ni Nyoman, has made their payments on time.  During the loan period the pigs grow fat and healthy.  They keep the piglets for 5-6 months and then sell it to a big buyer or breeder from another village.

Ni Nyoman has been successful maintaining her pigs by feeding with super quality feed that allow the pigs can grow fat and healthy.  Ni Nyoman can sell them for a satisfactory price and the profit from this business is uses to purchase additional piglets, increasing their pig population. The profit from her business will make her dream come true of making her kitchen more spacious.

This is the third loan for the Tukad Kemiri group.  They still need financial support of their business until they are able to continue business with their own capital.  With every sale of pork, they are saving to increase their capital.  Ni Nyoman uses the loan to purchase local piglets that she plans to sell for pig barbeque ("Babi Guling" in bahasa).  She hopes her new plan will be more successful.

The group has a new member bringing their total group size to 6.

loans.use: to purchase local piglets.

loans.name: Oybi

texts.ru: Ойби жительница одного не из многонаселенного пункта района Вахш. Ей 49 лет. Она мама двоих детей. Ее сыновьям 18 и 15 лет. Ее дети любят животных и занимаются животноводством. Сельскохозяйственные культуры являются основным источником дохода для жителей аграрной страны. Ойби выбрала иную деятельность. Она занимается шитьем национальной одежды на заказ. Ойби любит свою работу и продолжает заниматься данной деятельностью около 5 лет. Она решила отремонтировать дом, потому что уже много лет она не имела возможности сделать ремонт. Он сейчас ремонт является более чем необходимым для ее семьи. Из-за нехватки достаточной суммы средств Ойби просит кредит. Поддержите Ойби
texts.en:
Oybi is a resident of one of the less populous areas of the Vakhsh region. She is 49 years old. She is the mother of two children. Her sons are 18 and 15 years old. Her children love animals and work with livestock breeding. Agriculture is the main source of income for the residents of this agrarian country. 

Oybi chose another job. She works with sewing national clothing on order. Oybi loves her work and has worked with this activity for around 5 years. She decided to renovate her home, because she was not able to do this for many years. Currently renovation is more than necessary for the whole family. As she does not have sufficient funds to do the repair, Oybi requests a loan. Please support Oybi.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадине 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Мадины - средне-специальное образование. Животноводством Мадина стала заниматься с 2003 года с 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве у Мадины имеются: 1 дойная корова и 1 теленок, также Мадина вместе с мужем занимается выращиванием фасоли и клевера на приусадебном участке мерою 0,50 ГА. У Мадины имеются свои постоянные покупатели ее продукции.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мадина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы. Доходы от кредита Мадина планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на покупку легкового авто.
texts.en: Madina is 27 and married with one son. She has a specialist high school education and started working in animal husbandry in 2003 with 5,000 KGS. She now has one milking cow and one calf, as well as a 0.5 hectare plot of land on which she and her husband grow beans and clover. Madina has regular customers for her products, with a monthly income of 12,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy a cow. Madina plans to use profits from the loan into further increasing the amount of livestock she has, and wants to save toward purchasing a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sovann Group

texts.en:
Sovann is 24 years old and lives in Pursat Province in Cambodia. She is married and has one child.  She and her husband are farmers.  

Sovann is the leader of a borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will improve her family's living conditions. In the future, Sovann hopes to expand her farm and help her child obtain higher education.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  está en su 3° ciclo del programa de comité, donde además forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual y a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar e ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernardita quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que en muchos aspectos de su vida debe mejorar, pero es por lo que ella se está esforzando. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a una despensa que monto con mucho esfuerzo, y que poco a poco está creciendo y mejorando, y que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre va a su negocio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, panificados, lácteos, enlatados y otros, y de esa forma poder surtir su negocio, y ofrecer a su clientela la variedad que siempre buscan.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Unidas" ["Women United"] group was formed in the city of San Lorenzo. It is in its third loan cycle in the communal bank program. The group is also participating in the poverty elimination program, and through the poverty elimination survey, the group members can understand their individual situation, and work or continue to improve accordingly. 

One of the members is Bernardita, who in the most recent survey showed a level of poverty within level one; that is to say, many aspects of her life need to be improved, but this is why she is making an effort. Among the work that she does, she reports that she operates a neighborhood store, which she set up with great effort, and which gradually has been growing and improving. She has attracted very good customers who always come to her business. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in buying vegetables, meat, bread, dairy products, canned goods and other items. In this way she will be able to stock her store and offer her customers the variety that they are always looking for.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bread, dairy products, canned goods and other items to sell.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: La señora Demetria tiene 59 años de edad es una persona responsable y trabajadora, no tiene  hijos que dependen de ella y vive en el domicilio de su hermana en la ciudad de Monteagudo. Su principal actividad es el cultivo de papa como también es ama de casa, trabaja con ayudantes en la producción agrícola para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos en los que incurre en su diario vivir. Ahora requiere un crédito para que así pueda realizar la compra de insumos y preparación de terreno agrícola para la siembra de papa. De esta forma podrá realizar la siembra de dos hectáreas de papa y así lograra aumentar sus ingresos económicos para mantener su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Demetria is 59 years of age and is a responsible and hardworking person. She doesn't have dependent children, and she lives at her sister's home in the city of Monteagudo.

Her main economic activity is potato farming. As she is also a home-maker, she works with helpers in agricultural production in order to cover the costs of food, clothing, basic services and other costs that she incurs in her daily life.

Now she needs a loan so that she can buy inputs and prepare the farming land for planting potatoes. In this way, she will be able to plant two hectares of potatoes and thus increase her earnings to support her home and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inputs and to prepare the agricultural plot for planting potatoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been living in Massachusetts for most of his life, and, when confronted with the economic downturn and diminished job markets, he chose to take matters into his own hands. He founded Cape Cod Fish Share,  and currently employs four men and his son who venture into the ocean to catch fresh fish and lobster to serve to clients on a weekly basis. 

Programs that he sells include one week of fish, 2.5 pounds total or even one week, four cull lobsters. Pricing varies depending on the market, and due to close proximity to the ocean, his business thrives during the fishing seasons. However, he needs a loan to keep the business going throughout the off-season. 

Help David get his fresh seafood business off the ground!

loans.use: to cover seasonal start-up costs

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is thankful for the financial assistance that has been extended to her. A previous loan enabled her to buy spare parts and accessories for her transportation business. In addition to improving her business, the loan provided income to help educate her children and pay for everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

Eufemia would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her Jeepney unit.* Profits from her business will help her sustain her family's daily needs and pay for her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eufemia dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to improve her living standards. She meets with her co-fellowship members** every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the word of God that she studies.

* Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines to defend themselves against the invading Japanese. Through their ingenuity, Filipinos modified the Jeep into a 20-seat Jeepney. The vehicles are open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance for her Jeepney

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn is a businesswoman from Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is  32 years old and is married with two school-age children. Marelyn has a little  sari-sari (convenience store) business, which she has managed for 10 years now. She last reached out to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for financial help in 2009. She has religiously paid all her obligations in a timely manner. 

In need of more capital to restock her store with cases of soft drinks and bags of rice, Marelyn applied for another loan. The profit she earns from her business will be saved to Paglaum for the purpose of educating her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with soft drinks and rice

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirty-five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Blanca Doris

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer humilde que vive en el campo con su esposo y sus dos hijos, aunque toda la vida se ha dedicado al trabajo doméstico y cuidado de su familia, desde hace 5 años se decidió a iniciar con su propio negocio.
Ella tiene tres unidades de negocio que son la producción de ganado, producción de huevos con gallinas ponedoras y la producción de pollos de engorde para el consumo. Ella decide empezar con su negocio al ver la necesidad de aportar con los ingresos del hogar y así tener un sustento diario.
Ella alterna todas estas labores con las actividades del hogar y a pesar de que sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, el campo demanda mucho tiempo y dedicación.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar dos terneros para el levante y gallinas ponedoras. Esto le permitirá gozar de un incremento en sus ingresos y así garantizar el mantenimiento de su actividad.
Su mayor sueño es convertir su negocio en un gran modulo productivo en cual ofrecer más empleos y generar utilidades.
texts.en:
Blanca is a humble woman who lives in the country with her husband and her two children.  

Although her whole life has been dedicated to domestic work and caring for her family, five years ago, she decided to start her own business.  She has three parts to her business, which are producing livestock, producing eggs with laying hens, and producing chickens to fatten for consumption.  She decided to start her business after seeing the necessity of helping with the household income and having their daily needs met.  She balances all of this work with her household activities.  Even though her children are now adults, the country demands a lot of time and dedication.

She is requesting this loan to purchase two calves and laying hens.  This will allow her to benefit from an increase in her income and guaranty the maintenance of her work.  

Her dream is to make her business into a large production unit that can offer jobs and be useful.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and laying hens.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en:
Hing, a young mother of two little children, is a villager from the Kampong Cham province in the Dambae district.  Hing is a cassava grower and a grocer; it is the profession that she has occupied for seven years.  Including this loan, Hing has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loans, with successful repayments, enabling her to improve her lifestyle better than before.  

For this cycle, she teamed up to form a group of three to obtain a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.  She strongly believes that she can improve her yield better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, insecticide, fertilizer, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Junaidullo

texts.ru:
Чунайдулло жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-х детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Чунайдулло живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Чунайдулло также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание Чунайдулло занимается своим делом. Он работает мастером в фирме по производству пластиковых окон  дверей. Также Чунайдуло подрабатывает строителем.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход.  Сейчас жена  Чунайдулло очень сильно болеет. Ей необходимо пройти лечение в дорогостоящей больнице. Для этого ему необходимы денежные средства, но в данный момент он не имеет достаточно денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку необходимых медикаментов для лечения своей жены, а также на частичный ремонт  своей квартиры. Чунайдулло очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Junaidullo is a good-humored and hardworking man of the age of 34 years. He is married and has four children. He turned to Arvand because he knew that it was possible to receive financial support. 

Junaidullo lives with his family in a village. He does not have higher education, as he did not get the opportunity to study at the university due to financial problems in his family. Junaidullo's wife does also not have an education and she is a housewife. She does household work and raises the children. In order to have an income for buying food, Junaidullo works. He works with manufacturing plastic windows and doors. Junaidullo also works as a builder. He gets a good income from this business. 

Currently Junaidullo's wife is very sick. She needs to undergo treatment at a costly hospital. For this, Junaidullo needs money, however currently he does not have sufficient funds. Therefore he turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase necessary medication for the treatment of his wife and also to repair his house. Junaidullo hopes very much for a good result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a medicine

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Las Piedras.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo seis  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. 
Doña Cruz realiza el crédito para un negocio que tienen con su hijo, ellos se dedica a la venta de frutas, legumbres y mariscos, muy de mañana su hijo se desplaza hasta el mercado de mayoristas a comprar las frutas,  legumbres y el pescado para luego recorrer la ciudad en su carro,  también en su casa donde doña Cruz vende a personas cercanas  y con lo cual se gana algo para el bien de su familia. Llevan 9 años dedicados al comercio  y gracias a esto ellos salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y mariscos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the loan group Las Piedras (The Rocks) meet every two weeks in the Las Piedras sector of the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, known for it traditional culture, for the happiness of its people, and for its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals.

Señora Cruz, who is 55 years old, lives in this place. Her husband died a number of years ago, but from this relationship she has six adult children, two of whom still live with her.

Doña Cruz is taking out the loan for a business that she has with her son. They sell fruits, vegetables, and shellfish. Her son goes to the wholesale markets very early in the morning to buy the fruits, vegetables, and fish to then go through the city in his car. Doña Cruz also sells from her home to people who live nearby, and with that she earns something for the well being of her family. They have been in business for 9 years, and thanks to this, they are getting ahead.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables, and shellfish. She has been in the loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because of the help and benefits that the institution offers them. Her dream is to have a shop in her house.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and shellfish

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a farmer from Oyan, Sibutad. She is 47 years old, married with two adult-age children.  Her primary crop is rice production that has been going for years. She is a constant help to her husband who is also a farmer. 

Luzviminda has signed up as a member with PMPC and has taken previous loans already. Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. 

Luzviminda wishes to sustain their farming activities and save more for times of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice field

loans.name: Charina Rosario

texts.en:
Charina Rosario previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of eggs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stocks of eggs needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Charina Rosario dreams that her business will stay longer and stronger, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of eggs needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she utilized in buying gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her pineapple farming business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcela hopes that her business will last longer, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her pineapple farming business.

loans.name: Ananita

texts.en:
Ananita is 59 years old and widowed with nine children, one of whom is in school. Ananita works very hard to provide for them.

Ananita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ananita has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Ananita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to continue with his sales business.

loans.name: Pot's Group

texts.en:
Pot, 60, lives with her husband in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has seven children. She has struggled to feed and care for her family by farming for 16 years, while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 80,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 50,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Pot and her group member have been members of VisionFund for one cycle already, and they completely paid back their loan. Pot wisely and successfully used the loan from VisionFund to relieve her family’s financial burden. She is now leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Chanthy is a 61-year-old mother of eight children. To make a living, she grows cassava and rainy season rice as the main business to get a decent income. 

For 10 years involvement in current business, she is able to earn up to 41,000 KHR per day. This is the sixth loan for Chanthy and fifth loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan with success, and it has improved her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor cost. She strongly believes that she can gain a good income better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and labor costs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has an abaca (fiber from abaca palm leaf, used for handicraft production) weaving business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Fe is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Leyda María

texts.es:
La Joven Leyda María  trabaja  en uno de los colegio de la Ciudad de León desempeñando el cargo de docente  desde hace ocho años, la Joven  sale de su casa de habitación 6:30 am, inicia sus labores 6:45 am  finalizando  a las 12:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  por la tarde  dedica dos hora para la planificación de sus labores del día siguiente, la joven Leyda María es  madre de dos  hijos con edades 8 y 6 años.

La joven Leyda se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito  el cual implemento para gastos Médicos como es consulta y medicamentos, así lograr la pronta recuperación de su salud y continuar sus labores cotidianas al igual con el cuido de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The young woman Leyda María has worked as a teacher in one of the high schools in the city of León for the last eight years. She leaves her home at 6:30 am, starts working at 6:45 am and finishes at 12:00 pm, with this same schedule from Monday to Friday. In the afternoon she spends two hours planning her work for the following day. Leyda María is the mother of two children ages eight and six.

Leyda came to Ceprodel to ask for a loan that she will use for medical expenses such as consultations and medications, as well as getting her health back soon, continuing with her daily work and caring for her small children.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, que gracias al trabajo de todas ya están en su quinto ciclo. Además de recibir capacitaciones forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indiciadores podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cesaria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas y de toda clase, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante. Ella comenta que se tiene que sacrificar mucho ya que sus ventas son ambulantes y tiene mucha competencia, pero que de igual manera está luchando por poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  prendas variadas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y también ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
There are 17 women in this communal bank, and thanks to their hard work they are already in their 5th loan cycle.  In addition to receiving training, they are participating in the Poverty Elimination Program.  By taking a survey with 50 indicators they will be able to understand the financial situation of each and every one of the members, and so can work to make progress.  

One of the members of this group is Cesaria, who has a business selling a variety of all types of garments.  She is a very hardworking woman who, with her sacrifice and efforts, is getting ahead.  She states that she has to sacrifice a lot, because she sells on the street and there is a lot of competition.  However, she is striving to help her family and give them everything she was not able to have.

Cesaria is requesting this loan to buy a variety of garments to sell.  This will enable her to carry out her business plan, which will help her to increase her income so that she can help her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy a variety of garments to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 29 años, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 
Comenta que desde los 14 años de edad empezó a salir a vender las colchas que ellos mismos producen con su mamá, después de 6 años se independizó y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia.
Él lleva los productos artesanales de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Villa Elisa y Asunción y se transporta en su automóvil que gracias a este trabajo logró comprarse y también tiene una linda casita.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hamacas, frazadas y sábanas puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y quiere poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes, y también agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 29 years old, and he is single. He lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. He says that he began going out to sell quilts that he and his mother make themselves when he was 14 years old.  After 6 years he became independent and started working on his own. 

He carries artisanal products from the zone to the cities of Villa Elisa and Asunción in order to sell them. He transports them in his automobile that he has been able to purchase thanks to this work; and he also has a pretty little house. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of hammocks, blankets, and sheets, because he has many orders for these products and he wants to be able to meet his customers’ requests. Also, he appreciates the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks, blankets, and sheets.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from rice retailing and fish vending. Susana is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khmet's Group

texts.en:
Khmet is 42 years old and married. She is blessed with one child. For her family, two hectare of rice cropping is the only source of income, which generates currently her about 23,600 KHR, after the 10 years involvement in current business. 

Khmet has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages with a successful repayment of her past loan, and her living condition is getting better than before. 

Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, weeding, and transplanting fees, and to buy insecticides for her crop. 

She strongly hopes that she can gain a good income better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, and transplanting fees, and to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Chantha is now 39 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Chantha and her husband are farmers who grow tobacco, and sometimes work for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 19 years, they are able to make a daily earning of 28,000 KHR and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.
 
This is the first loan for Chantha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, she is going to use this loan to pay for labor fees, and use a portion of it to spend on transportation. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend and grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: A mother in her mid-forties, Mom is married and blessed with three children, one of whom is in school. To overcome the financial burden in her household, Mom does cassava farming and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been in her business for ages, and it has returned her about 41,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Mom and the fourth loan for her joint borrower. Mom has repaid her past loan with success, and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. As the leader of this group, Mom will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, labor costs, insecticide and potash. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, labor costs, insecticide and potash

loans.name: Evelina Luz

texts.es: Evelina es una aplicada mujer que hace 9 años realizo un curso en una entidad de Colombia en culinaria, desde ese entonces como en la ciudad que radica no había muchas oportunidades de trabajo, decidió mudarse de ciudad y aventurarse en un nuevo sueño, comenzar su vida de 0, aun sabiendo que hacia donde se dirigía no tenía nadie cerca, pero esto no fue impedimento para esta soñadora mujer que empaco en sus maletas un poco de ropa y gran ambición de salir delante, de demostrar que tenía todo lo necesario para crear su empresa y triunfar en la vida. Con la ayuda de algunos microcréditos logro establecer un pequeño negocio de venta de pulpa de frutas que distribuye por diferentes restaurantes de la ciudad, aparte también realiza banquetes para toda clase de eventos pues es bien sabido pro sus clientes que su sazón no tiene comparación, actualmente presenta una dificultad y es que no puede abarcar muchos clientes dado que no tiene muchos implementos en su negocio, por lo que su volumen de ingresos no pueden aumentar. Trabaja con una persona y juntas tiene un gran sueño y es poder montar una casa de eventos con la que espera tener gran éxito y así darle la vida que soñó a su pequeña hija quien es la gran inspiración de su sabor en las comidas
texts.en: Evelina is a determined woman who took a culinary course 9 years ago from an organization in Colombia. After that, because there were not many work opportunities in the city where she comes from, she decided to move to a different city and pursue the adventure of a new dream. She started her life over from zero, even though she knew that where she was heading she didn't have anyone close to her, but that was not an impediment for this woman full of dreams. In her suitcases, she packed a little bit of clothing as well as the great ambition to get ahead, to demonstrate that she has what it takes to create a business and succeed in life. With the help of some microloans, she succeeded in establishing a small business selling fruit pulp. She distributes the pulp to various restaurants in the city. In addition, she offers catered meals for all types of events, since it is well-known among her customers that her seasoning has no comparison.
