Currently, however, she is facing a challenge -- she cannot take on many customers because she doesn't have a lot of equipment for her business, and thus her income level cannot increase. She is working with another person, and together they have a great dream: to establish a venue for special events, which they hope will be a great success. In this way, Evelina will be able to provide the life she dreams of for her little daughter, who is the great inspiration behind her flavorful dishes.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to expand her business and serve more customers.

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KANKELE est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savons, de chaussures, de tabac et de beignet.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe KANKELE sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AWA  assise au milieu est une vendeuse de tabac en poudre. Elle compte acheter des sacs de feuille de tabac chez les grossistes à Marka Coungo puis le transforme en poudre. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et à Konobougou à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 Fcfa qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kankele group is made up of married women who average 40 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Konobougou, in the Konobougou commune, which lies in the Baroueli prefecture of the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends and practise restauration businesses and trading activities, buying and selling soaps, shoes, tobacco and fritters. 

The women in this group are on their 20th group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso in an effort to satisfy their huge customer demand.

The customer, Awa, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, sells powdered tobacco. She is planning to buy sacks of tobacco leaves from wholesalers in Marka Coungo and then transform them into powder. She sells on a retail basis and for cash at her home and in Konobougou to a mixed customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy tobacco.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana Coura, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produit cosmétique, de galette et de jus.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAMOU  première personne à partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de jus. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de sucre, du sachet plastique et autre matière première sur place chez les grossistes à Fana, puis le transforme en jus de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché hebdomadaire de Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who average 31 years of age with two children each. They all live in traditional families in the Fana Coura district of Fana in the Guégnéka commune, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends and buy and sell cosmetics, pancakes and juice.

The women in this group are on their fourth group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso in an effort to satisfy their huge customer demand.

The customer, Mamou, who is on the far left of the photo, is not educated. She currently sells juice and is planning to buy 50kg of sugar, plastic sachets and other raw materials from wholesalers in Fana, which she will use to make quality juice. She sells on a retail basis and for cash at the weekly market in Fana to a mixed customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making juice.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es soltero y comenta que es dueño de una casa comercial, donde vende todo tipo de joyas, como así también de accesorios para celulares, y también la venta de saldos.
El cliente es de la zona de Encarnación, es soltero vive en alquiler.
Comenta que hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este trabajo, y que se ha hecho ya de muy buena clientela que siempre compra de él, los productos que tiene. Es un hombre muy trabajador que con esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de saldo electrónico para la venta, que le permitirá poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is from the city of Encarnacion, is single and  lives in a rental unit. He owns a commercial establishment in which he sells all types of jewelry, as well as cell phone accessories, and also, cell phone minutes.

Arnaldo has been dedicated to this type of work for more than 10 years and has established a very good clientele who always buy the products he has from him. He is a very hard-working man who with great effort and sacrifice has been improving his condition of life.

Arnaldo requests this loan to purchase enough cell phone minutes to permit him to fulfill customer demand.

loans.use: buy cell phone minutes to retail to his customers.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her direct-selling business, and it also helped in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 25,000 PHP, to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Prescilla hopes to be more successful in business and have more customers. She dreams to give her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, such as clothing and health products, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Letecia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tubeheza Group

texts.fr:
Divine  fait partie du groupe  Tubeheza  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Willy un commerçant. 
Elle a sous charge sa petite sœur qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de chaussures d’occasion depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures d’occasion  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait  avoir la capacité de faire son commerce sans recourir au crédit  et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Divine belongs to the Tubeheza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Willy, who is a trader. She is responsible for her younger sister who is studying. 

She has been selling second-hand shoes for the past 15 years and is on her seventh loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of second-hand shoes to resell, so she can earn more money.

In the coming years, she would like to sufficient financial capacity to be able to run her business without recourse to loans and also to see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of second-hand shoes to resell so she can make more money.

loans.name: Ou Yit's Group

texts.en:
Ou Yit is aged 27 years and is a young mother of two sons who are still small. She and her husband make a living through planting cassava. They have been in this business for nine years. The current business earns them about 44,000 KHR per day, and they are able to save about 20,000 KHR daily for future needs.
  
This is the second loan for Ou Yit with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ou Yit is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business, and she also hopes to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa viene de una familia humilde, su padre se dedica a la compra ventas de frutos del País, su mama se encuentra en el exterior trabajando.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, y comenta que su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en algo de la rama de su Carrera  y de esa manera ser una buena profesional,  tener un ingreso con el cual podrá ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, y que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con su carrera.
texts.en:
Clarisa comes from a humble family. Her father works buying and selling local fruits. Her mother is working abroad. 

Clarisa is studying for a degree in computer engineering. She reports that her aspiration is to complete her degree and begin working at a job related to her field. In this way she will be a successful professional and will have an income with which she can help her family. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in costs necessary for her graduation. This will be of great help for her so that she can continue on her career path.

loans.use: to pay costs toward her graduation.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Mercedes es un grupo nuevo que se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Santaní. El grupo tiene 14 integrantes, todas con muy buenas expectativas sobre los trabajos que hacen.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Veronica quien se dedica a la peluquería montada en su propia casa, además ella por la mañana trabaja en una casa de familia es muy emprendedora y guapa tiene muchos clientes, y se siente agradecida por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, con lo que podrá seguir mejorando el servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en: The Las Mercedes Committee is a new group that formed when several neighbors and friends from the City of Santaní came together.  The group has 14 members, all with great prospects in the work they do.  One of the members, Veronica, runs a salon she operates out of her own home and also works in the home of a family member in the mornings.  She is very enterprising and put-together, and has many customers.  She feels grateful for being a part of the project of this women's group.  She is seeking this loan to buy supplies for her salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and others, with which she will be able to go on improving service for her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and others

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 30 years old and married to a policeman. They have two children. To augment her spouse's income, Maribel patiently raises hogs and sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired weight. 

Her income goes for her children's school needs. Another part of the income was used as revolving capital. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy three sacks of hog feed for maintenance. This will help her hogs grow healthier which leads to higher profit upon selling. 

Someday, with patience in the hog-raising business, she will gain good profits for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of hog feed for maintenance

loans.name: El Papa Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado El Papa Francisco está en su primer ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en el programa de comité, que les permitirá poder crecer y mejorar sus vidas.
Nelly es una joven que se dedica a la manicura a domicilio y con el préstamo que pide quiere comprar esmaltes, cremas y libros en donde se puede observar diferentes tipos de diseños que uno puede aprender a pintar en las uña, y demás.
Nelly es una persona entusiasta y que tiene muchas ganas de aprender y salir adelante, todo esto para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group called "El Papa Francisco" is in its first cycle; it is a new group that has placed its hopes in the committee program, which will allow them to grow and improve their lives.

Nelly is a young woman who makes a living by doing manicures in her home. With the loan she is asking for she wants to buy nail polishes, creams, books where you can see various kinds of designs you can learn to paint on nails, and other things.

Nelly is an enthusiastic person and she has a great desire to learn and get ahead, all to be able to help her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, creams and books.

loans.name: Anamir

texts.es:
La Sra. Anamir tiene 30 años, está casado hace 4 meses con el señor Diego de 33 años, pero como pareja ya estaban viviendo juntos desde hace 8 años, tienen dos hijos, por quienes esta pareja está luchando para darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La señora Anamir se dedica a las ventas variadas desde hace 4 años, empezó con un capital que llegaron a juntar trabajando en el extranjero junto con su pareja y hoy se dedica a la venta de perfumes, bebidas, golosinas y demás.
Anamir pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, perfumes, golosinas, de este modo poder contar con más productos y dar así a sus clientes una mayor variedad y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Anamir is 30 years old. She has been married for 4 months to Diego, who is 33. However, they have been living together as a couple for 8 years. They have two children, for whom this couple is working hard to give them a dignified life without privations. 

Anamir has worked selling a variety of items for 4 years. She started with some capital that she and her partner had saved up from working abroad. Currently, she sells perfumes, beverages, snacks and other items. 

Anamir is requesting this loan to buy beverages, soft drinks, snacks and perfumes. In this way, she will have more products in stock, so she can offer her customers a broader variety and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft drinks, snacks and perfumes.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 41 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural businesses, raising pigs and farming rice in the Philippines. 

Mila requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly towards her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jobelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jobelyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Jobelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jobelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is 55 years old and married with two children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by growing rice, cassava, cashew nuts, and rubber trees. Sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current businesses bring in about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Sorn's sixth loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 36 лет. Она замужем  и имеет троих детей. Она обратилась в Арванд тогда, когда узнала о том, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Нигина живёт со своей семьей в маленькой деревушке. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как после окончания средней школы у неё не было возможности поступить в Университет из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Муж Нигины также не имеет высшего образования и работает разнорабочим.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Нигина занимается своим делом. Она работает в салоне красоты парикмахером и еще подрабатывает тем, что сдает в аренду свадебные платья. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Муж Нигина находится в РФ на заработках.  Сейчас Нигина хочет увеличить количество свадебных платьев для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку свадебных платьев. Нигина очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nigina is a cheerful and hardworking woman of 36. She is married and has three children. She has turned to Arvand because she found out she could get financial support from them. Nigina lives with her family in a small village. She doesn't have a higher education since after high school she wasn't able to apply to university because of family financial difficulties. Nigina's husband doesn't have a university education either and works as a general labourer.

In order to earn a living, Nigina works in a beauty salon as a hairdresser; she also earns good money renting wedding dresses. Nigina's husband is currently working in Russia and she wants to expand her business by increasing the number of wedding dresses she has for rent. Therefore she has turned to Arvand and wants to get a loan to purchase wedding dresses. Nigina very much hopes for a good result and thanks Arvand in advance for support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses for her dress rental business

loans.name: Duhuze Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe  Duhuze  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Deo, un chauffeur. 
Elle a sous charge 1 orphelin et 2 enfants membre de sa famille élargie tous  étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, bassin,pagnes,…) depuis  15 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pagnes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait  importer  de l’Uganda, des pagnes, du riz et du haricot et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jacqueline belongs to the Duhuze group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Deo, who is a driver.

She has been selling shop goods (rice, beans, damask fabric and "pagnes", which are brightly-colored pieces of fabric) for the past 15 years. This is her first loan from Turame and with this Kiva loan that she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of "pagnes" to resell and make more money.

In the coming years, she would like to import "pagnes", rice and beans from Uganda and also see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of "pagnes" to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 40, is a married father of one kid. He is a resident of Memot district of Kampong Cham. He runs a small grocery stall and grows cassava as the main source of income. It is the business that he has had for 10 years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sary is in his fourth-cycle loan and his co-borrower is in her second-cycle loan. The successful repayment of his past loan has enabled Sary to support his business in a timely way as well as to uplift his lifestyle better than before. 

Now, he is seeking a 2,000,000 KHR loan while his joint borrower is applying for a 1,600,000 KHR loan. As the leader, Sary will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and grocery items to sell. He strongly believes that he can gain a higher income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas, está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Actualmente están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
La Sra. Aurelia es miembro de este grupo, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas el día, hasta muy entrada la noche. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que está luchando por su familia y por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, panificados, frutas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” group is in its 8th cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank, where all the women work and help one another to move forward. They are completing the Elimination of Poverty Survey, which will make it possible for each woman to understand her living situation and be able to work accordingly. 

Señora Aurelia is a member of this group. She has a small grocery store in which she works every day from the very early hours until very late at night. She is a very unselfish woman who is fighting for her family and for her loved ones. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruit, and similar items. In this way she will be able to continue growing and helping her family, as she has been, and she is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruit, and similar items.

loans.name: Beato San Roque De Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Beato Roque De Santa Cruz está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comités, también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien al entrar al grupo se encontraba por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, pero a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo está mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Ella se dedica exclusivamente a la artesanía, bordados y croché, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, telas de ao poi, lienso y demás para poder seguir con sus bordados.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia
texts.en: Beato Roque of Santa Cruz is in its second Committees' Program loan cycle.  It is also part of the poverty elimination program, in which one of its members, María, entered when she was below the poverty line, but has since improved her situation through her hard effort and work.  She works exclusively as an artisan, doing embroidery and crochet.  She tells us that she is seeking this loan in order to be able to buy thread, Paraguayan Ao Po'i fabric, linens, and other materials to continue with her embroidery.  She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to able to continue growing and improving her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, Paraguayan Ao Po'i fabric, linens, and other materials

loans.name: Virgencita De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo virgencita de Caacupe se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la región del chaco, gracias al sacrificio de todas ya que se ayudan, y están saliendo adelante. Las 17 señoras están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, mejorando por medio de las capacitaciones.
Rocio es parte de este grupo, ella es una excelente vendedora de prendas y por medio de sus ventas es que ha ido mejorando y creciendo poco a poco. Su sueño es poder tener un gran negocio y seguir trabajando y luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
Rocio pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia y sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Virgencita de Caacupe was formed when several neighbors and friends got together from the Chaco region. Thanks to their sacrifice they help each other and are getting ahead. The 17 women are participating in the poverty elimination survey and improving through training.    

Rocio is a part of this group. She is an excellent saleswoman of clothing and through these sales she has improved and grown little by little. Her dream is to have a great business and keep working and fighting for her family and her loved ones.   

Rocio is asking for this loan to buy a variety of clothing  so she can continue selling and thus help her family and her loved ones. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó con 17 mujeres, todas ellas unidas y por sobre todo muy trabajadora, que se unieron con la idea de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido y en equipo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  9 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar.
Gloria es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la vender comidas variadas que ella misma hace, y que después sale a vender de forma ambulante. Ella es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien, su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados para hacer sus comidas, como ser carnes, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, y luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 17 women, all of them united and very hard-working. They are united around the idea of being able to help their families by working as a team. They are carrying out an inquest concerning the elimination of poverty, and 9 of them presently live below the poverty line. Consequently, they intend to continue working to improve themselves.

Gloria is one of these. Out in the streets she sells various meals that she prepares. Gloria is very good at what she does and, for that reason, things are now going well for her. Her dream is to be able to continue working and helping her family.

Gloria is requesting this loan to purchase various inputs for preparing her meals, including meat, condiments, bread products, vegetables, and other items. In this manner, she hopes to continue making her meals and struggling to improve her income.

loans.use: buy supplies for making meals, including meat, condiments, bread products, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 20 años es un joven muy estudioso y por sobre todo muy dedicado, que está estudiando la carrera de Técnico Superior en Rehabilitación.
Vive con su padre, y cuenta que su aspiración es ejercer su profesión en forma particular, creando su propio consultorio y así poder tener solvencia económica.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, que le permitirá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Victor is 20 years old. He is a studious young man that is devoted to his studies. He is pursuing a technical diploma in Rehabilitation. 

He lives with his father and his goal is to be able to work independently, establishing his own practice and achieving economic solvency.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition, which will allow him to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha es de la ciudad de Itá, es estudiante de la carrera de comercio, y comenta que se está dedicando mucho para poder ser una alumna destacada.
Ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tendrá.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Mirtha comes from the town of Ita and is a business student. She is very dedicated to her studies in order to be an outstanding student. She is making her best effort to become a professional that is useful to other people and to society as a whole. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for her graduation fees.

She thanks the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea es una señora muy sacrificada ya que está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, ya que es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
Con su trabajo ha podido criar a sus hijos, y es por ellos que está luchando, para poder darles una buena vida, y todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, que la hará realizarse como persona y como profesional y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Dorotea is a very hardworking woman; she is studying and working at the same time because it is the only way to be able to get ahead. She has been able to raise her children with her work, and it is for them that she is striving, to give them a good life and everything that she wasn't able to have. She is studying for a career in nursing, which will allow her to help her family and to be fulfilled as a person and as a professional. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her tuition, which will allow her to keep studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de familia sacrificada, su madre es empleada doméstica, una mujer muy luchadora que la está ayudando en todo lo que puede para poder estudiar.
Maria está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, que le permitirá poder ejercer la profesión de abogada, con lo que quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, como así también poder sentirse un profesional útil en la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le dará la oportunidad de seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo, luchando por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is from a sacrificing family; her mother is a domestic employee and is a fighting woman who helps Maria in every way that she can so that Maria can study. 

Maria is studying law, which will allow her to practice as a lawyer. As a lawyer she wants to be able to help her family and loved ones and will also feel like a useful professional in society. 

She is asking for this loan to pay her tuition payments, which will give her the opportunity to continue studying as she has been doing and continue to fight for a better future.

loans.use: to pay tuition payments.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 19 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, y ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patricia, quien se dedica al servicio de peluquería, que con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar y hoy en día ya le va muy bien. Su sueño es poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren trabajar por un futuro mejor.
La Sra. Patricia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de elementos para su peluquería, como ser tinte, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Activas" group is in its 19th cycle of the women's committee program. The members all work and help each other get ahead, and they make their best efforts to be able to give their loved ones everything they weren't able to have themselves.

One of the members is Patricia, who makes a living from a hair salon business that she was able to start with a lot of sacrifice. It is currently going very well for her. Her dream is to be able to keep giving her customers a good service, and also to be able to give work to other people who, like her, want to work for a better future.

Patricia is asking for this loan to buy things she needs for her hair salon like dyes, rinses, creams and other items that will help her to make her business plan a reality. This will in turn help her to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, rinses, creams and other items

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona está viviendo en la casa de una tía en la ciudad de San Pedro, ella está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo dedicada.
Sus padres son del campo y se ayudan por sus estudios. Ella está estudiando para ser técnica en enfermería, con lo que quiere ayudar a su familia y también a las personas que necesiten de su servicio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar su matrícula, como también comprar libros, y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Petrona is living in the home of an aunt in the city of San Pedro. She is studying and working at the same time. She is a very hard-working person, and above all very dedicated. 

Her parents are from the countryside, and they help her with her studies. She is studying to be a nursing technician. With this, she wants to help her family and also help people who need her services. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her tuition, and also to buy books and other items.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy books and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
El Sra. Maria es casada y se encuentra trabajando en la venta de ropas desde hace 15 años, y comenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas y también desea implementar una boutique por la demanda existente,  y ya que le está yendo muy bien.
En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y mandar  construir para su negocio propio, y de esa forma seguir luchando por mejorar su estilo de vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, lo que le servirá para poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has been working in the area of clothing sales for 15 years. She comments that her sales are going very well, and she would also like to open a boutique to satisfy the existing demand and because it is going very well for her. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and have a building constructed for her own business. In this way she will continue working hard to improve her lifestyle and help her loved ones. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of clothing to sell. This will help her to continue with her sales, increasing her income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghĩa works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Nghĩa is 60 years old, and she is married with 4 children.

Nghĩa lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nghĩa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nghĩa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Nghĩa hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 22 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for four years.

The main hardship that Loan faces in her life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. In 2012, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Loan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Khuyến

texts.en:
Khuyến is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. Her family lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Khuyến has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

In 2014, Khuyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from the group. The main hardship that Khuyến faces in her life is lack of a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Khuyến hopes her business will do well. She also hopes that she will make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Mận

texts.en:
Mận is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She uses her business to support her family in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mận works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Mận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Mận faces in her life is lack of a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Mận hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to keep her family healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She lives with her family in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Hà has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. This is her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine.

With her business profit, Hà hopes her business will improve. She also hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hưng

texts.en:
Hưng is 29 years old and he is married with two children.  He lives with his two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 

He has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. He has been involved in this business for six years.

The main hardship that Hưng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.This is Hung's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Hưng hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 29 years old.  She is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives in Tangub City with her husband and three children. He is a farmer who plants corn and bananas.

May wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
This is Aurelia, 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Aurelia operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias in addition to various hanging plants and others plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies, such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. 

Aurelia hopes to expand her business and dreams to have an abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan that he used to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for him to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ariel dreams that his business will last longer and hopes to have good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from a general store and from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business. Haidee successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and soft drink retailing. Emma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood and charcoal to sell.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Sinai's Group

texts.en: Sinai is a young father of two little children residing in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. To cover his daily cost of living he works at a construction site and does rice cropping as the main source of income. It is the business that he has had for several years. This is the second cycle loan for Sinai and the other two borrowers and the first loan for a remaining borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy construction equipment to support his occupation. He strongly believes that he can gain a good income from his job and his cash-crop.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment to support his occupation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sa Moer's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Damabe district of Kampong Chnang province, Sa Moer is 45 years old and is married. She has seven children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family she and her husband have been in growing cassava and cashew nuts for 27 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 
Sa Moer has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to improve her living’s conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Ren is 50 years old and widowed with five children. She has been working as a farmer who grows rice and beans. Engaging in this business for 30 years she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day from the current business and manage to save KHR 10,000 daily for future needs. 
This is the first loan for Ren with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now applying for a loan of KHR 3,200,000, she is going to use this loan to pay the land fee in order to grow rice and beans. She hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income to improve her family’s lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay the land fee in order to grow rice and beans

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La Sra. Biviana tiene 26  años, y está en pareja, ella  empezó vendiendo artículos de limpieza para el hogar en forma ambulante, luego ya empezó a vender  prendas de vestir y calzados deportivos a cuotas.
Actualmente cuenta con una muy buena clientela formada  y gracias a este trabajo puede mantenerse y ayudar a su madre. Biviana ha demostrado ser una persona, responsable, honesta con sus compromisos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones, buzos, zapatos entre otros, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas, ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Biviana, age 26, is in a relationship.  She started by selling cleaning items for the home in an itinerant manner.  Then she started to sell clothes and sport shoes on credit [customers pay back on installment plan].

She currently has a good customer base.  Thanks to this work she is able to support and help her mother.  Biviana has demonstrated herself to be a responsible and honest person with her commitments.  

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, sweatshirts, and shoes, among others.  With this she will be able to continue with her sales and helping her family like she is doing.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, sweatshirts, and shoes, among others.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Medalla Milagrosa 2 está en su 6º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y  ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas han ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Son todas vecinas de un mismo barrio y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Carmen es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy sacrificada y por sobre todo muy luchadora, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, con lo cual se viene ganando la vida para ayudar a su familia. Además de este trabajo ella se dedica a la costura, el cual le da un ingreso extra con el cual también ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, ganándose el sustento diario.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa 2 group is in its sixth lending cycle with the Women's Committee program, in which each member promises to work and help each other to get ahead.  They are conducting a poverty elimination survey and, thanks everyone's hard work, they have been improving their quality of life and that of their families.  They are all neighbors and provide mutual support to improve each others' lives. 

Carmen is one of the members of the group.  She is a very selfless, and above all tenacious, woman who works selling a variety of types of clothing.  This is how she makes her living and supports her family.  In addition, she also works as a seamstress, which provides her with some extra income with which she can help her family even more.  She is seeking this loan to buy clothing articles for retail, which will allow her to continue keeping up her sales and providing for her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing articles for retail

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Lorenza del Socorro,  es madre soltera de tres  hijos  de los cuales solo dos  estan a su cargo, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, gaseosas y repostería, desde hace 16 años ella ha realizado esta labor para la mantención del hogar ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos.  

Lorenza del Socorro,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la Compra de bloque, cemento, arena, piedrín zinc, perline, tornillo y mano de para la construcción de un cuarto para lograr tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lorenza del Socorro is a single mother of three children, of which she takes care of two. For the last 16 years she has worked selling drinks, sodas, and pastries. She works this job to take care of her home as she is both father and mother for her children. 

Lorenza del Socorro approached Ceprodel to request a loan that she will use to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, beams, screws and labor for the construction of another room to achieve a higher standard of living for her and her children.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, beams, screws and labor.

loans.name: Khánh

texts.en:
Mr. Khánh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Khánh is 42 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Khánh lives with his 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Khánh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Khánh has been involved in this business for 6 years.
The main hardship that Khánh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Khánh hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Antonio, se dedica a la venta de productos varios desde quince años, en un mercado de la ciudad de León donde  inicia a ofertar sus productos a su clientela desde las  6:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm el realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

El señor Sergio Antonio solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de sardina, atún, pescado seco y especie,  para ofrecerles a sus clientes ya que se aproxima la temporada de semana santa.

Sergio sueña con  mantener su negocio bien establecido, para continuar con la preparación de sus hijos que lleguen hacer grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Sergio Antonio has worked selling different products for the last 15 years in a market in the city of Leon where he works from 6:00am to 5:00pm. He works this job to sustain his home. Sergio Antonio asks for this loan from Ceprodel to buy sardines, tuna, dried fish and spices to offer to his clients as Easter Week is approaching.

Sergio dreams of maintaining a stable business so that he can continue to prepare his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy sardines, tuna, dried fish and sauces.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Robi, who is married, is a mother of one school-aged child. She is in her early thirties and makes her living by managing a tailoring business. Robi has been in this business since 2008 and is able to generate a fair monthly profit. She opens her business from 9:00 am to 8:30 pm every working day.

This is Robi's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy rolls and other tailoring materials. Robi used all of her other successfully repaid loans to buy rolls of cloth and sewing materials for her business. She managed to make a profit, which she used to cover part of her child's school fees and home food expenses. Robi dreams that one day she will be able to rent a good business venue. 

She will share this loan with her borrowing group "CHAMWINO" which includes a total of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Cẩn

texts.en:
Mr. Cẩn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. He is 60 years old and married with three children. Cẩn lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cẩn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Cẩn faces in his life is his low profit margins. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Cẩn hopes to maintain a successful business, for his business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Thước

texts.en:
Mr. Thước works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Thước is 57 years old and married with four children. He lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thước first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thước faces in his life is his low profit margins. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Thước hopes to maintain a successful business, for his business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 61 years old and blessed with five children. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to insufficient income she also buys additional fruits and vegetables that she sells in their village. She aims to continue and strengthen this business in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital she would like to avail a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to buy more stocks of cabbages, carrots, onions, eggplants, beans and leafy vegetables to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cabbages, carrots, onions, eggplants, beans and leafy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Due to financial insufficiency, Susan engages in selling snack food within her community. She is 47 and has five school age children. She and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree. In this regard, Susan wants to strengthen her business in order to earn a larger income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to resell in the local community. She is hoping that she will be able to improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Hạnh

texts.en:
Mr. Hạnh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Hạnh is 45 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Hạnh lives with his dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Hạnh has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main harship that Hạnh faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Hạnh hopes to maintain  a successful business, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to a build toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 47 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Nga is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. The main hardship that she faces in her life is lack of a hygienic latrine.

Nga hopes to improve her business with her profits. She also hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Mr. Sơn works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Sơn is 32 years old and he is married with 2 children.
Sơn lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Sơn has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Sơn faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine.He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Sơn hopes to travel for vacation within the country, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 26 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 1 school age child. 

Jesus is newly engaged just this year in a crab buying and selling business and earns approximately Php 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving monthly support from his sisters who are presently residing abroad. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing more kilos of crabs for resale. Jesus has become a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Jesus hopes to expand his new business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of crabs for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy more fruits needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elena dreams to have another fruit stand and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and find strength from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en:
Tito is 65 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 3 adult aged children. 

Tito is engaged in fishing activity for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also doing hog fattening and hog raising. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 sacks of feed for his pigs to be fattened. Tito has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Tito hopes to expand his hog fattening and hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of feed
